story:
Hello! We are Gurukitty Studios, we are independent comic creators/publishers and are the people who brought you the popular webcomic Daqueran and Hello, Albertosaurus. If you live in the Vancouver (BC) area you probably have seen us at one or more of the local conventions.

We have been making our rounds locally for about a year, promoting our comics and cute little products, but we have ambitious goals, so we’ve outgrown the local and small cons. We are ready to move east and try our luck at some of the awesome conventions the rest of Canada has to offer!

We are promoting a new anthology called Ghost Tales soon and we want to give the contributing artists all the exposure we can by taking the book to a bigger convention to get it the biggest audience possible.
So we are hoping we can count on you guys, our readers, fans, friends and random helpful people to help us reach our goal of going to Calgary Expo in 2012. The money will be used toward travel and hotel accommodations, as well as to cover any unexpected travel fees that might pop up (such as overweight bags filled with books to promote).

Of course, we will offer come perks for people who help us reach our goal and if you look to the side you will see a list of donation levels with prizes attached to each one. We don’t have a lot of money and we wish we could offer more, but we think the prizes are pretty nifty.
Adding to those prizes we will list all donors on a blog entry once the campaign is over with a huge thank you!

Thank you all for all your support!
Hope to see you at Calgary Expo!


Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help us reach our goal even if you don't have money, we really need help spreading the word, the more attention this campaign gets, the better chance we have of succeeding!

If you have Tumblr, Twitter, Facebook, deviantArt, blogs or any other social outlet online please use those tools to spread our campaign link!

story:
Short Summary

We are a Podcast. You'll never meet a group of misfits like us. Pull up a chair and have a beer while we talk Movies, Sports, Current Events, Video Games. All while we bust each others balls HAHA. Roll Call the 4 Mexicans you love to hate: Compton Eric, Joey Maximus, El Compadre & Tom Bomb. HELP US KEEP DOING WHAT WE DO! BE SURE TO LISTEN TO THE SHOW ON ITUNES, STITCHER RADIO, PODOMATIC & SOUNDCLOUD.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your HELP to continue doing what we do best. With your help we can buy better equipment, better beer, better mics & better podcasting situations 

  • Donate any amount, no amount is too little. Everything is very much appreciated.
  • We have many perks for example. Guest spots on show, shout outs, t-shirts, art pieces (by CPT Eric) 
  • The Funds will go to good use. As stated above. Thank you from the bottom of our Hearts

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's okay. There are many other ways you can help our cause. For example by:

  • Sharing our Facebook page to your friends, family or co-workers. 
  • Sharing this Donation Campaign with others. 
  • Remember to use the  Indiegogo share tool

THANK YOU ALL FOR THE SUPPORT!!! YOU ARE ALL AWESOME. BE SURE TO LISTEN TO THE SHOW ON ITUNES, STITCHER RADIO, PODOMATIC & SOUNDCLOUD.

story:
Would it be okay if we took cheesecake cartoons and funny sexy comics to the masses?  After working events for the last few years and speaking with over 2,000 people I learned how many people like and appreciate fun, humorous--and even sexy--art!  The odd thing is they just don't know where to look.  If they knew where to look, what if we made content free to them?

For my third book I thought this would be a great oppurtunity to get more adults reading comics and looking at cartoons.  How?  With sex appeal!  My original goal of this book was to be a 60+ page e-book but I still needed some resources to finish it.     That's why I'm doing this Indiegogo campaign and I'm making a 90+ page exclusive Indiegogo paperback edition available.  The Indiegogo edition of this book will be the ONLY print version of Adam Street's Big Important Sexy Lady Book. This is a great way for you to own an exclusive copy,  but more importantly to be a beacon of hope for those disadvantaged adults who could use some T&A in their life.   

Everyone who donates will get their name in the book for supporting the project.

1/4/14 Stretch goals

#1 If we reach $1,500, everyone gets an additional 20 page digital ashcan of sketches.

#2 At $2,000 I'll add 10 more pages to the book.

#3  At $3,000 I'll add 20 more pages to the book (30 all together).

story:
Hi, I’m Raymond Cuttill. I’m a 62 year old who has always dreamed of being a comedian. Basically I’ve done very little about it until now. I have done a few open mics and I could work my way up to the Edinburgh Fringe in a few years time but have I got the time? So at the last minute I decided to try to perform at the Edinburgh Fringe this coming month. It’s something I’ll remember the rest of my life (even if that’s only 2 weeks LOL). 

Now you may know the Scottish Referendum is on September 18th, shortly after the Fringe. Here the Scottish decide if they want to be independent of the United Kingdom, including of course England. Are we dragging them down? So I thought what about an English campaign for Scottish Independence? Are they dragging us down? Hence the campaign Independence for Scotland But We’ll Keep The Oil (lots of oil off Scotland). Or to put it another way Sod Off Scotland. So the campaign was born and where better to present but in Edinburgh in the heart of Scotland. I hope (I’m pretty sure) they’ve got a sense of humour (or humor) so that’s my dream. Go and perform. 

It’s such a quick decision that nothing’s been arranged so I’m going and plan to join in wherever anyone has dropped out or in compilation shows or even help out where I can.

I’m going to Edinburgh in my campervan. I need a small amount to live on and travel around Edinburgh and maybe do some promotion. I’m throwing caution to the winds and going to try it. I’ll be asking around about spare spots in the Fringe and I’ll be sending out press releases for the Sod Off Scotland campaign. I hope to lighten up the serious Scottish Independence debate. I may even do radio or TV interviews.

Help me fulfil my dream and I offer some perks, including Sod Off Scotland campaign mugs, T-shirts and a DVD of me performing. you can also help by liking my facebook pages

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Sod-Off-Scotland-LOL/745566008840734

and follow me on Twitter as I report my progress

https://twitter.com/RaymondComedy

So please help me I’ll send you love, Rieki distance healing and even jokes and maybe a perk.

Raymond Cuttill

Comedian

Chief Sassenach, Sod Off Scotland LOL (But We’ll Keep the Oil)

story:
Dark Champion Shader is a comic by Carey Anderson inspired by the Tokusatsu shows such as Super Sentai and Kamen Rider. This campaign will fund the first three issues of Dark Champion Shader to be published. 

STORY

Shader is the story of film student Daniel Vann who is caught up in a war he never saw coming. Daniel held on to a super suit he didn't know he had until an assassin tried to take it from him. The suit then gave Daniel the power to defend himself from his attackers but that was only the beginning.

Sounds good? Then Check it out Here 

http://theduckwebcomics.com/Dark_Champion_Shader/

 FINANCES

So where is the money going? Well for the Most part to the book.

$450 will go to the books and get me about 270ish books

$50 will go to Shipping costs

$50 will go to me for some lunch cause I'm hungry.

STRETCH GOALS

$550 First three issues Funded

$770 Color Covers for all three issues

$1100 Trade Paperback collection of the first FOUR chapters of Shader

$2200 A Dedicated Website for Shader

REWARDS

What's any super hero without Merchandise?

  • Three Chapters of comics
  • Three Button pins
  • Ten Stickers
  • Two different Sized Plushies
  • A paper Action Figure!

story:
The news is still coming in: the Details are still filtering through. We have been struck by the magnitude of the devastation that Typhoon Haiyan has brought upon the Philippines. Together with creators from all over the globe we are donating our talents to create an anthology. Our goal is to raise money for the relief and response efforts in the aftermath of super typhoon Haiyan.



When the category-5 super typhoon Haiyan made landfall in the Philippines on Friday the 8th of November 2013, with speeds ranging from 190-195 mph, it achieved the rank of the strongest storm to ever make landfall. Typhoon’s Nancy, Violet and Ida all generated speeds in excess of 200 mph while out at sea but slowed prior to encountering land. Haiyan is the second category 5 typhoon to hit the Philippines in 2013, following on from typhoon Usagi in September.

Allied with the destructive power of the winds, the storm surge of a typhoon often causes extensive damage. Despite the extreme nature of the winds during Haiyan, the storm surge contributed most to the destruction and loss of life. The worst area of the Philippines to suffer from the storm surge was Tacloban City, where the surge rose to a height of 2.3m, destroying vast swathes of property and devastating the population. Prior to the typhoon 220,000 people resided in Tacloban City.


Whilst the international relief effort has pledged money and assistance, the efforts have been hampered by the sheer scope of the destruction to the infrastructure to the country and the slow mobilisation of aid by the government. The United Nations estimates that presently 2.5 million people desperately require aid, with reports of hunger and thirst widespread amongst survivors.



The Haiyan Benefit Anthology is the result of a collaboration of independent comic book creators from around the world who wanted to help raise awareness and funds for those affected by Typhoon Haiyan.

The comic book creators whose work will be featured in this anthology and art book all came together through various Facebook groups which act as a nexus point for international creatives to collaborate and educate eachother to form a working community of like minded individuals.


The Haiyan Benefit anthology is the brainchild of comic writer Phil Woodward. The idea was to bring together comic creators from all over the globe to produce 150 colour pages of monsters and myths from Filipino folklore.

This collection of stories includes work many published creators all of whom have given up their time and talents free of charge to raise money for those affected by the Haiyan disaster.

The covers featured in this campaign are only demo covers,  real covers 

will be revealed upon completion of project

Work has begun and below are a couple of examples of whats to come

By Jane Straw

By Frank Agness


The art book will feature pages of art based on the same myths and legends as the anthology and will be in full colour.



It will feature talented artists from all over the globe and will contain various styles not confined to comic art.

We have already begun work on producing some imagery and below is our first couple of finished pin-ups.  

1) Sarangay:  Pencils and Inks by Graeme Howard with Colours by Lancelot Catan.

2) Serina: art work by Tek Tan

By Mick Abbath


The sketch book will feature pages of concept work and sketches from both anthology and art book and will be a special extra item at higher packages.  It will feature talented artists from all over the globe and will contain various styles not confined to comic art.


As part of the set it shows the base building blocks for some mesmerizing art work.

Here are some examples of sketches that will be in the book

By Craig Sherbert

By Frank Agness


Philippine mythology includes a collection of tales and superstitions about magical creatures and entities. Some Filipinos, even though heavily Christianized, still believe in these tales. The prevalence of belief in the figures of Philippines mythology is strong in the provinces.

Because the country has many islands and is inhabited by different ethnic groups, Philippine mythology and superstitions are very diverse. However, certain similarities exist among these groups, such as the belief in Heaven (kaluwalhatian, kalangitan, kamurawayan), Hell (impiyerno, kasamaan), and the human soul (kaluluwa).


The stories of ancient Philippine mythology include deities, creation stories, mythical creatures, and beliefs. Ancient Philippine mythology varies among the many indigenous tribes of the Philippines. Some groups during the pre-Spanish conquest era believed in a single Supreme Being who created the world and everything in it, while others chose to worship a multitude of tree and forest deities (diwatas). 

                                

         

upgrade your pledge with one of the heroic and Legendary perks

All printed material does not include shipping, please see table attached and add the relevant amount to your pledge.

 

All prints will ship with books unless bought as an additional item with the digital pledges.

Once the time comes to start shipping, a survey will be sent out asking for your current address. At any time before we ship your pledge, you can contact Phil or through the fan page.

The above shipping costs are only estimated costs and we may require you to alter you shipping fee if we have under calculated cost.


The talent involved in bringing this project to life have all been working in the indie comic scene for many years and below are some examples of previous published works.



     




The 300-mile wide typhoon – locally known as Yolanda – has left a trail of destruction with thousands feared dead. The full extent of the damage will become clearer in the weeks to come as rescue teams reach the more remote areas.

Philippine Red Cross volunteers have been on the ground since before the storm hit, helping with evacuation plans and warning communities. Now, they are getting aid to the people who are most in need and preparing to help thousands more


Even before the typhoon Yolanda entered Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR), food and non-food items were already prepositioned in PRC Cebu Regional Warehouse consisting of 2,000 tins of ready to eat food, 4,000 blankets, 4,000 plastic mats, 2,000 hygiene kits, 2,000 jerry cans, 10 units of health emergency tents and 5,000 of food and non-food items with support from the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

Once printing costs and shipping have been deducted from the fund, all proceeds from the Anthology will then go to the Philippine Red Cross who will determine the best allocation to resident victims impacted by the event. 

(For more information about the Philippine Red Cross and other ways to contribute.)

This is a not-for-profit endeavor. All creative effort, art, design, editorial and managerial contributions made in the creation of this anthology were donated by those involved.


If you're unable to donate or want to do more to help the goal of the team behind the anthology then please share this with friends and family of whom may be able to help

Alternatively you can visit our Facebook fan page and keep up to date with production and information that will be posted regularly on the page.

 

On behalf of the team i would like to express our gratitude for not only supporting this project but for helping us make a difference, remembering those who have died and bringing hope to those now faced with the aftermath of this tragedy.

                              


There are no major risk factors. This project is my team and my primary objective! Most of us are freelance artist and writers so we have huge amounts of time on our hands. Everyone is on board! My team and I are very diligent and determined to finish this project even if we don't reach our pledge

All digital versions of the novel will be sent as soon as it is finished while anyone wanting a printed version will have to wait for a period of at least 3 months in order for us to ensure it is printed at its best and that everyone receives a quality product.

story:
Gods of War, Demi and Kya take up arms as the Pæcekeepers to become the line of defence the world has from itself!

New to the scene comic writer N.S Kane makes her debut to the comic world with the adventure of Pæcekeepers. Two girls bonded together by the spirits of ancient Egyptian Gods take up their right as supreme warriors to protect the world.  This Indiegogo is to raise money for the first issue of the series. 

Once human, these champion women are now something far more extraordinary for the future of mankind. The military sect called the D.O.S.A or the Department Of Special Advances, have brought back the lives of the old Gods from ancient mythology, creating a force of Pæcekeepers that are about to change the world. Kya spawned from the Goddess Nut and Demetria spawned from the God Geb, are the two successful “trials” subjects. The two have been the only surviving subjects to advance past the “trails” as soul mate twins. The two have an extreme physic connection and after being altered and injected with the powers from the gods, they are not as strong as they appear. The two ladies are both extremely beautiful and embody the ideal warrior, when they step onto a battle field the enemy looks up in awe of them as they are bred to be heroes from another time.

The comic fuses both ancient and modern times together giving the reader a surreal but connected twist to these characters. With 16 pages of sheer beauty in full glossy colour, this will be the first issue in the long spanning journey of Pæcekeepers.

With rewards from both the artist and the writer, the project is determined to get off the ground and leap into success thanks to the illustrative collaboration of Matt Lao and his exceptional work. He is a San Francisco based comic book artist and Illustrator, offering services for the film, television, publishing and entertainment industries.

To find updates, contests, and more follow us on social media.

www.facebook.com/N.S.Kanecomics

www.facebook.com/pages/Matthew-Lao-Illustrations

www.mattlao.com/

PRINT REWARDS


 Special thank you for the fan art provided by Omareiden Mgs. Check out more of his work and drawing videos: www.facebook.com/pages/The-art-of-omareiden

Gods of War, Demi and Kya take up arms as the Pæcekeepers
to become the line of defence the world has from itself! New to the scene comic writer N.S Kane makes her debut
to the comic world with the adventure of Pæcekeepers. Two girls bonded together
by the spirits of ancient Egyptian Gods take up their right as supreme warriors
to protect the world.  This Indiegogo is to raise money for the first issue of the series.  Once human, these champion women are now something far
more extraordinary for the future of mankind. The military sect called the
D.O.S.A or the Department Of Special Advances, have brought back the lives of
the old Gods from ancient mythology, creating a force of Pæcekeepers that are
about to change the world. Kya spawned from the Goddess Nut and Demetria
spawned from the God Geb, are the two successful “trials” subjects. The two
have been the only surviving subjects to advance past the “trails” as soul mate
twins. The two have an extreme physic connection and after being altered and
injected with the powers from the gods, they are not as strong as they appear.
The two ladies are both extremely beautiful and embody the ideal warrior, when
they step onto a battle field the enemy looks up in awe of them as they are
bred to be heroes from another time. 
The comic fuses both ancient and modern times together
giving the reader a surreal but connected twist to these characters. With 16

story:
Short Summary

My name is Veronica Divine, and I'm a published erotica author with an astonishingly loyal following in the genre of size-oriented fiction. 

While I work hard to create a picture in the mind of all my creators, some scenes are just better rendered with the hand of a talented artist, and my co-conspirator DevilHS is extremely talented. Of course, he won't work for free, so the purpose of this campagin is to raise the necessary funds to pay the man!

My gratitude in advance to anyone willing to offer their support in this endeavor, 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to create as big a graphic novel as possible with a minimum of ten pages. He will require a thousand dollars to meet that criteria. While all contributions are welcome, those donating more will get a controlling voice in just what kind of comic we put out, whether based on my existing works, or a new original piece designed just for the visual format.

This is not a soft-funding effort; if we meet the goal, all funding will be used to make the book, if we fall short, no funds will be collected.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know a little about comic scripting, but I may ultimately have need for someone to help with lettering and compilation. If you have these kinds of skills, please let me know!

Please share this project's link with any and all fans of well-written, beautifully illustrated adult content.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a 17 year old digital artist based in England and my passion is creating manga pages.

This is important to me because I want to become a successful manga artist along side game designer and illustrator in the future. I want to put all my time in to it, and hopefully create 15-30 successful chapters.

You will help me achieve the push I need to finish it, because it'll give me more that enough reason than what I already have. It's hard for me to do things unless I have that push I need because I suffer from depression which takes most of my motivation away.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

I don't mind how much money I gain from this, but because I wish to put all of my time into this instead of a job, I need a little money to  get some better equipment for drawing and also help out my mum, I want to show her I can get somewhere.


With your help I will give out certain rewards depending on the money you give me.

That includes: Being the first to read my manga. For example you'll be the first to know. Exclusive sketch designs, illustrations of character designs and last but not least for certain people, I fully coloured portrait image of one of the characters from my manga series.

I will give them to my mum as a thank-you gift for being so supportive of me.

The Impact

It not be valuable to you or the world in a helpful way, but I promise to make it as interesting as I can. 

Zenka is  an other worldly human who raises a child she finds crying in a bush, of to whom she names Zenka. To her Zenka means 'Peace Protector'. She trains Zenka from the age 8 till the age 16, before being taken one night, leaving it to Zenka to find her and save her. He faces many unpleasant challenges.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

It'll be difficult as I have college and must complete course work that can sometimes require all my time as well. I can get distracted quite easily making my progress slow, but I can work around that.

I will set certain days where I'll work on the comic for hours straight and other days I'll work on it for 1 hour-2 hours.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

It would be helpful if you could share this campaign with other manga lovers and story lovers, I'd be so much more grateful.


Use the indiegogo share tools and share this with your friends please ! :3

story:
CHE COS'È AGENZIA INCANTESIMI?

Agenzia Incantesimi è una serie a fumetti pubblicata gratuitamente  sull'omonima pagina (ma prossimamente si trasferirà sul sito di Verticalismi). Ne sono protagoniste Jasmine e Myriam, due ragazze che, grazie ai loro poteri magici (la prima è una potente maga, la seconda è figlia della regina del Popolo Fatato), indagano su tutti quei casi in cui sia coinvolta la magia.

Le nostre due protagoniste vivono infatti in un mondo in cui esiste la magia e tutta una serie di creature fantastiche come elfi, orchi, fate e altri ancora camminano tranquillamente in mezzo a noi. Un po' come se la Terra di Mezzo o Faerun fossero stati il nostro mondo durante il Medioevo, insomma.

LA STORIA

In questa divertente avventura, Myriam viene inviata in missione su una piccola isola greca dove gli uomini sono stati rapiti da un branco di feroci sirene.

Eccovi le prime cinque vignette. Per leggere il resto, sapete che cosa fare!


DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO

Oltre a corrispondere a Francesca Follini il giusto compenso per il suo (davvero splendido) lavoro, abbiamo un obiettivo leggermente più ambizioso, questa volta. La storia è infatti nata (ed è stata realizzata di conseguenza) per diventare un video semi-animato (per chi ha superato una certa età, intendiamo un'animazione stile il vecchio Supergulp, solo aggiornata ai tempi odierni: potete trovare molti esempi analoghi in rete). Il video, che verrà messo su Youtube nel 2016, sarà in inglese e servirà da "trailer" per la versione internazionale della serie, che partirà nello stesso anno.

Per quanto riguarda la cifra necessaria, sarà così suddivisa: 300€ andranno come compenso a Francesca per il suo lavoro. 200€ saranno invece destinati a coprire i costi dell'animazione del video. Gli altri 100€, infine, copriranno le percentuali di Indiegogo,di Paypal ed altre ed eventuali.

Tutto quel che arriverà in più verrà spartito fra gli autori o, se si presenterà l'occasione, sarà impiegato per ulteriori iniziative legate al video o ad Agenzia Incantesimi.

PERCHE' DOVRESTE AIUTARCI?

E' presto detto: questa storia è destinata al video promozionale e non verrà quindi pubblicata sulla pagina di Agenzia Incantesimi. Ma chiunque contribuirà con 3 euro o più riceverà via mail, immediatamente alla scadenza della campagna, un pdf con la storia in Italiano. Sarà quindi l'unica possibilità non solo di leggere la storia nella nostra lingua, ma comunque la sola opportunità di poterla ammirare prima dell'uscita del video, il prossimo anno.

ALTRI MODI IN CUI POTETE AIUTARCI

A parte contribuire al finanziamento, potete aiutarci diffondendo questa campagna fra i vostri contatti o attraverso le vostre pagine. Anche solo per questo noi ve ne saremo grati!


SHORT VERSION FOR ENGLISH READERS

We are preparing a video for the upcoming (next year) version of Enchatment Agency, a modern fantasy free webcomic illustrated by many Italian artists. We are collecting money to pay the animation of the short story "The men-eaters". Those who will kindly contribute will receive a pdf version (sent by mail) of the comic in English, so they'll be able to read the story many months before its publication. 

Here you are the perks:

1€: our thanks!

5€: pdf version of the story, English text.

10€: pdf version of the story, high definition pin-up of the fairy

15€: pdf version of the story, high definition pin-up of the fairy, exclusive sexy pinup (jpeg version)

20€: pdf version of the story, high definition pin-up of the fairy, exclusive sexy pinup (jpeg version), your name in the video end credits (section: special thanks).

50€: pdf version of the story, high definition pin-up of the fairy, exclusive sexy pinup (jpeg version), your name in the video end credits (section: special thanks), an original watercolor by Francesca Follini (shipping included).


THE BEGINNING OF THE STORY

Just a preview for you. If you want to read the whole story, you know what to do!

story:
12 stories depicting 12 Black people connected across different points of time and space intersecting along a multiverse where a Black cyborg that wouldn't have been forged without their attempts tries to escape an Earth doomed to a red giant sun in search of an eons old question, "What happened to the humans?". Eventually leading the cyborg on a multigalactic, multiuniversal thriller that began with a decoded number sent from another universe.. #27.


"What if a number linked humans across different points of time and space no matter their distances? like particles within a quantum mechanical universe paired across vast distances.. could humans be capable of entering a state of consciousness aided by technology that allows them to pair with other instances of themselves, and perhaps even share information?"

I wanted to create an indiegogo for my comic book ‘Story of 27’ because I'd need enough to make and distribute the comic book, which would be 12 issues plus a 13th issue tying it together all within the same multiverse just taking place in different timelines and universes with tones of afrofuturism and decolonialization. I'd also like to put together a 30 min (maybe longer if possible) animation short that ties with the digital issues I'd also distribute. It’s a lot of work and money and time I don’t have and can’t afford because I gotto focus on getting the bills paid. but with enough funding I could have time freed and money to get this going and put this wonderful mindscrew of a story out there for the world. I think it's a story worth telling, will you help you help me tell it?

I think it's a story worth telling, will you help you help me tell it?

story:
THE BEGINNING: FIRST TERM

In 2018, writer Mark Pellegrini and artist Timothy Lim (with additional colors by Brett R. Smith) launched their first fully illustrated comic book through Antarctic Press, which went on to 7 printings. The political parody introduced the world to WALL-MIGHT and MIGHT-FENCE , borrowing heavily -- and spoofing -- from anime and manga influences.

Intended to be a one-and-done project, Pellegrini and Lim found themselves returning to the idea of a sequel after numerous reprints and a persistent audience demanded to continue the story.

And this brings us to our second part!

FIRST TERM: PART II

WALL-MIGHT: First Term, Part II spoofs the current comic book industry and introduces a new assembly of characters as they take on the Deep State's newest, deadliest emissary: BURNING SANDERS.

Together with his Youth Resistance, he intends to take Wall-Might and his companions out for good!

Wall-Might will have some added help this time around -- including the high-flying Warhen, the plush-peacekeeper Marmot Maiden, and more!

We currently have a strong interest from publishers for the sequel, but only in a standard 32 page format and predicated on a demonstrable customer demand. It is our hope that a successful campaign will mean that the shorter version can be viable for local comic book stores!

The version that we are offering to IndieGoGo backers is our ultimate realization of the book, a 40-page jammed-packed action comedy with a very great, tremendous wrap around cover.

So good, everyone agrees, it's the best. The best.

Here's what you'll get!

  • Wrap-around exclusive homage cover by Timothy Lim with colors by Brett R. Smith
  • The 32 page story PLUS the bonus story, WALL-MIGHT GAIDEN
  • Concept sketches and supplemental material by Matthew Weldon (Punchline)

WINNING!

Our campaign goal accounts for the following factors:

  • Printing a limited number of books so that the sequel can satisfy those asking for it
  • Pay Mark Pellegrini and Timothy Lim for the work completed
  • Pay Mark Pellegrini and Timothy Lim to finish Wall-Might Gaiden exclusively for this book
  • Compensate Brett R. Smith and Matthew Weldon for their contribution
  • Demonstrate a desire for the book to be available later at local comic stores
  • Cover the cost of fulfillment

Above: Standard cover. With our goal, we can print the wrap-around cover!

Above: Original chibi art and WARHEN concept art by Matthew Weldon!

WALL-MIGHT GAIDEN

What will set this book apart from potential future printings or store editions if we meet our goal are the wrap-around cover and the addition of the backup story, Wall-Might Gaiden, a prequel that looks at Wall-Might's rise to power. The funding will help us complete the story and include it in the book!

GOALS

Due to our success on other works in 2018 -- BLACK HOPS: USA-*-GI, RED ROOSTER, and TRUMP'S SPACE FORCE -- we are able to pass the savings on to the reader by offering a limited edition book that is at a lower price point than other works have been in the past. We also learned from other campaigns and have decided to keep this campaign as simple as possible.

Our stretch goals are basic:

  • Gold foil printing on cardstock for the wraparound cover
  • Upgrade the interior paper to a high gloss
  • WIN

story:
Who The Heck Are You And What's This All About?

My name is Sebastian Lamoreaux, and I'm a small-time Writer living in the Pacific Northwest. I want you to think about comic books, or more specifically, Graphic Novels, for a moment. Think of some of your favorites. Now, imagine how hard they must have worked to get that specific comic published. Imagine how they had to fight, and how much money and time it took.

While I've got the effort and the time handled, I come to all of you to ask you, sincerely, for funding to help me achieve my dream.

The premise of the graphic novel, while not giving too much away, is more or less the story of a man named Jonathan Lyudoed and the people he surrounds himself with, from his Freshman Year in High School all the way until he's a successful, married man running his very own company. Of course, the place he grew up and spent most of his time with, isn't exactly what you'd call a normal little city. It's a place called The Narrows, and let's just say, doing his homework and passing his tests were the least of his worries.

Okay, Sounds Good. Now What's The Money Going Towards, Really?

Specifically speaking, the funds are mostly going towards the illustrator, Shea Vorbach, to compensate for the mountain of work she's going to have to do in order to bring this thing to life. On a smaller scale, though, funds will also go towards art tools, work-station upgrades, and the resources to print out actual copies to send to publishers and, perhaps, some of you lovely people!

Now, what does this mean for you? I'm glad you asked. If you're a fan of the idea of this horror graphic novel, which I imagine you must be if you're contributing, all of the perks will be directed towards giving you pieces of history in the creation of this book, or even a signed copy of the graphic novel itself! There'll be a wide range of contribution options, so even if you don't have much to give, there'll be an option and a special way for me to thank you!

Now, if I don't reach my goal, which, let's face it, is a possibility, I'm going to get as much done as I can, as mentioned in the first paragraph. It's no huge deal if I don't get every last penny. My parents taught me how to make money last, so every little bit you folks contribute helps, big time!

Warm Fuzzy Mode: Activated

Alright, let's get sincere for a minute. I usually don't like to get too touchy-feely with strangers, but I figure if you're considering giving me money, that gives you the right to poke my brain. The Sporting Life is the first, well, anything I've ever written (although by no means the last) and it has an incredibly special and meaningful place in my heart.

I began writing it when I was 18 years old, shortly after my birthday in December, when I was suffering from intense panic attacks and Depersonalization Disorder. I was having a rough go of it, and struggling with my classes. The idea formed in my head about someone feeling as though they are not real, or some manner of surreal-like feeling in day to day life, and that's when the character of Jonathan Lyudoed was formed. From there, you can probably guess the rest. I wrote the rough draft in about a year and a half, and at the age of 20, my Girlfriend (who is also the illustrator of this novel, the lovely and talented Shea Vorbach) urged me to seek publishing, as in her opinion, it was pretty good. I spent about a year trying to pitch it to literary agents and publishers, and I always got one thing in common from all of them: It would work better in a visual format. They described the characters and settings as being so visceral that they would prefer it in a more visual format, and so that's when I proposed the idea for this project to Shea, and she was on board!

I'll be honest with you, it's been a little rough for me. The idea of not being able to achieve my dreams that I've worked so hard on and held in my heart for so long is absolutely nightmarish. I'm not exaggerating when I say I'd rather die than give up on being a writer. I know that, to you guys/gals/insert pronoun of choice here, I'm just some stranger on the internet begging for money, and I don't blame you for thinking that. Really. I've thought the same thing about similar projects. However, there's something... that changes you, when you feel hopeless and that you have no future. It's a real kick in the pants. I intend to fight tooth and nail to realize my dreams, and if you believe in me the way I believe in myself, you're more than welcome to help.

It'll Be A Bumpy Road

I'm not going to lie to all of you. Even if I reach my goal, there's a possibility that it won't get published. There's the reality that, even in the end, we'll fail. However, in times where these thoughts are in my head, a saying pops into my brain,

"If you tell me it's wrong to hope, I'll tell you you're wrong, every time."

That's the key. Leaving my fate in the hands of a complete stranger is scary to me. I hope you'll understand why. In life, though, we can't let fear rule us. We can't let the risk of failure get us down. We have to keep hope in our hearts, and always look to the stars, reaching out for each and every goal we have in life.

I can promise you that I'm not going to be wasting or throwing this money away. I can promise you that I believe in this project, and that I'll do anything to see it through.

I can promise you that, together, we can all get this funded and published.

    What If I'm Broke?

    Don't worry, I can sympathize. I'm a real starving artist type, and so is my Girlfriend, so I know what it's like to not have a ton of money to spare, even if you'd like to give. If you can't afford to give anything to me, no hard feelings whatsoever. I don't want you to feel pressured or guilty. If you'd like to help me in a way unrelated to money, perhaps you could help spread word of this around?

    If we're being honest, I don't want to get published to be rich. Hell, I don't even want to be published to be famous. I want to be published to be recognized, and to share my ideas with the world. If you can help me and spread the word, that'll mean more to me than words can describe.
story_txt: Who The Heck Are You And What's This All About? My name is Sebastian Lamoreaux, and I'm a small-time Writer living in the Pacific Northwest. I want you to think about comic books, or more specifically, Graphic Novels, for a moment. Think of some of your favorites. Now, imagine how hard they must have worked to get that specific comic published. Imagine how they had to fight, and how much money and time it took.While I've got the effort and the time handled, I come to all of you to ask you, sincerely, for funding to help me achieve my dream.The premise of the graphic novel, while not giving too much away, is more or less the story of a man named Jonathan Lyudoed and the people he surrounds himself with, from his Freshman Year in High School all the way until he's a successful, married man running his very own company. Of course, the place he grew up and spent most of his time with, isn't exactly what you'd call a normal little city. It's a place called The Narrows, and let's just say, doing his homework and passing his tests were the least of his worries.Okay, Sounds Good. Now What's The Money Going Towards, Really? Specifically speaking, the funds are mostly going towards the illustrator, Shea Vorbach, to compensate for the mountain of work she's going to have to do in order to bring this thing to life. On a smaller scale, though, funds will also go towards art tools, work-station upgrades, and the resources to print out actual copies to send to publishers and, perhaps, some of you lovely people!Now, what does this mean for you? story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan J Hodge. I’m a science fiction author, a huge fan of comics, and I’m marrying those passions with this graphic novel adaptation of my debut work, Wounded Worlds: Nihil Novum. Wounded Worlds is a fantastic military Sci-Fi tale full of compelling characters, stirring drama, and gut-wrenching moral quandaries.

I’m launching this campaign because this story is best told in a visual medium. With your help, we’ll do just that. This is NOT the same stale, recycled alien invasion story you’ve seen over and over. This is about characters from both sides of the conflict finding each other and whether they can reconcile what they’ve done; both to themselves and each other.

If you’re still not convinced, Issue #1 is already available (as of 4/15)! Just visit ryanjhodgeauthor.com and judge for yourself what I’ve accomplished so far with my own investment.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding this project will make Issue #2 (and subsequent issues, depending on success) possible. Included in the budget will be artist fees, marketing fund, perk distribution, and dispensation for myself to allow time off work for labor on this and other Issues (not to exceed 20% of total contributions).

A contribution of any amount will get you a PDF copy of Wounded Worlds: Nihil Novum (the novel).

$10+ will get you access to the Issue 2 Launch Day Live-Stream where you will be able to directly chat with me about Wounded Worlds and other projects.

$25+ will grant you a comiXology redemption code for Issues 1 & 2 (when completed)

$40+ will grant you permanent access to the Launch Day Live-Streams for all subsequent issues. You will also be credited as a Major Contributor in Issue #2 and all subsequent issues.

$100+ will get you all of the above plus a signed Wounded Worlds T-Shirt of your choosing from yours truly (US Residents only).

If the posted goal is not met; your contribution will not go to waste. Issue #2 WILL come out (but it will come out faster if it’s funded).

The Impact

There’s a lot of stale air floating around the SciFi genre. My mission is to inject a bit of fresher atmosphere and that mission is not contingent on the success of this campaign. I already offer an illustrated SciFi adventure on my website (ryanjhodgeauthor.com) for free. I’ve got stories to tell and that’s exactly what I’m going to do. With your help, I’ll tell a lot more.

Risks & Challenges

Risks are minimal. I’ve already produced a couple novels and a single issue so far, so I’m familiar with the challenges of production and I have the discipline to finish difficult projects.

The biggest danger is that we’ll run out of funding before we run out of story. However, what has already been produced will continue to be extant; whether it’s three issues or thirteen, and increased visibility will mean increased purchases which means that the project may become self-sufficient at some point.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about this Campaign, of course, and you can visit ryanjhodgeauthor.com. Buy a tee or a hoodie to show some love for Wounded Worlds, check out my other stories, or just let the people of the interwebs know that you think this is a worthy project.

However you choose to help; thank you.

story:
THE BOOK OF RUTH

I have been blessed over the course of my career to have written stories for some of the comic industry's most iconic female characters, including Wonder Woman, Catwoman, Rose, Xena, Age of Conan: Valeria, and The Little Mermaid.  But there is something special about the story of Ruth. 

Ruth's tale chronicles one family's journey from poverty, to abundance, into poverty again, and then back to abundance.  But it is the central character of Ruth that makes this story so compelling.  Widowed as a young woman, Ruth makes the choice to leave behind everything she knows and follow her bereaved mother-in-law to Bethlehem.  While Naomi rails against God for his seeming abandonment of her family, Ruth holds only a quiet, and sincere faith that God, who she has come to know and love, has a plan.  It is her courage and unwaivering faith that shine like a beacon for all who feel lost.  Especially a retired soldier turned farmer named Boaz. 

One of the Bible's most beautiful love stories, this 112 page graphic novel, retelling of The Book of Ruth, set during the Great Depression, is the story of one woman's journey of faith and love as you've never seen it before. Join Noami, Ruth, and Boaz in the a little town called Bethlehem, Texas, as they struggle to overcome sickness, death and bankruptcy, and discover sometimes all you really need to have is faith.

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page one

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page two

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page three

THE BOOK OF RUTH - pages four & five

THE BOOK OF RUTH  - page six

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page seven

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page eight

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page nine

THE BOOK OF RUTH  - page ten

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page eleven

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page twelve

THE BOOK OF RUTH - page thirteen

At the time of launch there were two pages of interior artwork left to be completed.

story:
Your Investment - Our Growth


Shira and I have a dream we are putting into action.  Our successful talk show is busting at the seams with growth and it's time to embrace this growth.

We are in the process of expanding our model and launching the talk show into a daily two hour “drive time” national syndication on stations throughout the country and/or SIRUS XM Satellite Radio.

We are attracting people who have an investment mindset. Our new L.A. radio talk show, “Trending Topics w/Ant&Shira" is blazing the airwaves to give you full access to the world of Hollywood…Indie-style.”

Your contribution will support marketing for the show’s future revenue-generating syndication; production staff and employee salary; DVD/CD for our comedy series entitled “On Fire w/Ant aka "Big Quarter LBer”; seminars, events and workshops to showcase strategies for establishing yourself in Hollywood as an actor, producer, screenwriter, director, and filmmaker, facilitated by ShiraNicole and friends (A-list actors, producers, screenwriters, filmmakers, etc).

For further details please respond with any questions, by contacting us:

Anthony L. Smith & ShiraNicole
Producer/Film maker/Radio Personality/Comedian
trendingtopics@dramaticimpactproductions.com
www.LATalkRadio.com/Topics.php

619-358-5691 cell
310-658-2261 office

story:
Examine the Life of a Space-Age Novelty

MEET BORIS—the robot programmed for fun and leisure!

BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE merges past, present and future in a nostalgic tale full of innocence and imagination and experiments with the graphic novel form through juxtaposition of hand drawn illustrations and vector graphics, minimal use of dialogue or narration and vivid full-colour panels set on a dark gray background. BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE becomes almost cinematic at times, making the experience akin to reading a silent film.

BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE began as a series in 2010, with each installment focused on a singular challenge and resolution including dashed expectations, loneliness, interpersonal conflict and purpose in life. The dark themes of the story are offset by absurd and whimsical situations. Readers take delight in this deceptively simple story full of humanity and wonder. ROBOT OF LEISURE is still available in its original serial format for digital editions, while the Complete Series, which wrapped in late 2012, has been combined into a single 230-page paperback.



BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE is completely self-published by artist Katharine Miller under the imprint of Grawlix Interrobang. The project has been entirely self-funded until now. Funds raised through Indiegogo will cover printing, shipping, and marketing materials serving the ROBOT OF LEISURE brand. Any additional funding received will be put toward a book launch/tour, convention fees, or other ROBOT OF LEISURE promotional needs and appearances.

Katharine Miller is the sole entity behind ROBOT OF LEISURE. She spent her childhood gazing out of car windows and taking notice of abandoned storefronts and distended roadside attractions and wondering what became of the characters inside. Katharine created Boris in 2003 as the face of WHiRR, a line of robot-themed paper goods and handmade crafts. She has been dedicated to Robot of Leisure story development since 2006 and continues to find new situations and stories for her naïve little robot. Katharine's other works include two non-fiction humour books 30 Failures by Age 30 and The Curable Romantic: Advice for the Romance-Impaired.

What We Need

The graphic novel is complete and ready to be enjoyed by you and readers like you.

We're asking for $2500 to pay for a limited print run of 100 copies of BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE in a brilliant full-color paperback edition, including shipping and marketing costs.

Smaller donations receive ebooks and smaller perks. Larger donations will receive the print edition plus more exclusive perks.

To have 100 full-color paperback printed and shipped to my address costs about $1820. It's estimated that Indiegogo fees could run up to $225, roughly 9% of funds raised. The remaining $455 we're asking goes towards shipping these books (and perks) to donors and other interested parties.

Here's a handy graph to demonstrate how the money gets used.

What You Get

Everyone gets something!

Give $1 (or more!) and you'll be automatically signed up to receive updates on this campaign, which means you will be first to know when new fundraising freebies are "unlocked," news about the book and Boris, and sneak peeks into the making of BORIS Robot of Leisure.

Donate $5 and you will receive digital editions (ebooks) of the first three (3) installments of the ROBOT OF LEISURE series (Boris and the Open House, Boris Makes a Friend, and Boris Gets a Visitor). Every level beyond that gets ALL of the ebooks from the ROBOT OF LEISURE series in the format that best suits their electronic reading device.

At various levels of support, donors will receive:

  • boxed holiday cards or party invitations
  • limited edition Robot of Leisure magnet
  • Robot of Leisure 1" buttons
  • limited edition plastic Boris keychain
  • art prints
  • an original drawing of Boris in the costume or activity of your choosing
  • limited edition products from the 2005-2007 WHiRR/Robot of Leisure era (lightswitch plates, magnets, stationery, etc.)
  • one-of-a-kind felt Boris toy

If the $2500 funding goal is NOT met, we'll use the collected funds to fulfill the existing orders and perks. No one leaves here emptyhanded.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on dough but long on love for Boris? Please help spread the word about this campaign and ROBOT OF LEISURE around your various social networks. Every little tweet, email, Tumblr/blog post, and Facebook share will go a long way towards getting Boris the love he deserves.

    "Like" on Facebook

     Watch Trailers on Vimeo

     Robot of Leisure Blog

     Subscribe to Mailing List

Share our links and reward yourself with all the fabulous freebies already available at the ROBOT OF LEISURE site.

www.robotofleisure.com

The official website for BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE offers generous previews of the entire series, with a full free download of the first installment BORIS AND THE OPEN HOUSE. Visitors to the website can also download digital wallpaper and icons, watch promotional videos, and catch up on Boris’s blog projects BORIS 366 and 52 Weeks of Leisure.

an original drawing of Boris in the costume or activity of your choosing
limited edition products from the 2005-2007 WHiRR/Robot of Leisure era (lightswitch plates, magnets, stationery, etc.)
one-of-a-kind felt Boris toy
If the $2500 funding goal is NOT met, we'll use the collected funds to fulfill the existing orders and perks. No one leaves here emptyhanded.
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Short on dough but long on love for Boris? Please help spread the word about this campaign and ROBOT OF LEISURE around your various social networks. Every little tweet, email, Tumblr/blog post, and Facebook share will go a long way towards getting Boris the love he deserves.
     "Like" on Facebook
     Watch Trailers on Vimeo
     Robot of Leisure Blog
     Subscribe to Mailing List
Share our links and reward yourself with all the fabulous freebies already available at the ROBOT OF LEISURE site.
www.robotofleisure.com
The official website for BORIS: ROBOT OF LEISURE offers generous previews of the entire series, with a full free download of the first installment BORIS AND THE OPEN HOUSE. Visitors to the website can also download digital wallpaper and icons, watch promotional videos, and catch up on Boris’s blog projects BORIS 366 and 52 Weeks of Leisure.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Gang,


Thanks for looking at my project first of all. For those that don't know me, my name is Carlo Velasquez. I've been a fan of comics most of my life, and throughout my love of comics, roleplaying, gaming, general geekdom, I've always had these stories waiting to get out, whether it was work, moving to a new town, heartbreak, waiting to get better at drawing, trying to make it in music, to distract me, these stories still called out to be told. Thanks to sites like Indieagogo, it really was a no brainer to just go ahead and tell my tales!

With the help of a Fantastic artist Mr. Lee Borden Smith, my dream might actually be realized. And with your help I hope to share my dream with you!! This dream is to publish my stories in a serial comic book form, and maybe one day lead to bigger things in the future! I want you to join me here at the inception. Be introduced to characters and worlds that no one has ever seen. To play in my universe!

This comic book will be first of many, and I know it will put a smile on your faces, and entertain you. My hope is to have you fall in love with my characters and want to spend time in the worlds that they take place in.
 
The Loxonian Saga:
 
Takes place in the land of Ryoen and is mainly controlled by a ruling class of cat-like people called Antherians. After the a great war Lord Nurn brought peace to Ryoen with the help of the elephant-like Loxonian Tribesman, Elder Xon and his KIAN. After the tragic and sudden death of Lord Nurn, and the disappearance of his first son Jera, Nurn's youngest son Ra-Dor assumed power along with his suspected witch mother Lady Medine. Ever since Ra-Dor's rise to the throne, peace in Ryoen is wavering as Ra-Dor desire for power grows more ravenous.
 
Guardians of BREAKSource:
 
Alva was a simple nomad until the day he found a parasol. Well
he is still a nomad, but that parasol was far from simple. What
he found was more than just an umbrella, it was BREAKSource.
What is BREAKSource? BREAKSource has the POWER to defy
reality, call upon nature, manipulate the world to your will,
the power of the GODS. And when you use BREAKSource
the Guardians are not far behind.
 

What We Need

Our Goal is $2500
What is does it cover?
Mainly printing! And shipping and of course the artists.
AMMENDED PLEASE READ!!: "In Stone Perk" Will now recieve 2
copies of the book. And you may ask to have them both signed
and or one or none at all. Thanks again for the support!

& What You Get

We hope most people will choose to get a physical copy. There is nothing like actually having the comic book in your hand. More details in the perks section. Thanks very,very, much for even contemplating a donation! Even if you are just broke as a joke, but still want to contribute. Here's a deal, if you share this somehow or advertise this project I will give you a digital copy of the book FREE! Evey little counts even well wishes. Thank you.


Approx. size of the book is 36-40 pages.


-carlo

story:
Now in its final week! Chateau Obsidian #1 & 2 are here and now InDemand!

 

My name is Ross Bampfylde, a writer and illustrator and in 2020, amid all the chaos, I have successfully crowdfunded the second issue of Chateau Obsidian! last year I successfully crowdfunded Chateau Obsidian #1. With my work on issue 2 now in full swing, I would like to get the next chapter in the story out to those waiting to see what happens after the cliffhangers of the premier issue, and also introduce new fans wanting to jump onto this epic story.  

Chateau Obsidian #2 cover A

Chateau Obsidian #2 cover B



 



Chateau Obsidian #1, all covers bagged and boarded, ready to go!

Completed artwork for Chateau Obsidian #2:



The project is something I have been passionate about for years - an original comic series in 6 issues, set aboard the Starship Mayflower (the name of the ship being a little nod to my home city of Plymouth).

I grew up reading comics titles such as 2000AD and those by Marvel UK, my favourites being Nemesis the Warlock, Transformers and Death's Head. Since then I‘ve believed that battling robots, far future spaceships travelling at astonishing speeds and scientific ventures gone wrong are some of the coolest themes possible. Throwing in some of my adult interests into the mix we get a comic series that if it were a film I could describe as:

'Ullysses 31 meets Transformers The Movie (1986) via Sideways'

I studied at Plymouth College of Art and Design and have worked on a number of small press projects including, among others, Doctor Who and 2000AD fanzines, anthology comics, and a graphic biography of James Bond creator Ian Fleming. I’ve had a number of desk jobs and I’ve also worked drawing commissioned custom comics and illustrations, sharpening my skills at likenesses by drawing pictures for those who want to see their loved ones as superheroes, Mega-City One Judges or having a cup of coffee with the Golden Girls.

By funding this project, contributors will help me achieve my lifelong dream of creating my own comic from start to finish, hopefully getting a few people hooked on the story along the way.

 

In the far future, during the Starship Mayflower’s first incarnation as a cruise liner, holiday hologragher Jack finds himself amongst a deep criminal conspiracy when he unknowingly records evidence of the ship’s criminal element in a holographic recording of two tourists. What begins as a search for his missing photos leads him and his girlfriend Sarah deep into the Mayflower‘s underground business. Meanwhile, something weird is growing in the ship’s vineyards.

The two tourists provide welcome comic relief in their own travels, visiting the ship’s many wine producers.

Centuries later, with the ship in pirate hands, Captain Featherstone and his android second-in-command must travel deep within the vast ship - to parts not visited for centuries - to confront the mythical Green Man, who has forced the ship on a collision course with Earth. 

And back on Earth, Helena, a rebellious young woman reluctantly accepts her destiny as the only person who can protect Earth from the incoming disaster.

My target is £500 (approximately $620 USD) - Which Is more than enough to print and ship a small run of copies, continuing the story for the existing fan base, and attend a couple of local conventions later in the year. During the current lockdown due to COVID-19, I am firing on all cylinders working from home at minimal expense. I plan to have issue #2 printed and ready to launch in September 2020.

If I reach my target you'll see the next chapter of the new, exciting story of the Starship Mayflower in September 2020, continuing the story into 2020, in time for the 400th anniversary of the original Mayflower, taking the pilgrim fathers to the new world from my home city of Plymouth, UK.

I have also decided that if I reach or exceed the target, I will donate 20% of the total gained during the campaign to the NHS, the health service so valiantly dealing with the current COVID-19 crisis here in the UK.

** Update - almost £150 donated to the NHS on 19th May 2020! **

For those of you who missed out on Chateau Obsidian #1, a digital copy of the premier issue is included with each perk so you won’t have to miss out on the first chapter.

As with issue #1, you can have your likeness included into the story in issue #2 either as a one-off appearance, or introduced as a recurring character to also appear in later issues - including assisting main characters Jack and Sarah in the finale as they fall foul of the conspiracy aboard the starship Mayflower!
 

Also available are original and variant editions and original art!

Double splash page from Chateau Obsidian #6 - recurring characters likenesses featured in this scene were snapped up in the issue #1 Kickstarter.

Artwork for a double splash page intended for issue 6. The spaces in the car are up for grabs as you could be a recurring character!


Page 9 of Chateau Obsidian #2 work in progress - your face could be on this page!


All perks include a digital edition of Chateau Obsidian #1 and for an extra £3 you can include an issue one physical copy!


£3 - Digital Edition: Digital PDF of Chateau Obsidian #2

£5 - Print edition: Printed Copy of Chateau Obsidian #2

£7 - Variant Edition: Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, Plus Digital PDF edition.

£20 - Signed Variant Edition + Prints: Signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2 plus 2 character art prints and digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2.

£23 - Variant Plus Option: Signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, Signed Original Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, plus 2 Art prints & digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2.

£50 - Get Drawn In!: Get drawn in! Also get the signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, 2 Art prints and digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2.

£75 - Get drawn in! Plus Original Art Option: In addition to being drawn in, get original B&W artwork, and a signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, 2 art prints and the digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2.

£100 - Commission Option: Get your own commissioned artwork! Get drawn in! Also includes original B&W artwork, signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2 2 art prints and digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2.

£250 - Help save Jack and Sarah! (Limited to 2 only): Become a recurring character and be part of the series finale! Also receive original B&W artwork, signed Original Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, signed Variant Edition of Chateau Obsidian #2, 2 art prints, digital bundle of Chateau Obsidian issues 1 & 2. Also for an extra £20 you can be included on a future comic book cover!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out if you like what you see.
  • Smash those Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What's This?

This campaign is for an exclusive, SIGNED copy of Kevin Eastman's Totally Twisted Tales along with a pack of cool collectibles!

This Clover Press exclusive cover for Kevin Eastman's Totally Twisted Tales is SIGNED by the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles co-creator himself, Kevin Eastman!

Kevin Eastman’s Totally Twisted Tales is 96 pages of dark and twisted depravity from the clinically insane minds of Kevin Eastman and Simon Bisley! The novella features three full length stories featuring guys, girls, monsters, mutants, superheroes, slackers and lowlifes – as well as one VERY fast rat! 

What is a graphic novella?

A graphic novella is a brand-new format created by Clover Press. Graphic Novellas are trade paperbacks that feel like hardcovers. What's even better than that? They're offered at an amazing price!

Why are we here?

We want to show off our brand-new format, offer some amazing perks, and meet some fans!

If you support this project and agree that the graphic novella is a great way to binge comics, we'll be able to make more awesome sets like this in the future!

 

 

 

 

 

Meet The Team

KEVIN EASTMAN

Kevin Eastman is an American comic book writer and artist best known for co-creating Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles with Peter Laird. 

SIMON BISLEY

Simon has cited Frank Frazetta, Gustav Klimt, Salvador Dali, William Turner and Richard Corben as influences. His distinctive style is predominantly rendered using acrylics on bristol board; Simon does not regularly use airbrushes, contrary to popular belief, but he has been known to use car spraypaint and various other household items to achieve his amazing results…

Clover Press is a progressive, eclectic, boutique publisher made up of four industry veterans. Our goal is to work on projects we have a strong passion for.

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Clover Press is made up by a team of publishing professionals. While delays are always possible and sometimes impossible to control, the members of Clover are committed to delivering the best quality products in as timely a manner as possible.

story:
***READ BOOK 1: CHAOS IN HUMANHATTAN! NOW!!!! ***

(SEE LINK BELOW.)

Our 92 page, full color graphic novel is finally ready to be published and we need to see if there is enough demand for our book in order for the publisher to cover the high print cost. Help us bring this book from digital to hard copy! If we can get 350 or more pre-orders, we can make this happen!!!!

*ALL FUNDS RAISED HERE GO DIRECTLY TO THE PUBLISHER TO PRINT BOOKS*

The retail price of the graphic novel will be anywhere from $14.95 - $19.95 depending on how many we have made (the more we print, the cheaper per piece). You can pre-order it here at a discount for $17 including shipping (international shipping higher). If we can raise one half of the print fees, the publisher will give us half of the print run. We'll have an extra 500+ books to give away free to cancer centers, hospitals, and patients. There are 72,000+ young adults diagnosed with cancer each year, and we'd like to help ease their experience by sharing Kaylin's experience, outlook, and humor. Help us bring this book alive and spread the laughter! 


WHAT IS THE COMIC ABOUT?

    Kaylin was diagnosed with Ewing's Sarcoma, a rare bone cancer at age 23. Her life was immediately put on hold and a new journey began. Throughout all the pain and uncertainty, she discovered within herself a powerful coping mechanism in the form of humor and imagination. This comic book is the result.

    Slightly cynical, slightly irreverent, and REALLY hilarious, "Terminally Illin" is a candid look into the life of a young adult battling cancer, but with a psychedelic, sci-fi twist! It’s more than a comic book: It’s provocative, educational, entertaining, and totally original.  Think of "Terminally Illin" as a chemo-induced "Alice in Wonderland' meets campy 'Hollywood' action-adventure.

    In our story, our hero goes in for her first day of chemo, but ends up getting lost in a fantasy world within her own microscopic body - on a quest to meet her disease face-to-face and kick it's butt!!

    She's joined by her pet kitty, Iceman, as they set out to destroy Cancer City, the invading cancer cell army, and their leader - the little dictator that's bent on world domination. We hope you follow along and maybe even learn something.

CHEMO MEDICINE BOOZE BOTTLES:

The Tumornator! Hopefully he won't 'be baaaaack'...


WHAT DO PEOPLE THINK OF IT SO FAR?

    Two years ago, we published our first comic with the help of Kickstarter.com and we've donated copies to cancer patients and hospitals all over the world with lots of enthusiastic feedback from patients, doctors, nurses, and more - people love it!  It was even featured on MTV's "World of Jenks" Season 2. Here are some testimonials:

“Cancer education just got both geeky and cool.” - Mikl-em , Laughing Squid

“Kaylin’s attitude in dealing with cancer is so inspiring that I felt her story had to be shared with the world - so I documented her life and the making of this comic book on my MTV show ‘World of Jenks’.” - Andrew Jenks, filmmaker

"Just got my link to the .pdf version of Terminally Illin'. This couldn't have come on a better day. I'm laying here in bed with a leaking, open wound from an incision that has been cut, irradiated for 5 weeks, re-cut and re-re-cut open over the past few months. It hurts. It's ugly. It's gross...and damn it if it isn't pissing me off. All I want is to be able to go for a run, swim with my kids, or hit the rock climbing wall. I put on the smile for friends and family, but I am so ready to be over this cancer thing. I really needed a good laugh and this totally did it for me. Read the entire thing twice. I don't know that anyone has done such a great job telling the cancer story as you two have done with this comic book." - Glenn D. Grossman

"Cancer is so serious, sometimes you need to shine some fun to make it through!" - Sheena Eickholt, 2013 Lymphoma Survivor

"This comic helped me find humor in a situation that is filled with pain that I didn't have control over. I ♥this comic." - Jessica Prestwood, cancer survivor

“Irreverent, sassy, strong and beautiful, Kaylin Andres is the Lara Croft of the cancer world. She isn’t fighting cancer, cancer is fighting her -- and it better watch out.” - Suleika Jaouad , Emmy Award-winning New York Times Well Columnist

WHY SHOULD YOU GET INVOLVED?

Without your help, this book might stay in the digital world forever - help us make the hard copy a reality with your pre-order today!

***WE SET OUR FUND RAISING GOAL TO $6,500 BUT WE DON'T HAVE TO HIT THIS GOAL TO COLLECT THE FUNDING. IF WE DO HIT OUR GOAL WE WILL HAVE HUNDREDS OF BOOKS AVAILABLE TO GIVE AWAY FOR FREE TO CANCER PATIENTS - BONUS!

Even if you don't want to back this project, tell a friend. =)

HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE TO GET YOUR BOOKS?

According to our publisher, the cheapest printing option is literally the slow boat to China. They estimate 2-3 months time until the books arrive. You'll most likely get your books by June or July, but it's worth the wait!!!

WHAT T-SHIRT AND BUTTON IMAGES WILL BE USED?

We're designing a new t-shirt and button for this project which will be revealed at a later time (after we take care of more pressing details). Be assured whatever the final designs, they will kick butt and you will want it.

DO WE SHIP INTERNATIONALLY?

Yes. But the pledge levels do not include the extra shipping. We can work out the rest by email and using paypal.


FEEL FREE TO EMAIL US WITH ANY QUESTIONS YOU MAY HAVE AND THANK YOU FOR CHECKING US OUT!

Sincerely,

Kaylin & Jon

PLEASE ENJOY THE FULL BOOK TO READ HERE: http://cancercomicbook.com/topsecret/FINAL_BOOK1.pdf

NOW!!!! ***(SEE LINK BELOW.)Our 92 page, full color graphic novel is finally ready to be published and we need to see if there is enough demand for our book in order for the publisher to cover the high print cost. Help us bring this book from digital to hard copy! If we can get 350 or more pre-orders, we can make this happen!!!!*ALL FUNDS RAISED HERE GO DIRECTLY TO THE PUBLISHER TO PRINT BOOKS*The retail price of the graphic novel will be anywhere from $14.95 - $19.95 depending on how many we have made (the more we print, the cheaper per piece). You can pre-order it here at a discount for $17 including shipping (international shipping higher). If we can raise one half of the print fees, the publisher will give us half of the print run. We'll have an extra 500+ books to give away free to cancer centers, hospitals, and patients. There are 72,000+ young adults diagnosed with cancer each year, and we'd like to help ease their experience by sharing Kaylin's experience, outlook, and humor. Help us bring this book alive and spread the laughter! WHAT IS THE COMIC ABOUT?    Kaylin was diagnosed with Ewing's Sarcoma, a rare bone cancer at age 23. Her life was immediately put on hold and a new journey began. Throughout all the pain and uncertainty, she discovered within herself a powerful coping mechanism in the form of humor and imagination. This comic book is the result.    Slightly cynical, slightly irreverent, and REALLY hilarious, "Terminally Illin" is a candid look into the life of a young adult battling cancer, but with a psychedelic, sci-fi twist! It’s more than a comic book: It’s provocative, educational, entertaining, and totally original.  Think of "Terminally Illin" as a chemo-induced "Alice in Wonderland' meets campy 'Hollywood' action-adventure.    In our story, our hero goes in for her first day of chemo, but ends up getting lost in a fantasy world within her own microscopic body - on a quest to meet her disease face-to-face and kick it's butt!!    She's joined by her pet kitty, Iceman, as they set out to destroy Cancer City, the invading cancer cell army, and their leader - the little dictator that's bent on world domination. We hope you follow along and maybe even learn something.CHEMO MEDICINE BOOZE BOTTLES:The Tumornator! Hopefully he won't 'be baaaaack'...WHAT DO PEOPLE THINK OF IT SO FAR?    Two years ago, we published our first comic with the help of Kickstarter.com and we've donated copies to cancer patients and hospitals all over the world with lots of enthusiastic feedback from patients, doctors, nurses, and more - people love it!  It was even featured on MTV's "World of Jenks" Season 2. Here are some testimonials:“Cancer education just got both geeky and cool.” - Mikl-em , Laughing Squid“Kaylin’s attitude in dealing with cancer is so inspiring that I felt her story had to be shared with the world - so I documented her life and the making of this comic book on my MTV show ‘World of Jenks’.” - Andrew Jenks, filmmaker"Just got my link to the .pdf version of Terminally Illin'. This couldn't have come on a better day. I'm laying here in bed with a leaking, open wound from an incision that has been cut, irradiated for 5 weeks, re-cut and re-re-cut open over the past few months. It hurts. It's ugly. It's gross...and damn it if it isn't pissing me off. All I want is to be able to go for a run, swim with my kids, or hit the rock climbing wall. I put on the smile for friends and family, but I am so ready to be over this cancer thing. I really needed a good laugh and this totally did it for me. Read the entire thing twice. I don't know that anyone has done such a great job telling the cancer story as you two have done with this comic book." - Glenn D. Grossman"Cancer is so serious, sometimes you need to shine some fun to make it through!" - Sheena Eickholt, 2013 Lymphoma Survivor"This comic helped me find humor in a situation that is filled with pain that I didn't have control over. I ♥this comic." - Jessica Prestwood, cancer survivor“Irreverent, sassy, strong and beautiful, Kaylin Andres is the Lara Croft of the cancer world. She isn’t fighting cancer, cancer is fighting her -- and it better watch out.” - Suleika Jaouad , Emmy Award-winning New York Times Well ColumnistWHY SHOULD YOU GET INVOLVED?Without your help, this book might stay in the digital world forever - help us make the hard copy a reality with your pre-order today!***WE SET OUR FUND RAISING GOAL TO $6,500 BUT WE DON'T HAVE TO HIT THIS GOAL TO COLLECT THE FUNDING. IF WE DO HIT OUR GOAL WE WILL HAVE HUNDREDS OF BOOKS AVAILABLE TO GIVE AWAY FOR FREE TO CANCER PATIENTS - BONUS!Even if you don't want to back this project, tell a friend. =)HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE TO GET YOUR BOOKS?According to our publisher, the cheapest printing option is literally the slow boat to China. They estimate 2-3 months time until the books arrive. You'll most likely get your books by June or July, but it's worth the wait!!!WHAT T-SHIRT AND BUTTON IMAGES WILL BE USED?We're designing a new t-shirt and button for this project which will be revealed at a later time (after we take care of more pressing details). Be assured whatever the final designs, they will kick butt and you will want it.DO WE SHIP INTERNATIONALLY?Yes. But the pledge levels do not include the extra shipping. We can work out the rest by email and using paypal.FEEL FREE TO EMAIL US WITH ANY QUESTIONS YOU MAY HAVE AND THANK YOU FOR CHECKING US OUT!Sincerely,Kaylin & JonPLEASE ENJOY THE FULL BOOK TO READ HERE: http://cancercomicbook.com/topsecret/FINAL_BOOK1.pdf

story:
NYC Hip-Hop Comedians Squirm and Germ are going to the National Association for Campus Activities (NACA) Conference in Lancaster, PA from October 18-20. At the event they will meet university representatives from the Mid-Atlantic region who could book them for their first set of college tours! With over 150 schools attending from New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, and D.C. this is a hugely exciting opportunity for Squirm and Germ.

However, with fees for NACA membership, delegate passes, booth registration, promotional/marketing materials, electricity, WiFi, transportation and food costs, they need your help. All donations are greatly needed and will help S&G have the most successful NACA experience possible. Your generosity and support is seriously appreciated. With every dollar you donate you're helping Squirm and Germ share their comedy/music with colleges throughout the nation!
