From a recent interview on Moby's - 1/9/2016

http://www.mobys.ws/01/09/interview-with-j-miles-dunn-creator-of-grinidon-a-fantasy-graphic-novel/

Grinidon is ‘A Fantasy Graphic Novel’, but what more is it? From what I can tell, Grinidon promises war, adventure, mystery…but there’s more to it than that, isn’t there?

J. Miles Dunn – This is definitely a story with all of those elements, but I can quickly name a few things that may separate it from similar works in this genre.

One, I have been working on this story for more than twenty years. This has allowed me to really delve deeply into this world and create a place that truly feels authentic. There are reasons why the people and kingdoms look and behave the way they do, having differing cultures and motivations.

Secondly, the island where the book takes place, Calaway, has only been settled by humans within the last fifty years. I can talk more about this later, but I love this aspect of the series. You are not just part of a struggle between people and kingdoms; you are in a place with endless opportunities for new discoveries. There are already mysteries that they cannot explain, and many of the answers they find will only create new questions and added dangers.

Thirdly, I would have to say the characters. You can’t have a great story without great characters, and to achieve this, they need to have genuine reasons for why they act the way they do and what has brought them into the situation they are in. Just as with people in our world, Grinidon’s characters have complex backgrounds and personalities, and they continue to evolve through their relationships with other people and the changing world around them. Their actions will have consequences, and the reader will be able to see how these ripple and affect one another.

The artwork is truly outstanding and really seems to suit the story you’re telling. Can you tell us about how Erwin came to join the project?

Erwin (Arroza) is such a great person – and I couldn’t mean that more sincerely. I have been lucky to have worked with many great people along the way, which is an absolute necessity when you’re setting out to do something as involved and demanding as creating a new company and series from the ground up.

His style was very different from what we had done before, much darker and grittier, and we had moved away from color and were essentially starting the book over.  Even though it is the same story, the differences were undeniable...believe me, when you're in the difficult position of being a start-up company with little money and no revenue coming in, this decision came with a great deal of personal sacrifice.

The style is eye-catching, and those splash pages showing the landscapes and vistas give the sense that the land, the island of Calaway itself, will play a large role in the tale. Perhaps the land still has many secrets hidden in its valleys and forests?

That statement couldn’t be any truer. In a sense, Calaway is a character of its own. It has a history that extends beyond what its inhabitants know, and each race, kingdom and location holds secrets that will continuously come into play. The more the readers come to understand the lore and mysteries of the island, the more they will begin to form opinions of their own as to what things mean and where the story is headed.

Is Calaway a place of magic?

Magic is one of the greatest components of Grinidon. The series is actually named after a tower that houses a secret assembly of wizards – the most powerful magic users in the realm. During the story, you find out who these characters are and why they have come together. Each is very unique in both personality, and how they have chosen to use their power. Some know each other well, others have even been enemies, and one particular wizard of interest is a stranger of completely unknown origin. This makes for a very interesting dynamic and allows the reader to learn more about magic and the realm through the character’s interactions.

You’ve spent three years working on turning this story into a graphic novel. What inspired Grinidon?

When I was about thirteen-years-old, I began to slowly piece this world together. I had originally wanted to be an illustrator, but over time, I fell more-and-more in love with writing. I had wanted to try making a novel out of this place I had created but I just couldn’t find the right story to do it. It took about five or six years before I finally came up with an idea that I truly believed in and could really pour myself into.

Ultimately, I found the more I was willing to express myself through my characters, the easier the story became to write. Symptomatically, as I became more personally invested in the story, it also made it much more interesting and meaningful to work on.

This is why I am so passionate about this story and project, because it is very much a part of who I am. This has kept me from taking shortcuts in regards to plot and development, and really stay true to my vision and remain loyal to the reader. I hope people are able to identify with these characters and circumstances, and find value and meaning as well as entertainment.

As the author, is there anything in particular about the series that you would like the readers to be aware of?

I think one of the greatest strengths of this series is that since I have written so much of the story already, I have been able to include small clues and various pieces of information in earlier volumes that won’t immediately be obvious – or even recognizable at all. This was one of the most challenging aspects of writing the books because I had to change so many things throughout the series simultaneously, but the benefit is, as you progress through it, you can reread any of the volumes at any time and see things that you may have missed before. To me, this makes the series infinitely more enjoyable because you will always be finding something new as you revisit it.


If you have read this far, you have my thanks!  I hope we have managed to catch your interest and feel free to visit us at our websites where you can get more up-to-date pictures and information!  


Risks and challenges

Nearly everything is made locally, so the only foreseeable problem we could encounter is a minor delay in shipping. We can't control the weather, but the companies we are using all have quality and delivery guarantees.
story_txt:
As early as I can remember, I have always been a fan of comics. My earliest heroes were Spider-man, the Hulk, Superman, and Batman. Even before I could read, I would flip through pages and try to piece together the stories for myself, imagining their voices as I would hear them on my favorite cartoons.In middle school, I became a huge fan of fantasy films and novels, and began creating characters, stories, and a world of my own. My passion for drawing turned into an obsession for writing, and I have spent more than two decades creating the fantasy world where Grinidon takes place. I have devoted the last three years to bringing this series to life, and now the time has finally come to release the first volume!  Our GoalThis is an absolute work of passion and I am so proud of how far it has come. In order to continue to release Grinidon, especially in a timely manner, we need to build our audience.  With your contributions, I will be able to print extra volumes of our first graphic novel beyond the small number that have already been pre-ordered.  I can then take these books to comic conventions where we will hopefully meet new readers, and then continue the cycle until we are old and gray...which is not as far-off as I would like ;)   When I am able to, I would also like to bring Grinidon's incredibly talented artist, Erwin Arroza, to the U.S. on a work visa.  Then we could travel to some of these conventions together and you could see what a great person he is, and why I consider him such a dear friend.  The StoryGrinidon is an epic saga of kingdoms and factions fighting for control of a newly discovered island, Calaway.  You join the story fifty years into this conflict, after its lords and people have successfully won their independence from their homeland - and now wage war against each other.  Lords and families from the old lands have risked everything to come here and find their fortune.  Alliances have been formed and broken, guilds and kingdoms have risen and fallen, and heroes have come from the most unlikely of places.  In Volume 1, the southern kingdom of Carnasus is preparing its capital for an attack from the north.  The council has sent word for all those loyal to the realm to aid them, but they know that this is a battle they cannot hope to win. The northern army is impossibly large and their king has taken steps to ensure victory. All appears lost until a figure from Carnasus’ past reemerges - but the slim hope he offers comes with great risk, for he knows a dark secret that must never be told. The council must decide if they will place their lives into the hands of those they cannot trust, or risk annihilation on the battlefield and leave their end to fate.PERK ITEMSWallpaperPrints - 11" x 17":Laden and DemetriusGideon, Alycea, and VeradonLoricGrinidon T-ShirtsLogo 1Logo 2Personalized Drawing Erwin Arroza will sign and send you an 11"x17" Original Commission, done in bw pencil with ink wash, complete with certificate of authenticity!This picture will never be recreated in any print or poster, and we will absolutely consider any special requests you may have -  though of course, within reasonYour Likeness In The BookWe are offering a limited number of opportunities for your likeness to appear within Volume 1, or to even be a recurring character within the seriesLinksFacebookTumblrTwitterInstagram Music Credit: "Lost Frontier" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/From a recent interview on Moby's - 1/9/2016
http://www.mobys.ws/01/09/interview-with-j-miles-dunn-creator-of-grinidon-a-fantasy-graphic-novel/Grinidon is ‘A Fantasy Graphic Novel’, but what more is it? From what I can tell, Grinidon promises war, adventure, mystery…but there’s more to it than that, isn’t there?J. Miles Dunn – This is definitely a story with all of those elements, but I can quickly name a few things that may separate it from similar works in this genre.One, I have been working on this story for more than twenty years. This has allowed me to really delve deeply into this world and create a place that truly feels authentic. There are reasons why the people and kingdoms look and behave the way they do, having differing cultures and motivations.Secondly, the island where the book takes place, Calaway, has only been settled by humans within the last fifty years. I can talk more about this later, but I love this aspect of the series. You are not just part of a struggle between people and kingdoms; you are in a place with endless opportunities for new discoveries. There are already mysteries that they cannot explain, and many of the answers they find will only create new questions and added dangers.Thirdly, I would have to say the characters. You can’t have a great story without great characters, and to achieve this, they need to have genuine reasons for why they act the way they do and what has brought them into the situation they are in. Just as with people in our world, Grinidon’s characters have complex backgrounds and personalities, and they continue to evolve through their relationships with other people and the changing world around them. Their actions will have consequences, and the reader will be able to see how these ripple and affect one another.The artwork is truly outstanding and really seems to suit the story you’re telling. Can you tell us about how Erwin came to join the project?Erwin (Arroza) is such a great person – and I couldn’t mean that more sincerely. I have been lucky to have worked with many great people along the way, which is an absolute necessity when you’re setting out to do something as involved and demanding as creating a new company and series from the ground up.His style was very different from what we had done before, much darker and grittier, and we had moved away from color and were essentially starting the book over.  Even though it is the same story, the differences were undeniable...believe me, when you're in the difficult position of being a start-up company with little money and no revenue coming in, this decision came with a great deal of personal sacrifice.The style is eye-catching, and those splash pages showing the landscapes and vistas give the sense that the land, the island of Calaway itself, will play a large role in the tale. Perhaps the land still has many secrets hidden in its valleys and forests?That statement couldn’t be any truer. In a sense, Calaway is a character of its own. It has a history that extends beyond what its inhabitants know, and each race, kingdom and location holds secrets that will continuously come into play. The more the readers come to understand the lore and mysteries of the island, the more they will begin to form opinions of their own as to what things mean and where the story is headed.Is Calaway a place of magic?Magic is one of the greatest components of Grinidon. The series is actually named after a tower that houses a secret assembly of wizards – the most powerful magic users in the realm. During the story, you find out who these characters are and why they have come together. Each is very unique in both personality, and how they have chosen to use their power. Some know each other well, others have even been enemies, and one particular wizard of interest is a stranger of completely unknown origin. This makes for a very interesting dynamic and allows the reader to learn more about magic and the realm through the character’s interactions.You’ve spent three years working on turning this story into a graphic novel. What inspired Grinidon?When I was about thirteen-years-old, I began to slowly piece this world together. I had originally wanted to be an illustrator, but over time, I fell more-and-more in love with writing. I had wanted to try making a novel out of this place I had created but I just couldn’t find the right story to do it. It took about five or six years before I finally came up with an idea that I truly believed in and could really pour myself into.Ultimately, I found the more I was willing to express myself through my characters, the easier the story became to write. Symptomatically, as I became more personally invested in the story, it also made it much more interesting and meaningful to work on.This is why I am so passionate about this story and project, because it is very much a part of who I am. This has kept me from taking shortcuts in regards to plot and development, and really stay true to my vision and remain loyal to the reader. I hope people are able to identify with these characters and circumstances, and find value and meaning as well as entertainment.As the author, is there anything in particular about the series that you would like the readers to be aware of?I think one of the greatest strengths of this series is that since I have written so much of the story already, I have been able to include small clues and various pieces of information in earlier volumes that won’t immediately be obvious – or even recognizable at all. This was one of the most challenging aspects of writing the books because I had to change so many things throughout the series simultaneously, but the benefit is, as you progress through it, you can reread any of the volumes at any time and see things that you may have missed before. To me, this makes the series infinitely more enjoyable because you will always be finding something new as you revisit it.If you have read this far, you have my thanks!  I hope we have managed to catch your interest and feel free to visit us at our websites where you can get more up-to-date pictures and information!  Risks and challengesNearly everything is made locally, so the only foreseeable problem we could encounter is a minor delay in shipping. We can't control the weather, but the companies we are using all have quality and delivery guarantees.

story:
(Now accepting orders outside the United States! Just add $18 to your pledge per copy if you'd like it to be shipped overseas!)

 

Stretch Goals Reward Chart (these additional rewards will be given out if the final amount raised has reached these stretch amounts!) (Updated 11/20/16)

$2000 (REACHED!) - All $3+ contributors will also receive a 1.25" Jim button!

$2500 (REACHED!) - All $8+ contributors will also receive a short bonus e-book based on a longer memory from Jim's childhood!

$3000 (REACHED!) - All $12+ contributors will also have themselves drawn in Jim style next to their names on the "Backer's Page" inside the book!

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

This...Is Jim.

 

Jim is a good friend of mine, and somebody I've been illustrating for the past several years. And I'm Tanner Simmons, a recent graduate from the College for Creative Studies in Detroit, Michigan. I'm an illustrator and writer who finds inspiration not only in the stories I continue to experience every day, but the stories of others that I cross paths with. Human themes fill my work, whether it's a story of pure fantasy or something that draws heavily from real-life. Everything I do as an artist draws from a feeling or a place I've been before, even in minute ways. However, Jim is a special case of this philosophy in practice.
 

This Is Jim is a book I finished writing and illustrating earlier this year, and a project I've been extremely enthusiastic about since I first starting working on it. This book tells the story of our titular character Jim, as he navigates through his own memories; recalling seemingly random and out-of-order events that have occurred in his life. Many of these memories are normal, mundane happenings that most of us tend to ignore or take for granted on a day-to-day basis, but are vivid recollections in Jim's mind. He is naive, but also wonderfully curious about the littlest details in the world around him, and that's what the book is really about: the little details.

This book holds a lot of sentimental and cathartic value for me, as it draws from many of my own experiences but also the experiences of friends, acquaintances and even complete strangers. I believe it also holds many stories that other individuals can relate to as well though, and this is why I'm launching this crowd-funding project through Indiegogo. With your support, I intend to jump-start the first run of physically printed This Is Jim 172-page paperback and hardcover books so that I can get these stories and feelings into the hands of others, literally.

My hope is that through the success of this campaign I will be able to sell additional copies of this book and fund the future of Jim's artistic partnership with me. I certainly have more stories to tell with him, and would love to expand on this concept with more books and other illustrative efforts. With your help, this is a grand possibility.

 

The Good Stuff

So what do you get for helping out the cause? Well, aside from the main offering of providing a physical copy of the book itself, you'll have the option to donate and net yourself a bunch of awesome Jim swag, both of the digital and physical variety. Even if you can only spare a dollar, you'll get something worth your troubles. Be sure to check out all the different perks that are being offered and see which reward tier suits you the best! Digital e-books, exclusive wallpapers, stickers, custom drawings...you name it!

BLOWBALL ($1 TIER) - Exclusive "This Is Jim" themed computer wallpaper!

DANDELION ($3 TIER) - Wallpaper + 1.5" x 2" Jim Sticker!

DAISY ($8 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Digital PDF of "This Is Jim!"

TULIP ($12 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Your name on the "Backer Page" in the back of the book!

CARNATION ($30 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Physical Softcover "This Is Jim" Book!

LILY ($35 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Softcover + Author's Signature in the front of the book!

MARIGOLD ($45 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Physical Hardcover "This Is Jim" Book!

ORCHID ($50 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author's Signature in the front of the book!

ROSE ($60 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author Signature + Special Dust-Jacket designed by the author!

LOTUS ($75 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + E-Book + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author Signature  + Dust Jacket + Personal illustration of you in Jim style inside the front cover of the book!

 

Risks & Challenges

Seeing as how this is the first official print I've ever done of a book in mass quantities, I will be doing everything in my power to minimize errors in the printing process and get a shelf-worthy product for all of you who choose to contribute to the cause. I currently have a single test print of a hardcover version of the book that I ordered several months ago to showcase during my final presentation at school, and will be using it as a model for how I'd like the rest of my books to be printed as well. The final dimensions will be 8.5" x 8.5" inches, the perfect size for holding in your eager hands!

Another big reason I'm choosing the Indiegogo route with this comic book is that This Is Jim contains some adult language and suggestive themes that aren't suitable for very young readers. By self-publishing, I can avoid having to edit out sections of the book that I consider to be important despite their more adult-oriented content. These moments are few and far between, but it is worth mentioning that this is NOT a book meant for children. Please be aware of this if you intend to purchase a copy of the book for a child. The content will either make them giggle incessantly or will go right over their precious little heads, so be mindful before letting them read through it.

I wrote this book for people like me who have experienced so much in life already, but still have miles ahead of them. It's my way of expressing myself as an individual, yet attempting to connect with others with vastly different experiences of their own. It's a book for all of us, and I hope at the very least it'll make someone appreciate stories both little and large.

story:
***scroll down for the english version*** 

Mi nombre es German Andino. Soy un artista/periodista hondureño. Permíteme contarte de qué se trata este proyecto...


Las estadísticas, con todo el peso de su imprecisión, hasta el 2014, decían que Honduras era el país más violento del mundo y los medios lo han repetido hasta el punto en el que nuestros 103 homicidios por cada 100,000 habitantes son un dato ambiguo e inútil. Diez, quince, diecinueve homicidios al día, ya dan igual. Se ha repetido tanto que se anula su impacto.

El país se ha convertido en un espacio muestral frío, una tierra estéril que exporta poco más que bananos. Que se ofrece al lucimiento de los reporteros que lo pasean rápido y con cuidado. "Honduras es el infierno, ¡vean!"...

Este cómic pretende lo contrario: Llevarte de la mano por las calles temidas de Honduras y darte unas palmaditas en la espalda mientras los latidos de tu corazón se tranquilizan y te permiten ver a la gente que no es noticia,  los que seguimos vivos; como el periodista de nota roja del primer capítulo, o el vendedor de cocaína -que quiere ser como Daddy Yankee- de uno posterior. 

No hay estadística que cuente los charcos de sangre que uno pisa ni las ráfagas de AK-47 que, desde lejos, atragantan cenas o cantan canciones de cuna. Como tampoco puede pesarse la cocaína que, regada por el suelo, marca la ruta del narcotráfico que sube a Norteamérica. La vida diaria no entra en ningún titular ni la capta el reportero de guerra más avezado del mundo en un paseo de dos semanas.

A veces -demasiadas a mis 30 años-, veo algún muerto en la esquina de mi casa. En cualquier parte esto sería un golpe emocional... Y me incluyo: ¡Cuánto hemos normalizado esto! Aquí, son las cintas amarillas de la fiscalía las que atraen a los niños que, sólo gracias al espectáculo y las multitudes que se juntan para ver el cadáver, pueden jugar en la calle aunque sea solo por un momento, lo que se tarda en levantar al penúltimo muerto, lo que se tarda en volver a encontrarse a la parca trabajando en otro barrio.

Juegan los niños y entre ellos -como en un gran carnaval de saltos, prisas, cámaras, libretas y crímenes- cosecha el periodismo escenas llenas de color; vendedores de ataúdes que corren detrás de los familiares de las víctimas para lograr la venta del día. O suicidas que juegan a irse de la lengua. Que hablan. En Honduras, hablar es siempre demasiado.

Esas son las historias que se dibujan en esta novela gráfica. Las de los hondureños que  hemos aprendido a convivir con los cadáveres: periodistas, transportistas, tatuadores, comerciantes, dealers, secuestradores, músicos, niñas... No las de los habitantes del averno; las de los que se atrevieron a contarme un poco de su vida. Los que se adaptaron y pasan sus días en este país. 

Déjenme explicarles mejor, con viñetas y a pie de calle, cómo se sobrevive en el lugar donde hay que desarrollar el hábito de ponerse la mordaza o servir de parque de atracciones entre cintas amarillas.

                                                                         ***

Aquí van las primeras páginas(posiblemente no en su versión final) de la novela...

Puedes hojearla en Issuu:

 Descarga directa, PDF versión en español(¡compartí!):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxR1hqRWlXTzY5cWM/view?usp=sharing

***



El proyecto "Honduras: El hábito de la mordaza" empezó en el formato de la crónica periodística. Texto puro y duro en un blog y en dos o tres revistas. 
El siguiente paso fue ilustrar buena parte del trabajo de reporteo que hice intermitentemente durante un par de años en las ciudades más peligrosas de Honduras. Después, dibujar. Y dibujar más. Sin parar. 
Así, estas investigaciones se convirtieron en una novela gráfica en proceso. Ahora, el siguiente paso es: editarlo, completarlo y que se lea. Lo colgaremos en Internet para que todo el que quiera y nos apoye pueda tener este material de primera linea de combate. ¡Directo a tu ordenador! Sin intermediarios.
Aquí tienes un pequeño regalo por haber llegado hasta aquí: 

 

una historia corta que publiqué en Yorokobu. 

*Descárgala de la galería de imágenes del proyecto(ver pestaña superior).

*Descarga directa. PDF Versión en español(¡Compartí!):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxZGh3UDJlMXNudjA/view?usp=sharing


La primera parte de "Honduras: El hábito de la mordaza" tendrá aproximadamente 40 páginas digitales. Tres capítulos en blanco y negro, a excepción de los dibujos de mis diarios de campo que ilustraran algunas escenas del cómic. Ahora mismo rondan la red algunos de ellos: 

Por si esto fuera poco, como parte fundamental de este proyecto está el fotógrafo Javier Arcenillas. Sus impresionantes fotografías también estarán en las páginas de esta edición digital. 
Con Indiegogo pretendemos financiar todo el proceso de este cómic, de principio a fin. El guión está terminado. Mi intención es que la primera parte esté dibujada y editada en Junio del presente año. Para ello voy a dedicar los próximos 3 meses a dibujar. 
¿A QUE DESTINAREMOS LAS APORTACIONES?
El dinero recaudado servirá para permitirnos invertir por completo nuestro tiempo en el dibujo y edición de esta novela gráfica, cubrir los gastos del reporteo que nos haga falta y contribuir con nuestro fotógrafo y traductores. 
QUIERO PARTICIPAR. ¿CÓMO LO HAGO?

Participa reclamando cualquiera de las recompensas(ver menú a la derecha), y compartiendo el proyecto con tus contactos en twitter, facebook, mail, tumblr o a través del boca-a-boca. 

Aquí mismo y desde mi página de Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/german.andino podrás ver updates del proceso del cómic de principio a fin.

Muchas gracias por tu atención y tu apoyo. Cualquier ayuda, por pequeña que sea, permitirá que el proyecto se convierta en una realidad. Por eso no dejes de adquirir alguno de los packs del menú de la derecha. Gracias de nuevo.

German.


****************************************************************************


My name is German Andino. I’m a Honduran artist/journalist. Let me tell you what this project is about…


The statistics, with all the weight of their inaccuracy, until 2014 said that Honduras was the most violent country in the world and the media has repeated it to the point where our 103 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants are a useless data point. Ten, fifteen, nineteen homicides  a day, it’s all the same now. It’s been repeated so much that it dulls its impact. 

The country has turned into a cold sample space, a sterile land that produces little more than bananas. One that lends itself to reporters that pass through quickly and with great care. “Honduras is hell! Look!”

This comic tries to do the opposite: walk you through the feared streets of Honduras and pat your back while your heartbeat slows down to give you a look at the people who aren’t news, those of us who are still alive; like the crime journalist in the first chapter, or the cocaine dealer who wants to be like Daddy Yankee in the next one.

There are no statistics that can count the pools of blood you have to step through or the bursts of AK-47 fire that from far away can make you choke on your dinner or sing you to sleep at night. Just like no one can weigh the cocaine that, sprinkled along the ground, marks the narco-trafficker´s route to North America. Daily life doesn’t appear in headlines and even the world’s most seasoned war reporter doesn’t capture it in a two-week trip here.

Sometimes – too many times for my 30 years – I see a body on the corner of my block. This should cause an emotional response anywhere… and it does for me. But we’ve somehow normalized this! Here the investigators’ yellow tape attracts kids who, just thanks to the spectacle and the crowds that come from all around to see the corpse, get to play in the street even if it’s just for a little while. However long it takes to carry away that next-to-last body, however long it takes for the grim reaper to show up again working in the next neighborhood over.

The children play and among them – in a carnival of rushing around, cameras, notepads, and crime – journalism harvests its colorful scenes; coffin vendors  run behind the family members of the victim to get in that day’s sale. Or those suicidal people who tempt fate running their mouth. Who talk. In Honduras talking at all is always too much.

Those are the stories drawn in this graphic novel. Stories about us Hondurans who have learned to live with the corpses: journalists, transit workers, tattoo artists, vendors, drug dealers, kidnappers, musicians, children… not about the inhabitants of the underworld. They are stories about the people who dared to tell me about their lives. The people who have adapted and spend their days in this country.

Let me explain to you better, with comic strips from street level, how to survive where one has to make a habit of silence  or become an attraction between yellow tape.

Check it out on Issuu:



Direct download. PDF  version:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxT0...




The project “Honduras: The habit of silence” began in journalistic chronicles format. Pure hard text in a blog and in two or three magazines.

The next step was to illustrate a good part of the reporting work I did intermittently over a couple of years in Honduras’s most dangerous cities. Next, draw. And draw more. Nonstop drawing.

That’s how these investigations turned into a graphic novel in progress. Now the next step is: edit it, complete it, and have it be read. We’ll put it up on the internet so that everyone who supports us can have this material first. Straight to your computer! No intermediates.

Here’s a little gift for having gotten this far:

                       


A short story that I published on Yorokobu with an interview done with our text editor, journalist Alberto Arce, about his book Novato en Nota Roja.

Download it from the gallery of images for the project (tab at the top).

Direct download of Spanish version PDF(english/french version in a few days):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxZGh3UDJlMXNudjA/view?usp=sharing

The first part of “Honduras: The  habit of silence” will be about 40 digital pages. Three chapters in black and white, with the exception of the drawings from my field journals that will illustrate some scenes from the comic. Some of them are already floating around the web:

As if this weren’t enough, the photographer Javier Arcenillas is going to form a fundamental part of the project. His impressive photographs will also appear on the pages.

With IndieGogo we intend to finance the entire process of this comic, from start to finish. The script is finished. My intention is that the first part be drawn and edited by June of this year. To that end I’m going to dedicate the next three months to drawing.

What will contributions go towards?

The money collected will allow us to invest all of our time in drawing this graphic novel, cover expenses for the reporting that’s still to do, and pay our photographer and translators.

I want to participate. How do I do it?

Participate by getting any one of the packs, and by sharing the project with your contacts on Twitter, Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/german.andino , E-mail, or by word of mouth. From my Facebook page you’ll be able to see updates from the comic process from start to finish.

Thank you for your interest and support. Any help, however small, will allow us to make this project a reality. So don’t forget to get one of the packs from the bar to the right. Thanks!.

German.
story_txt:
***scroll down for the english version*** 
Mi nombre es German Andino. Soy un artista/periodista hondureño. Permíteme contarte de qué se trata este proyecto...







Las estadísticas, con todo el peso de su imprecisión, hasta el 2014, decían que Honduras era el país más violento del mundo y los medios lo han repetido hasta el punto en el que nuestros 103 homicidios por cada 100,000 habitantes son un dato ambiguo e inútil. Diez, quince, diecinueve homicidios al día, ya dan igual. Se ha repetido tanto que se anula su impacto.El país se ha convertido en un espacio muestral frío, una tierra estéril que exporta poco más que bananos. Que se ofrece al lucimiento de los reporteros que lo pasean rápido y con cuidado. "Honduras es el infierno, ¡vean!"...Este cómic pretende lo contrario: Llevarte de la mano por las calles temidas de Honduras y darte unas palmaditas en la espalda mientras los latidos de tu corazón se tranquilizan y te permiten ver a la gente que no es noticia,  los que seguimos vivos; como el periodista de nota roja del primer capítulo, o el vendedor de cocaína -que quiere ser como Daddy Yankee- de uno posterior. No hay estadística que cuente los charcos de sangre que uno pisa ni las ráfagas de AK-47 que, desde lejos, atragantan cenas o cantan canciones de cuna. Como tampoco puede pesarse la cocaína que, regada por el suelo, marca la ruta del narcotráfico que sube a Norteamérica. La vida diaria no entra en ningún titular ni la capta el reportero de guerra más avezado del mundo en un paseo de dos semanas.A veces -demasiadas a mis 30 años-, veo algún muerto en la esquina de mi casa. En cualquier parte esto sería un golpe emocional... Y me incluyo: ¡Cuánto hemos normalizado esto! Aquí, son las cintas amarillas de la fiscalía las que atraen a los niños que, sólo gracias al espectáculo y las multitudes que se juntan para ver el cadáver, pueden jugar en la calle aunque sea solo por un momento, lo que se tarda en levantar al penúltimo muerto, lo que se tarda en volver a encontrarse a la parca trabajando en otro barrio.Juegan los niños y entre ellos -como en un gran carnaval de saltos, prisas, cámaras, libretas y crímenes- cosecha el periodismo escenas llenas de color; vendedores de ataúdes que corren detrás de los familiares de las víctimas para lograr la venta del día. O suicidas que juegan a irse de la lengua. Que hablan. En Honduras, hablar es siempre demasiado.Esas son las historias que se dibujan en esta novela gráfica. Las de los hondureños que  hemos aprendido a convivir con los cadáveres: periodistas, transportistas, tatuadores, comerciantes, dealers, secuestradores, músicos, niñas... No las de los habitantes del averno; las de los que se atrevieron a contarme un poco de su vida. Los que se adaptaron y pasan sus días en este país. Déjenme explicarles mejor, con viñetas y a pie de calle, cómo se sobrevive en el lugar donde hay que desarrollar el hábito de ponerse la mordaza o servir de parque de atracciones entre cintas amarillas.                                                                         ***Aquí van las primeras páginas(posiblemente no en su versión final) de la novela...Puedes hojearla en Issuu: Descarga directa, PDF versión en español(¡compartí!):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxR1hqRWlXTzY5cWM/view?usp=sharing
***
El proyecto "Honduras: El hábito de la mordaza" empezó en el formato de la crónica periodística. Texto puro y duro en un blog y en dos o tres revistas. 


El siguiente paso fue ilustrar buena parte del trabajo de reporteo que hice intermitentemente durante un par de años en las ciudades más peligrosas de Honduras. Después, dibujar. Y dibujar más. Sin parar. 

Así, estas investigaciones se convirtieron en una novela gráfica en proceso. Ahora, el siguiente paso es: editarlo, completarlo y que se lea. Lo colgaremos en Internet para que todo el que quiera y nos apoye pueda tener este material de primera linea de combate. ¡Directo a tu ordenador! Sin intermediarios.

Aquí tienes un pequeño regalo por haber llegado hasta aquí: 
 
una historia corta que publiqué en Yorokobu. 
*Descárgala de la galería de imágenes del proyecto(ver pestaña superior).
*Descarga directa. PDF Versión en español(¡Compartí!):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxZGh3UDJlMXNudjA/view?usp=sharing
La primera parte de "Honduras: El hábito de la mordaza" tendrá aproximadamente 40 páginas digitales. Tres capítulos en blanco y negro, a excepción de los dibujos de mis diarios de campo que ilustraran algunas escenas del cómic. Ahora mismo rondan la red algunos de ellos: Por si esto fuera poco, como parte fundamental de este proyecto está el fotógrafo Javier Arcenillas. Sus impresionantes fotografías también estarán en las páginas de esta edición digital. 
Con Indiegogo pretendemos financiar todo el proceso de este cómic, de principio a fin. El guión está terminado. Mi intención es que la primera parte esté dibujada y editada en Junio del presente año. Para ello voy a dedicar los próximos 3 meses a dibujar. 

¿A QUE DESTINAREMOS LAS APORTACIONES?
El dinero recaudado servirá para permitirnos invertir por completo nuestro tiempo en el dibujo y edición de esta novela gráfica, cubrir los gastos del reporteo que nos haga falta y contribuir con nuestro fotógrafo y traductores. 
QUIERO PARTICIPAR. ¿CÓMO LO HAGO?

Participa reclamando cualquiera de las recompensas(ver menú a la derecha), y compartiendo el proyecto con tus contactos en twitter, facebook, mail, tumblr o a través del boca-a-boca. 
Aquí mismo y desde mi página de Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/german.andino podrás ver updates del proceso del cómic de principio a fin.
Muchas gracias por tu atención y tu apoyo. Cualquier ayuda, por pequeña que sea, permitirá que el proyecto se convierta en una realidad. Por eso no dejes de adquirir alguno de los packs del menú de la derecha. Gracias de nuevo.
German.

****************************************************************************

My name is German Andino. I’m a Honduran artist/journalist. Let me tell you what this project is about…




The statistics, with all the weight of their inaccuracy, until 2014 said that Honduras was the most violent country in the world and the media has repeated it to the point where our 103 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants are a useless data point. Ten, fifteen, nineteen homicides  a day, it’s all the same now. It’s been repeated so much that it dulls its impact. 
The country has turned into a cold sample space, a sterile land that produces little more than bananas. One that lends itself to reporters that pass through quickly and with great care. “Honduras is hell! Look!”
This comic tries to do the opposite: walk you through the feared streets of Honduras and pat your back while your heartbeat slows down to give you a look at the people who aren’t news, those of us who are still alive; like the crime journalist in the first chapter, or the cocaine dealer who wants to be like Daddy Yankee in the next one.
There are no statistics that can count the pools of blood you have to step through or the bursts of AK-47 fire that from far away can make you choke on your dinner or sing you to sleep at night. Just like no one can weigh the cocaine that, sprinkled along the ground, marks the narco-trafficker´s route to North America. Daily life doesn’t appear in headlines and even the world’s most seasoned war reporter doesn’t capture it in a two-week trip here.
Sometimes – too many times for my 30 years – I see a body on the corner of my block. This should cause an emotional response anywhere… and it does for me. But we’ve somehow normalized this! Here the investigators’ yellow tape attracts kids who, just thanks to the spectacle and the crowds that come from all around to see the corpse, get to play in the street even if it’s just for a little while. However long it takes to carry away that next-to-last body, however long it takes for the grim reaper to show up again working in the next neighborhood over.
The children play and among them – in a carnival of rushing around, cameras, notepads, and crime – journalism harvests its colorful scenes; coffin vendors  run behind the family members of the victim to get in that day’s sale. Or those suicidal people who tempt fate running their mouth. Who talk. In Honduras talking at all is always too much.
Those are the stories drawn in this graphic novel. Stories about us Hondurans who have learned to live with the corpses: journalists, transit workers, tattoo artists, vendors, drug dealers, kidnappers, musicians, children… not about the inhabitants of the underworld. They are stories about the people who dared to tell me about their lives. The people who have adapted and spend their days in this country.
Let me explain to you better, with comic strips from street level, how to survive where one has to make a habit of silence  or become an attraction between yellow tape.
Check it out on Issuu:



Direct download. PDF  version:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxT0...





The project “Honduras: The habit of silence” began in journalistic chronicles format. Pure hard text in a blog and in two or three magazines.
The next step was to illustrate a good part of the reporting work I did intermittently over a couple of years in Honduras’s most dangerous cities. Next, draw. And draw more. Nonstop drawing.
That’s how these investigations turned into a graphic novel in progress. Now the next step is: edit it, complete it, and have it be read. We’ll put it up on the internet so that everyone who supports us can have this material first. Straight to your computer! No intermediates.
Here’s a little gift for having gotten this far:

                       

A short story that I published on Yorokobu with an interview done with our text editor, journalist Alberto Arce, about his book Novato en Nota Roja.
Download it from the gallery of images for the project (tab at the top).
Direct download of Spanish version PDF(english/french version in a few days):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B35_NbPkX3cxZGh3UDJlMXNudjA/view?usp=sharing
The first part of “Honduras: The  habit of silence” will be about 40 digital pages. Three chapters in black and white, with the exception of the drawings from my field journals that will illustrate some scenes from the comic. Some of them are already floating around the web:
As if this weren’t enough, the photographer Javier Arcenillas is going to form a fundamental part of the project. His impressive photographs will also appear on the pages.
With IndieGogo we intend to finance the entire process of this comic, from start to finish. The script is finished. My intention is that the first part be drawn and edited by June of this year. To that end I’m going to dedicate the next three months to drawing.
What will contributions go towards?
The money collected will allow us to invest all of our time in drawing this graphic novel, cover expenses for the reporting that’s still to do, and pay our photographer and translators.
I want to participate. How do I do it?
Participate by getting any one of the packs, and by sharing the project with your contacts on Twitter, Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/german.andino , E-mail, or by word of mouth. From my Facebook page you’ll be able to see updates from the comic process from start to finish.
Thank you for your interest and support. Any help, however small, will allow us to make this project a reality. So don’t forget to get one of the packs from the bar to the right. Thanks!.
German.

story:
Thanks for taking some time to view our Indiegogo project! We are a writing team seeking funding for two comic books, The Ascendant and Horsemen. Both books are currently in production and will be debuted at the New York Comicon (NYCC). Below is a brief description of both comics and some artwork. For a more comprehensive look at how much it costs to put out a comic book (significantly more than we are asking for here), please see our post on the subject in the updates tab above.

Important note: All rewards will be paid even if we don't reach our goal! 

The Ascendant:

The Ascendant is about Cail, an escaped Duke of Hell, who has entered our world and is righting some of his wrongs by sending other escaped demons back to the Pit. His first challenge comes in the form of a nasty villain named Halstein, the Earl of the Bleak Isles. Check out their first battle below:

Cail is joined in his quest by another escapee, Faustus. Faustus provides Cail with help in the form of arcane knowledge. He's a surly, but well intentioned fellow.  You can also see Cail's meeting with Faustus below:

 

 

Horsemen:

There is a game of chess being played for dominion over the multiverse. On the side of freedom are the Horsemen, an elite fighting force of intergalactic guardians. Their nemesis, Fate and Destiny, look to extinguish all freewill and remake everything in their colorless image. They have battled for the souls of sentient beings across space and time longer than recorded history. Fate and Destiny have multitudes of plans, each more devious than the next, but they are all connected to their ultimate scheme - complete domination of all existence!

Led by their senior Horseman War and narrated by his protégé Destruction, the limited series is a adventure that will take its heroes on quests to strange alien worlds or anywhere a battle must be fought. The first issue opens with the fall of the godlike Horseman Thanatos and the emergence of his replacement Gemna, a man born of one of our earthly tragedies. Check out some images:



 

 

The first six pages of both The Ascendant and Horseman can be seen by clicking the links below. Additionally there are links to our blog where plenty of other content can be found, our Twitter accounts if you would like to follow us and get a view from inside our heads, some other YouTube videos where we talk more about our journey to NYCC, and lastly Facebook pages for both comics where we've snuck in even more stuff about the books and included tons of high rez images that show the whole process from pencils to final pages.

Finally, here's a quick pic of the t-shirt that sponsors will earn at the $35 level and above:
 
 
Thanks for taking a look! We truly appreciate your time, please feel free to reach out to us with comments, thoughts or just to say hello.
Sincerely,
-Mark and Josh
 
 
Update:
Here are a few character sketches. You can also see them in the "gallery" tab where we will continue to add more content.

story:
Who are we?
Old College Comics is an independent comic publisher staffed by creators who are, above all else, fans of the medium. Formed by a bunch of old college buddies who were tired of living in creative obscurity, our goal is to tell original stories, regardless of genre. All of us have to work full-time jobs to pay off loans and rent, but we’re doing this because it’s our passion. We love comics. We all love writing and drawing our own comics and want to get our stuff out there to be read by fans and professionals alike. We’ve already been hard at work making our dream a reality, creating a line of books, now we just need the funds to get our books in the hands and on the computer screens of everyone out there. If you’d like to help us, we’d greatly appreciate it.



What have we got lined up?
We’ve got two books in the works. The cornerstone of Old College Comics is our anthology book, The Freshmen Fifteen--a collection of comics that shows what our 24 writers and artists can do. The anthology will be:

  • 15 black & white comics with a full-color cover
  • 110 pages of story
  • 2 or 10-page comics in anti-boredom, easily-digestible, length
  • all printed in a standard comic size format (6.625x10.25)
  • available in print and online as a digital download


Along with that, we’ve got the first issue of our 22-page superhero comic, Afterman, written by Joe Bryant and Mike Pallotta, and beautifully drawn and watercolored by Jeff Chang.



At this point, Afterman and all 15 comics in the anthology have been completely scripted out, edited, and are in the process of being drawn by our artists.

On top of that we’ve been building a site to showcase all of the talent and projects involved at OldCollegeComics.com.

What are the comics about?
In the anthology, we’ve got:

  • Ragnar: the adventure of a loin-clothed Viking prince on the run from his countrymen. He has been running for two days without stopping. It’s his birthday.
  • Idiot Dad: a slice of life comic about the stupidity of one young father.
  • Alex Elwood: a trip into another world with a guy and the monstrous giant he befriends. Is it real life? Is it just fantasy? It’s only 10 pages, so it won’t take too long to find out.
  • The House on the Forest’s Edge: a horror story about a home for orphans who have to fight for survival whenever a new kid comes to stay.
  • Lonely: the memoirs of a delusional and delightful little girl who wants to move to Hollywood, but doesn’t realize she already lives there.
  • Bad Pun Comics: a Sunday-strip style collection of awful, awful puns.
  • You’re STUCK Here: the minglings of a group of friends who attend a community college and can’t seem to ever graduate or date anyone outside of their own circle.
  • Dummies: the story of a family of unwitting robots caught in the middle of a futuristic war game between two soldiers.
  • Child Gone Wild: a comedic-thriller following two detectives tracking down a demon fetus who teleports from womb to womb, destroying relationships with each jump.
  • Population 1: a sci-fi comic about a man confined from society in a home filled wall-to-wall with moving screens that show everything from the news to his inner-most thoughts.
  • No Way Out: the tale of a man whose number of suicide attempts are only outnumbered by the number of ways he’s imagined his own death, each of which have failed miserably.
  • Katzenkotze: baroque, vaudevillian, and soul-encompassing, this two-part creation will leave you as wide-eyed and captivated as the owner of a vomiting cat, scrambling to clear shoes, clothes and blankets out of the way before certain destructive explosion damns it all.
  • Old Time Manatee Comics: the sometimes-educational-depending-on-how-little-you-know-about-manatees adventures of a manatee, Morris T. Manatee, and all the bullshit a manatee gets up to. Manatee.
  • Junklords: the story of two junkyard workers who come across something that’s not quite man, not quite machine.
  • And finally, we’ve got Rocket Arms: the tale of a man who finds a genie’s lamp on the beach. What does he wish for? Only the title can tell (in a very self-explanatory way)!


Outside of the anthology, we've got our superhero comic. The first issue of Afterman which follows Greg Martelli as he moves from Chicago to Long Beach looking to start fresh in the city of his favorite hero, Afterman. Things go from bad motel to worse when Greg’s caught in the middle of a battle between his idol and a handful of dangerous villains throwing exploding pom-poms, blasting streams of fire, sweating acid onto innocent people, and generally destroying everything in sight. Can Greg survive? Will Afterman save the day? Did I just say “sweating acid”? At least one of the answers is yes!

When are we looking to publish?
The week of Halloween, just in time for Long Beach Comic Con, November 3rd-4th! The artists are currently sketching out their pages and we’re moving along nicely. With your support we’ll be able to have a small press booth at the Con, and enough copies of our books to sell, along with any promotional material, so that we can properly get our work in the hands of comic readers.

How do we plan to use your money?
Any money donated to our cause will go directly into covering costs for:

  • publishing both of our books, both in print and online
  • shipping books and incentives
  • building and keeping up our website: OldCollegeComics.com
  • the Long Beach Comic Con booth
  • promotional material for LBCC (a banner, business cards, two posters, and prints)
  • the incentives for all you wonderful people supporting us here (t-shirts, promo cards, prints, character sketches, etc.).

What if we exceed our goal?
Any excess funds received will go directly to our next line of books, and securing booths at any future comic conventions.

What if we don’t raise the funds?
We’ll try not to cry and tweet about it.

For updates, comments or questions:

  • on Twitter at @OldCollegeComic
  • Facebook at facebook.com/OldCollegeComics
  • contact us at oldcollegecomics@gmail.com
  • head over to our site at OldCollegeComics.com

And please share this campaign! Thank you for your support!

Bad Pun Comics: a Sunday-strip style collection of awful, awful puns. 
You’re STUCK Here: the minglings of a group of friends who attend a community college and can’t seem to ever graduate or date anyone outside of their own circle.
Dummies: the story of a family of unwitting robots caught in the middle of a futuristic war game between two soldiers.
Child Gone Wild: a comedic-thriller following two detectives tracking down a demon fetus who teleports from womb to womb, destroying relationships with each jump. 
Population 1: a sci-fi comic about a man confined from society in a home filled wall-to-wall with moving screens that show everything from the news to his inner-most thoughts.
No Way Out: the tale of a man whose number of suicide attempts are only outnumbered by the number of ways he’s imagined his own death, each of which have failed miserably.
Katzenkotze: baroque, vaudevillian, and soul-encompassing, this two-part creation will leave you as wide-eyed and captivated as the owner of a vomiting cat, scrambling to clear shoes, clothes and blankets out of the way before certain destructive explosion damns it all.

Old Time Manatee Comics: the sometimes-educational-depending-on-how-little-you-know-about-manatees adventures of a manatee, Morris T. Manatee, and all the bullshit a manatee gets up to. Manatee.
Junklords: the story of two junkyard workers who come across something that’s not quite man, not quite machine.
And finally, we’ve got Rocket Arms: the tale of a man who finds a genie’s lamp on the beach. What does he wish for? Only the title can tell (in a very self-explanatory way)!

Outside of the anthology, we've got our superhero comic. The first issue of Afterman which follows Greg Martelli as he moves from Chicago to Long Beach looking to start fresh in the city of his favorite hero, Afterman. Things go from bad motel to worse when Greg’s caught in the middle of a battle between his idol and a handful of dangerous villains throwing exploding pom-poms, blasting streams of fire, sweating acid onto innocent people, and generally destroying everything in sight. Can Greg survive? Will Afterman save the day? Did I just say “sweating acid”? At least one of the answers is yes!When are we looking to publish? The week of Halloween, just in time for Long Beach Comic Con, November 3rd-4th! The artists are currently sketching out their pages and we’re moving along nicely. With your support we’ll be able to have a small press booth at the Con, and enough copies of our books to sell, along with any promotional material, so that we can properly get our work in the hands of comic readers. How do we plan to use your money?Any money donated to our cause will go directly into covering costs for: 

publishing both of our books, both in print and online
 shipping books and incentives
building and keeping up our website: OldCollegeComics.com 
the Long Beach Comic Con booth
promotional material for LBCC (a banner, business cards, two posters, and prints)
the incentives for all you wonderful people supporting us here (t-shirts, promo cards, prints, character sketches, etc.).

What if we exceed our goal? Any excess funds received will go directly to our next line of books, and securing booths at any future comic conventions.What if we don’t raise the funds?We’ll try not to cry and tweet about it. For updates, comments or questions: 


on Twitter at @OldCollegeComic


Facebook at facebook.com/OldCollegeComics

contact us at oldcollegecomics@gmail.com

head over to our site at OldCollegeComics.com

And please share this campaign! Thank you for your support!

story:
Our Story

My name's Evin and for about the past 2 years I've been self-publishing the all-ages fantasy comic Knifestone over at http://knifestone.net, the third chapter of which is wrapping up, and it's time I put out a for-reals book. I've been doing some hand-stapled, photocopied editions of the first chapters as I go, but it's time for something better.


I've weighed my options decided to go with the comics-centric digital printing service Ka-Blam (http://ka-blam.com). I'm only looking to do about 100 copies of the ~176 page book which will cover me for the few conventions I attend, sending out to publishers, selling on the website, stocking at the bookstore I work at and the few comic stores in town, and then some. Of course, if I manage to exceed my goals the first priority is to bump up the number I can print.


The Impact

Helping me fund this print run will not only help me monetarily but, almost more importantly, will be a pretty big boost emotionally. I've got a nice little readership (about 100 or so weekly) which is awesome and I appreciate it, but I don't get a ton of feedback and I'm pretty quick to get down on myself and feel like I'm doing this for nothing. I'm super happy pushing through those feelings (I've only missed half a week in the past two years and that was 'cuz I was really sick) regardless because I care enough about the story to tell it and comics and storytelling in general are what I want to do with my life, but it'd be really, really nice to just feel that I'm making enough of an impact that a few kind people would be willing to throw some dollars my way to make it happen.


What We Need & What You Get

The costs for my run are pretty meager - just shy of $500 or so. I've also got some travel costs and stuff for the convention in May I'm attending and want the book printed in time for (http://www.vancaf.com/), but that's about it.

If I don't hit the final total then I'm still going to print the book, but only about 50 copies or so which I can probably swing on my own (just under $300 or so). So because I'll be printing regardless of how much I make, everyone will get their premiums no matter what.


Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can help, honestly, is to read my comic and tell your friends if you like it. Tweet it out, join the Facebook fan page, throw things (responsibly and with attribution, plz&thx) on Tumblr, leave some comments on my website, whatever. My whole goal in printing books and getting out there and doing shows is just to get people to read my stuff. If all you can do is talk about me, that's really all I ask, and I'm eternally grateful.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I am Arun, a marketing professional with an interest in innovation! A few years ago, my mom & sis had produced a customized comic for my son, featuring him,me & my wife in a very interesting story and with our comic images in the illustrations. Needless to say, it was a great thrill for the family and since then the idea to take this experience to more kids has been parked at the back of my mind! Recently, my former colleague & project advisor Sajeev, introduced me to Nebu, the creative tech brain behind this project and he has set up a nice prototype website (link shown in campaign :http://www.kustomkomix.com )  where any of you can experience the fun of putting your kid into a timeless Christmas story! And thats just the beginning. This campaign is aimed at helping us finish the development and put in a much bigger set of stories for you & your kids to enjoy! We know this is not going to change the world!!! But we sure as hell hope that there are going to be a lot more happy kids & families for the effort!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

In this first round of funding, we are looking at raising USD 20,000. This will go into the following investments

1. USD 5000 towards upgrading the demo website technology and user interface  into a fully functioning website

2. USD 5000 towards testing and improving the facial feature set application, expanding it to fit more ethnicities and generating better character likeness. Special features/ accessorization will also be added in.

3. USD 10000 toward building an initial library of 20 story titles across different themes

This round of funding will focus on getting stories featuring one kid to be fully functional in a website. The website is expected to go fully live by April 2013. We will be looking to move on to multi character stories featuring more kids, family & friends in subsequent stages of development!So also, adapting the concept to other platforms like pads & smart phones. Hang in there with us!

 

The perks for your support are aimed at making you a part of enjoying the fun of personalized storybooks & sharing it with others. Create your own customized digital version of some of the classic stories on our website for your child and get a pdf version free for you to make your own print! Become a Founding Fan and gift memberships to other near & dear ones on launch! Use this unique website to promote your own business & brands thru customized stories. All this plus privileged membership on the launch of the full website. Do look thru more details on the perks on offer!

 

The Impact

It never works better than when you are part of the fun and action! Our demo website link given in the campaign should help you get a first feel for this! With your support, we are sure the final offering of personalized story illustrations featuring kids and family will make for a unique reading experience! Fond memories, unexpected thrills, enhanced involvement with reading - these are some of the simple things we believe you can help achieve!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do help us reach this effort out to more families with kids in your social circle, who can enjoy a new thrill of reading. Authors, illustrators, creative technology & media professionals are also welcome to contribute feedback, content and references who can help take the project forward! We look forward to your support in reaching the campaign to a wider audeince thru your social network and the share features on this Indiegogo campaign page!

All those who have test driven our demo website are welcome to also give a feedback on the same at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/PXNDF9D. Your comments and suggestions will help us better design the final website!

story:
It's been 5 years since I began drawing Wuffle comics. Time flies! Now the series is over and I need your help to make the third and (kinda) final volume happen. So let's do it!

 

Honestly, if we can just reach the goal to make the book, that is enough for me. <3 But if we can make it further, these are the things I can offer you:

 

The funding goal this time is not just to cover the costs of book production. It's also for the team, for the people who have helped me make the comic. In addition, it will be used for improving the website, as well as helping me spend more time creating more digital content for everyone. Lastly, shipping fees in Thailand have increased, and the higher goal will help compensate for that too.

See the chart below :

From left to right; Editor : Guts, Comic Artist : Piti Yindee, Colorist and Background Artist : Mik, Script Writer and Proofreader : Leonard Kirke

We did it 2 times before and we will do it again for the last time, here at Indiegogo! Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word to your friends, family, and to the world!

Last but not least, if this campaign does not succeed, I can try again in the future. However, I will still manage to make all of the digital content for free and I'll work on improving the website to include more user-friendly reading like I've planned, it'll just happen more slowly. ^^

Thank you very much for all the support after all these years, folks!

- Piti Yindee

story:
The Dominus is the story of six childhood friends who reunite as adults and embark on an adventure to protect the Holy Grail from the Antichrist. Through their adventure, they are drawn into the eternal struggle between good and evil, face death, and become ‘blessed’ with unique abilities and powers.

Created and written by Daniel Thompson

Drawn by Eliseu Gouveia

Colored by Robert Reichert & Octavia Moon

Covers by Drew Moss

The Dominus is a 96 page full-color Graphic Novel.

The Dominus is the story of six childhood friends who reunite as adults and embark on an adventure to protect the Holy Grail from the Antichrist.  Through their adventure, they are drawn into the eternal struggle between good and evil, face death, and become ‘blessed’ with unique abilities and powers. The Dominus is a 96 page full color original graphic novel.  It is intended for mature audiences with violence and mild profanity.   

The story picks up on the night of a reunion between the six friends who grew up together at Saint Christopher’s Orphanage in Long Island, New York.  They are reminded of a story from their childhood involving a hidden land inside the Himalayas where the Holy Grail was kept in secret, guarded by an ancient race called the Peregrinus.  Upon hearing that name, memories are triggered among the group involving incredible things they could do as children while at the orphanage. 

As the group tries to make sense of these new memories, they are joined by their old priest who implores them to go on a quest with him to the Himalayas, where they must become the frightening power of good to protect the Grail from an ancient evil that seeks to possess it.

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Late last year we completed a successful campaign for the Dominus.  Earlier this year we filled all of our orders and in the time between have completely sold out of our first print run.  This campaign is for funding our second print run, which will sport an all new cover. We are hoping to raise $2,600.  Once the printing is covered we will send all the files to the printer.  We are hoping to ship the book to all the backers in February of 2020.  If we can make that happen sooner, we will. 

We have 3 perk levels that will give the backers some really cool swag.

Anything we raise over the goal will be used for additional perks and for starting on another exciting project I am currently writing.

The Impact

Bringing these characters to life is a dream come true for me.  All the positive feedback I have received on this book has touched my heart and I am so very thankful and humble.  I created these characters years ago as a way to entertain my younger sister and brother.  Now to see them in the pages of their comic book AND that people love this story- words can't express how awesome this feels!

This project is dedicated to Fred Browne and Drew Wessel.

Risks & Challenges

This is my second Indiegogo project and I am super stoked about it!   I have years of experience in big and small business. I have launched markets for major companies and in 2007 I purchased a failing comic book store and turned it around into a viable business.  I know how to lead people and manage results.  Most of all I know the most important element of any business or project is its customers!

Other Ways You Can Help

When you sign up, please share this project with all of your friends on Facebook & Twitter!

story:
Hello everyone. I’m happy to announce that Wuffle the Big Nice Wolf : Year 1 is going to be printed! We’ve reached the goal!!
But the campaign is still on. For those who want the book, you can still make a contributions until the campaign is over. (March 6, 2013)

Now let's celebrate!







I was asked about upgrading perk and how to order more than one book, so here’s how to do so.

— Upgrading Perk
If you want to upgrade your perk, please do as follow
1.) Choose contribute
2.) Choose no perk
3.) Enter the amount of money you need to reach the perk you want. 
Example : You contributed $35 but you want a Grumpy Hedgehog, then you need to contribute at least $15 more
4.) Please leave a comment saying which perk you want to upgrade to after you’ve made a contribution!

— Ordering more than 1 copy
If you want to order more than 1 copy, please do as follow:
CASE 1 : You haven’t contributed
1.) Choose contribute now
2.) Choose the perk you want to contribute
3.) On top of the minimum amount of the perk, you can add $20 for 1 copy or $25 for a signed copy
Example : You want GRUMPY HEDGEHOG level and an extra copy and another signed copy, you’ll need to pay $50 + $20 + $25 = $95
4.) Please leave a comment saying how many extra copies you want.

CASE 2 : You have already contributed
1.) Choose contribute now
2.) Choose no perk
3.) In the amount field, add $20 for 1 copy or $25 for a signed copy
Example : You want an extra copy and another signed copy, you’ll need to pay $20 + $25 = $45
4.) Please leave a comment saying how many extra copies you want.



I'm Piti Yindee from Thailand and I'm the creator of the webcomic, Wuffle. 'Wuffle' is a free webcomic about everyday life of Wuffle, the big nice wolf and his friends in the Gingerbread Village. The comic has its own proper website that updates every Wednesday, as well as other social network outlets such as Tumblr or Facebook. There is also a Japanese version on Pixiv.

When I said Wuffle is a free webcomic, I meant Free-As-In-Freedom. The webcomic uses CC0 1.0 or “NO COPYRIGHT”. That simply means 'Wuffle' comic is free for everyone. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, anyway you want.
 
For more information of what you can do with Wuffle, see Wuffle free license
 
I want Wuffle to be a comic for everyone. I want to bring back the old charms of the good’ old classic cartoon that we saw when we were young. And I hope you enjoy the comic, and will come to love Wuffle the same way that I have. ^^
 
Read the comics here : Wuffle Comics Official Website
Or download and read at once (latest comic updated) : Download

This campaign is made for you to help me make "Wuffle" into a real, color printed book! The book will include:
  • All of the comics from its first year (14th Febuary 2012 - 13th February 2013)
  • All comics will be proofread by a professional proofreader as well as fixing any errors from the webcomic version
  • Special illustrations made for the book by me and several guest artists
  • Behind-the-scene sketches
All of these will be printed in a hard-cover A5-size full color 100-page book. Limited for this campaign only.




Since I'm self publishing the book, I'll need your help to make this book come true. The money will be spent on the publishing process as well as hiring a professional English proofreader to help editing the comic.
 
I'm thinking of printing around 500 copies, but this could change depending on how well the campaign go! You can help me by choosing the perks you like on the right side.

All of the perks with physical rewards already include worldwide shipping cost, so you don't need to add anymore money for shipping. 
 
Also, this is a Fixed Funding. This means the book will be printed only when I reach the goal before the deadline. If this campaign doesn't reach the goal, you will get a refund, and the book won't be printed. Even if the campaign fail, I will still continue drawing Wuffle for you, and hopefully I can try again in the future ^^

Obviously, you'll get the first print of the book! But that's not all, by supporting me, you can have your name on the book as one of the sponsors, a signed copy of the book, and many more stuffs from me! Here are the pictures for more details :



Honestly, I don't have a plan for stretch goals yet! I have some ideas like making an exclusive comic for the book, more extra pages, a calendar, etc. I don't know! Currently, I'm just happy enough if the campaign could reach the goal. 
 
One thing for sure though, any money exceed from the goal will help support me in the future and help me able to keep drawing Wuffle. Currently the comic is update once a week, but if I make enough from this, it would allow me to update the comic more often ^^


I know that not everyone can support the campaign with money even if they want to. Like I said earlier, Wuffle is free for everyone. You can help me by spreading the comic or this campaign.
 
If this campaign succeed, the book will also be available digitally for everyone in both JPG and PSD format. You are free to do whatever you want with the digital version of the book. You can print it and make a physical copy for yourself. You can even sell it in your area if you want to!
