The comic has its own proper website that updates every Wednesday, as well as other social network outlets such as Tumblr or Facebook. There is also a Japanese version on Pixiv.
When I said Wuffle is a free webcomic, I meant Free-As-In-Freedom. The webcomic uses CC0 1.0 or “NO COPYRIGHT”. That simply means 'Wuffle' comic is free for everyone. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, anyway you want.
 
For more information of what you can do with Wuffle, see Wuffle free license

 
I want Wuffle to be a comic for everyone. I want to bring back the old charms of the good’ old classic cartoon that we saw when we were young. And I hope you enjoy the comic, and will come to love Wuffle the same way that I have. ^^
 
Read the comics here : Wuffle Comics Official WebsiteOr download and read at once (latest comic updated) : Download

This campaign is made for you to help me make "Wuffle" into a real, color printed book! The book will include:


All of the comics from its first year (14th Febuary 2012 - 13th February 2013)
All comics will be proofread by a professional proofreader as well as fixing any errors from the webcomic version
Special illustrations made for the book by me and several guest artists
Behind-the-scene sketches


All of these will be printed in a hard-cover A5-size full color 100-page book. Limited for this campaign only.

Since I'm self publishing the book, I'll need your help to make this book come true. The money will be spent on the publishing process as well as hiring a professional English proofreader to help editing the comic.
 
I'm thinking of printing around 500 copies, but this could change depending on how well the campaign go! You can help me by choosing the perks you like on the right side.All of the perks with physical rewards already include worldwide shipping cost, so you don't need to add anymore money for shipping. 
 
Also, this is a Fixed Funding. This means the book will be printed only when I reach the goal before the deadline. If this campaign doesn't reach the goal, you will get a refund, and the book won't be printed. Even if the campaign fail, I will still continue drawing Wuffle for you, and hopefully I can try again in the future ^^




Obviously, you'll get the first print of the book! But that's not all, by supporting me, you can have your name on the book as one of the sponsors, a signed copy of the book, and many more stuffs from me! Here are the pictures for more details :



Honestly, I don't have a plan for stretch goals yet! I have some ideas like making an exclusive comic for the book, more extra pages, a calendar, etc. I don't know! Currently, I'm just happy enough if the campaign could reach the goal. 
 
One thing for sure though, any money exceed from the goal will help support me in the future and help me able to keep drawing Wuffle. Currently the comic is update once a week, but if I make enough from this, it would allow me to update the comic more often ^^

I know that not everyone can support the campaign with money even if they want to. Like I said earlier, Wuffle is free for everyone. You can help me by spreading the comic or this campaign.
 
If this campaign succeed, the book will also be available digitally for everyone in both JPG and PSD format. You are free to do whatever you want with the digital version of the book. You can print it and make a physical copy for yourself. You can even sell it in your area if you want to!

story:
The over-achieving teenager Amanda Polias expected her ailing adopted mother to die, but not in terror... right in front of her eyes. Amanda concocts a crazy scheme to temporarily stop her own heart and provoke a near-death experience. Her spirit journeys to the afterlife long enough to see a terrifying vortex engulfing the souls of the dead.

Hunted by demons and shades, Amanda and her loyal clay golem join forces with an immortal Greek warrior and a Zulu fairy in the hopes of making things right. Her journey to discover the culprit will take her through the Egyptian underworld, into the North Sea, and to the Grand Shrine of Japan, all to answer a single question… who would dare disrupt death itself? 

 

What We Need & What You Get!

Mythkillers was successfully funded via Kickstarter this summer, but we're turning to Indiegogo to continue offering our backer rewards while we set up a more permanent online store. From the $1 pledge for a single digital comic issue, all the way up to jewelry swag and embossed hardcover collectors' editions, our variety of rewards offers a wide palette for different budgets and levels of commitment.

Please Note:

*  All displays of rewards are mock-ups, and may not reflect the visual appearance of the final products. As more artwork gets completed, we'll be able to post samples to this page.

*  International supporters should consider digital reward packages (The Broke Classics Student, the Symposium, or The Heavenly Wisdom Special) because they have no additional shipping charges or shipping time.

 

Add-ons

We're happy to announce that backers can now pick and choose the rewards they wish to receive.  Just use the Indiegogo perk system to customize your reward package.  PLEASE NOTE: Pledges with only digital rewards don't have the option to buy add-ons in order to keep international shipping charges consistent across all reward packages. Those who wish to purchase a mix of physical and digital rewards should start with one of the other packages.

Sample Covers (Low-Res)

Mythkillers, Issue 1 (Original and Prestige Covers)

 

Mythkillers, Issue 2 (Original and Prestige Covers)

 

Mythkillers, Issue 3 (Original and Prestige Covers)

 

The Creative Team

Vicente Cifuentes: Illustrator & Inker

Born in the small, beautiful Spanish city of Albacete, Vicente Cifuentes works as a gifted 20-year veteran of the comics industry. He has devoted his considerable penciling and inking skills to some of the largest publishers around the world, including Marvel, DC Comics, Dynamite Entertainment, Glénat, and Soleil, among many, many others. Some of the most notable titles under his belt include Aquaman, Batgirl, Xena: Warrior Princess, and a comic book adaptation of The War of the Worlds by H. G. Wells. 

 

Mateo Guerrero Cruz: Illustrator

Born in Cadiz, Spain in 1976, Mateo Guerrero boasts an illustrious career among some of the most prominent publications in Europe. His first published work was Crónicas de Mesene in 1998. Then, he created Cazadores en la Red, a comic strip published by Idibus, a supplement for the newspaper El País, the most widely read online newspaper in Spain. In 2001, Mateo broke through into the English language market, drawing Warlands: Age of Ice, for the studio DreamWave. Then, Guerrero conquered the Franco-Belgian market, producing DragonSeed in 2006 for the publisher Humanoïdes Associés. He enjoys a long-running collaboration with publisher Le Lombard that began in 2008 that saw the release of the post-apocalyptic adventure story Beast, the fantasy series Turo in 2011, the grand Roman Empire epic Gloria Victis, and the recent dark historical thriller Jakob Kayne.

 

Juancho Vélez: Colorist

Juancho is a passionate, ambitious comic book colorist and illustrator who graduated from the Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art located in Dover, New Jersey. Ever since 2012, Juancho has studied color and its nuances as a means to enhance storytelling. He has dedicated his vivid hues to prominent publishers, such as IDW, Aspen Comics, Madefire, Chapter House, Darby Pop, Devil’s Due, Markosia, Zenescope, and even one small gig for DC Comics (which he hopes will blossom into something much bigger in the future!). Born and raised in Bogota, Colombia, he has ventured across the globe in pursuit of his dreams. He’s lived on and explored both the east and west coasts of the USA. Then, after learning his craft, Juancho forged new friendships and professional contacts in the comic book industry. They enabled him to relocate to Barcelona, Spain where he has plied his artistic craft ever since. As a heavyweight in the world of American and European comics, Spain provided a wonderful creative environment that encouraged Juancho to grow immensely as an artist. Finally, we almost forgot to mention that Juancho is currently on a worldwide search for the best cheeseburger in existence. Got any leads? 

 

Bill Tortolini: Letterer

Born and raised in the shadow of Boston, Bill Tortolini graduated from Salem State University. He has held the position of creative director for over two decades. In addition to working on large brands and advertisements for Fortune 500 companies, Bill also became deeply involved in the comics industry starting in 1996. Over the course of his vibrant career, he has lettered comics for some of the most prominent publishers in the world, including Marvel, Dynamite Entertainment, Random House, Disney, and Image Comics, among many others. Notable works include Marvel’s Anita Blake comics, the various adaptations of Robert Jordan’s bestselling Wheel of Time series, Stephen King’s The Talisman, Jim Butcher’s The Dresden Files, and George R. R. Martin’s The Hedge Knight and The Mystery Knight. Bill is an avid Boston sports fan, skier, golfer, and pop-culture aficionado. He lives in Billerica, Massachusetts, with his lovely wife, Kristen, their three children Abigail, Katherine, and Cameron, and his sometimes-loyal dog, Oliver. 

 

Chris Hepler: Writer

It is not certain that Chris Hepler had parents — according to the sacred texts of the 1970s, he was given life when Gary Gygax made a papier-mache golem out of discarded pages intended for a roleplaying game. After a short stint at the Johns Hopkins University where Chris was painted to resemble a human, he began working for such titles as Shadowrun, Earthdawn, and Legend of the Five Rings before pursuing screenwriting. In Los Angeles, he worked on a CBS Television drama The Agency and a Top Cow comic called M.I.T.H., but left for Canada, where the developer Bioware soon had him writing for such video games as Star Wars: The Old Republic and the Mass Effect trilogy.

There, he cemented his position as “that writer who actually cares about the science,” creating much of Mass Effect’s Codex, Galaxy Map, and Daily News. His launch-day Twitter event for Mass Effect 3, “Emily Wong Reports Live from UCLA,” made #solcomms the top-trending worldwide hashtag of the day, and yes, that means you can blame him for killing off several beloved characters.

Today, Chris is working for Seasun Games on a Pirates of the Caribbean video game as well as its comics arm. He enjoys dragon boating, herpetology, and as many martial arts as he can get his hands on. He lives in California with his wife, Jennifer Brandes Hepler, and their two loud children. 

 

Ed Benes: Cover Artist

Perhaps best known for his work on Birds of Prey, Justice League of America, and Batgirl for DC Comics, Ed Benes is one of the industry’s hottest talents! Following the successful launch of the first issue of his first creator-owned title Nina and Ariel, Ed is now hard at work on Issue 2, while also training the next generation of comic book artists at the Ed Benes Studio. 

 

Rafater (a.k.a. Rafael Teruel): Cover Artist

Rafater (whose superhero secret identity is Rafael Teruel) is a Spanish illustrator and masterclass artist. He studied Fine Arts in Barcelona and began his professional career 10 years ago when he discovered the power of digital art. He mainly works as an illustrator and has designed characters for several large companies and game projects, including Warhammer, Warhammer 40K, Legend of the Cryptids, Dragoborne, Infinity the game, and HEX TCG among many others.

He published several art books with Norma Editorial (Nightmare: Dark Gods), Design Studio Press (The Line Art Challenge), and Ediciones Babylon (EROS: The Sexiest Art of Rafater). He’s also the co-founder of the Creatuanary Challenge along with Dibujante Nocturno and Joshua Cairós. Together, they successfully executed their first crowdfunding campaign for the first Creatuanary published art book. Rafater is incredibly active on social media, especially on Instagram, where he has garnered almost 170,000 fans over two years. 

Currently, Rafater teaches part-time at Escola Joso and the Universitat la Salle while also aiding the development of some pretty fresh and amazing art projects that are under NDA (so he can’t talk about them! Don’t ask!)

 

Ediano Silva: Cover Artist

Ediano hit the ground running with his professional debut on the incredibly successful relaunch of Grimm Fairy Tales for Zenescope (v2 issues 1-3) and hasn’t let up since! Following his stint on GFT, Ediano illustrated the entire Pathfinder: Runescars series for Dynamite Entertainment, and then moved on to the comic book adaptation of the popular Microsoft video game Killer Instinct, while also adding nearly 20 cover illustrations whenever he had a free moment …and this was all completed in just his first year in the industry! Ediano is a workhorse with a finely detailed style, and the future is bright! Ediano just completed work on Vampirella / Dejah Thoris, and is just starting in on his new project (as yet unannounced).  

 

Rich Young: Art Director

Rich began his professional career in the U.S. comics industry over 20 years ago at Dark Horse Comics, and most recently finished a 9-year run as Director of Business Development for Dynamite Entertainment. His broad background spans editorial, licensing, marketing, and business development. Some of the graphic novels and art books Rich has edited or project managed include: Brandon Sanderson’s White Sand, Jim Butcher’s Dresden Files, Joe Abercrombie’s The First Law, Robert Jordan’s Wheel of Time, Charlaine Harris’ Grave Sight, Patricia Briggs’ Mercy Thompson, Paizo’s Pathfinder, Paramount’s The Warriors, Grumpy Cat, The Art of Atari, Undisputed Street Fighter: A 30th Anniversary Retrospective, and The Art of Tekken: A Complete Visual History.

A longtime resident of the beautiful Pacific Northwest, Rich lives, works and plays in Portland, Oregon. Rich is also the drummer in the local 5-man band Dear Drummer. The soul/funk/rock group regularly gig around town and have plans to go back into the studio to record their third album later this year.

 

Philip Daay: Managing Editor

Phil Daay serves as Lead Writer and Managing Editor for international game company Seasun, Inc.  He oversees his company’s narrative efforts to produce their online mobile game Pirates of the Caribbean: Sea of Glory in partnership with Disney.  He also supervises all aspects of production at his employer’s latest comic book publishing venture, called Seasun Comics.

In the film industry, Phil wrote the feature and short film adaptations of the critically-acclaimed comic series Black Salt.  The Black Salt short film recently won 1st Place in the Urban Action Showcase.  HBO/Cinemax agreed to broadcast the film and it thereafter gained over 3.3 million viewers on their platform.  His upcoming Sci-Fi/Thriller movie Abduct won distribution at the AFM.  His Psychological/Thriller Alone has recently completed post-production.  He also wrote the Horror movie Left in Darkness for legendary producer Stephen J. Cannell.

Phil strives to include three crucial elements in every story.  Stories should escalate into an emotional catharsis in the end. They should contain loads of suspense and keep audiences guessing.  Most importantly, stories should explore some aspect of what it means to be human, layered deeply into the Hero's tale. He applies this discipline and passion to every story and in every genre.

Phil currently lives in California with his wife and a toddler who loves to wander off and explore the wide open world.

 

And the last word...

We hope that this page answers all your Mythkillers questions, but just in case it doesn't, you can leave comments on the Indiegogo page or send an email to philip@seasungames.com. 

We've warned Phil that he might get a mountain of e-mails as soon as the Indiegogo goes live, so he's prepared. Or at least, we thought we warned him. Good luck, Phil!

In all seriousness...

 

Risks & Challenges

The Mythkillers series is currently in production. Publishing or manufacturing delays on the book or merchandise could arise due to unforeseen circumstances. Seasun Comics shall keep all Indiegogo donors informed about the publication of Mythkillers and the manufacturing/shipping status of all items. 

Donor packages that involve the review of scripts and story content (i.e. screenplay review) will require up to six months to fulfill, and are subject to the availability of Seasun Comics key employees giving direct feedback.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help out but have more time than funds, no worries. Spreading the word about our comic and our company is a great way to help out.

Be sure to like our Facebook group.

Our website www.seasuncomics.com often posts updates. Be sure to sign up for the newsletter.

We're /seasuncomics on Instagram.

On Twitter, follow @ComicsSeasun or @theotherhepler

And Indiegogo has its own share tools!

 

Why Indiegogo?

Let's address the elephant in the room. If we're a big gaming company, why are we crowdfunding an indie urban fantasy comic? To be clear, Seasun Comics doesn't need donations. The production artwork for the entire series is already 95% complete.

But crowdfunding is about more than just money.

We need Indiegogo because we're a small team without a distribution network. We're competing against 80+ years of legacy by the established publishers. We can't easily get Mythkillers into your local comics store. With Indiegogo, we can send the comics directly to you.

Also, we can't buy the most crucial thing for any new comics: fans. Crowdfunding gives us an amazing opportunity to invite fans to go on this journey with us.

Comics creators can only build fan communities up out of blood, sweat, and convention appearances until they have followers, mailing lists and Facebook groups. 

Lastly, Seasun is measuring the success of its new comic projects to see which of them seems viable enough to turn into a video game or movie. By supporting Mythkillers, you’re helping its chances of becoming something you can play or watch.  

Seasun Comics is our way to honor the tradition of our founders by bridging the gap between East and West.

Let's address the elephant in the room. If we're a big gaming company, why are we crowdfunding an indie urban fantasy comic? To be clear, Seasun Comics doesn't need donations. The production artwork for the entire series is already 95% complete.

We need Indiegogo because we're a small team without a distribution network. We're competing against 80+ years of legacy by the established publishers. We can't easily get Mythkillers into your local comics store. With Indiegogo, we can send the comics directly to you.
Also, we can't buy the most crucial thing for any new comics: fans. Crowdfunding gives us an amazing opportunity to invite fans to go on this journey with us.
Comics creators can only build fan communities up out of blood, sweat, and convention appearances until they have followers, mailing lists and Facebook groups. 
Lastly, Seasun is measuring the success of its new comic projects to see which of them seems viable enough to turn into a video game or movie. By supporting Mythkillers, you’re helping its chances of becoming something you can play or watch.  
Seasun Comics is our way to honor the tradition of our founders by bridging the gap between East and West.

story:
Hello,

My name is Stephanie and I have just finished my first graphic novel, "Machination". Here's a little more about the book:

In the year 6032, with the Earth abandoned long ago, the human population now resides on a Space Station surrounding the planet. This is the story of Nadily Tortalin, and is a tale for any person who has ever felt confused…

Nadily has been down on her luck, her entire life. She works in a humble office, traveling through time to solve murders of the past; helping to rewrite files that were deleted by some blundering fool years before.

A sudden and surprising event pulls her from her tedious lifestyle and into a world that she thought she had forgotten entirely. She finds herself falling down a path of mystery, murder and intrigue. Exploring further into this dark cavern of the unknown begins to put her own life in danger and she finds herself questioning her own existence; needing to know the truth about her past, present and future, but then discovering much more than she bargained for.

This multi-genre tale, asks the question, through love and dishonesty; who is deceiving the detective? We follow Nadily through her trials, from her tiresome routine into a world of dishonesty and action, will she be able to get over her own fears and to stop fighting the one thing she always craved: to be loved?

Because in Space, which way is up¿

In the gallery is a 21 page preview, in which, I feel you can get a feel of what the story is about, and take a look at the artwork. 

 

 

About the project 

I have been working on this project for the last year and have finally completed it. The book is 153 pages long and is a SCI-FI/ Family drama, mixed with a little mystery. 

I had the basic idea of the story about five years ago and have been developing it in my head ever since. It never really had an ending though, until I sat down and wrote out the 155 page long script. Then once I started drawing the characters, I felt a whole new excitement for the project, I could see them more clearly and felt that their story really needed to be told. 

So I went about thumbing out all the pages, noting which was the best way to begin and continue the project, after all this was my first time making a graphic novel, as my background is in animation. As the days went on of getting up early, and working late into the night, I found out somehting odd- I was not getting annoyed with the project and I never once thought that I would give up. This is probably a true sign that I felt really passionate about "Machination".  It is my first graphic novel and won't be my last.

 

Why I need funding

Apart from being that classic cliche of a poor artist, I really want to get this project off of the shelf, and into your hands! I am passionate about what I have produced and feel that it is a really enjoyable read. 

The book is available as a hard back or paper back, it's printed with full colour (on all pages), on luxurious matte paper.

 

 

 

 

I need money to also take my project to conventions, the cost of a table and the printing of more books is something that I really can't afford at the moment. And that's where you come in. With your help I can really start promoting the work, and let people know about it.

Please take some time to have a look at the rewards I offer, I hope to be hearing from you and that you will soon be enjoying reading about Nadily's journey.

 

If you can't contribute please help out anyways, you can spread the word! 

Please tell your friends, family, or anyone else you think might be interested in our project. Indiegogo also has social media sharing tools that make that sort of thing pretty easy.

Thank you so much, for anything you can give or do. 

 

Shipping Details:

Shipping for the comic is included for comics going to the UK. If you're international, please add 10 dollars to help us with shipping fees! We will ship anywhere. Keep in mind that books will be sent via regular post. 

NOTE: If you've already contributed, but forgot to add shipping, you can add it by clicking "Contribute now" and scrolling to the bottom of the list and selecting "No perk, just a contribution" and put 10 dollars for international orders. Thanks you!

story:
Feral: An Overview

Feral is the insight of a few months in the life of Hayley Rosa, a girl who has nothing but a bitter will to fight. Upon drifting to a new city to scrape a living hustling with her fists, she is beaten for the first time by the highly skilled Dr Brandt, a loss that came with personal consequence. It was a new and humiliating experience for her, something that she couldn't shake off and leave alone.

Upon learning that Brandt is the top tier of a prestigious fighting circuit based in the city, she joins up to prove herself and take the doctor down by beating him at his own game. Between them stand a set of brutally proficient and sometimes sadistic fighters from all over the world who test Hayley to the very brink of her ability.

Among the battles however, she neglects the demons rising up inside her with every fight, chewing at her morals and sanity, fueled by a past she cannot let go...

This comic is a little something I've had in the pipeline for the longest time. It's been revised and thought out to completion, but if a metaphor is needed, it's like a fully re-fuelled and completely booked flight heading for Babylon. It's ready to fly, but is yet to take off due to there being an elephant on the runway or something. 

Basically, I'm ready to move that elephant. All I need is funding and time. What I'm creating is almost a 'pilot', the first few chapters, introducing the main characters, a barrage of fisticuffs and ass kicking and generally making it an awesome intro to what I hope to be a complete series and the best first comic project I could hope to achieve.

While I've extensively worked on commissions all this time, I've always had to push aside the project to work and feed myself. I want to go the next step and create something personal and awesome.

What this means for you is you'll be treated to an orgasmic array of  Hayley dropping it hotter than Scott Adkins, as well as a funky fresh twist on your usual furry affair. Of course, contribution will not go unrewarded, as I have prepared a plethora of related goodies to say thankyou.

I hope to get this project started and finished in time for some of the other Aussie comic-cons, so I can throw it out and spread the word. The more hype this gets, the better and more awesome the final, complete story will be (not to mention quicker too). My idea is to get funding and start it in the new year (2013), spend two months drawing it up and a few weeks touch up and printing. Your contributions will mean that you will make sure I have the needed tools and supplies, and that I work on the project (AND NOTHING ELSE) to complete the first few chapters.

Even if you're just spreading the word, you have my utmost grattitude. Thankyou all!

My Deadline:

I am looking to have this completed by Furdu 2013 (April 26th), essentially in time for one of Australia's bigger furry conventions. I hope to get a stall there and hype the holy hell out of this comic, breathe fresh life into a comic genre that's over saturated with porn and/or fantasy. Once that's happened, Hayley's story can indeed continue and you'll get to see the awesome battles that she takes on.

Your contribution can be rewarded with:

  • downloadables and physical goodies
  • personal art related to the Feral universe
  • signed copies of the book
  • Cameo role in the comic in later installments (you get to fisticuff Hayley)

Just so you know, the comic is going forward regardless of the funding amount. It has already been started, but materials and equipment is still in demand for the pages I'm throwing out. Make it known if you are an overseas contributor so I can mail out any physical copies of the book etc etc.

Thank you all for your support!

story:
Welcome to the Feast or Famine Collected Edition - PRE ORDER Campaign!!!

Hello fellow comic book fan! I'm glad you've decided to check out this campaign. This is your chance to get a copy of the hit indie sci-fi series Feast or Famine!

If you have never seen or read the Feast or Famine comic book series before, I bet you're wondering what it's about. The quick and dirty answer is "A retro space adventure starring Nikola Tesla & Albert Einstein!" Sounds pretty cool, right? That's what I thought when I created this original comic book series for Alterna Comics 2 years ago. The final issue just hit stores this past April, and we are planning to collect all 3 issues into a beautiful, high quality, soft cover book! Featuring the entire original story, and some extras we'll we revealing soon!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This will be the only chance to reserve a copy of this special collected edition before anyone has a chance to. Issue 2 has already SOLD OUT, and the others are very close, so it's safe to say, this collected edition will be in high demand!

Along with the book, you'll also have exclusive access to other Feast or Famine Rewards including, t-shirts, stickers, prints, commissions, and more! See below for a FULL PERK GALLERY!

Our goal is $5,000 and all of it will be going straight into the printing & shipping costs of this campaign.


 

Who am I, and who is Alterna Comics?

My name is Dave Swartz and it's a pleasure to meet you! I'm a comic book creator that has been writing, drawing, coloring and lettering comics for 5 years.

In 2015 I self published a Graphic Novel called Atlas:ORGINS about a metaphysical superhero. I've contributed to several short stories in the anthologies 'It Came Out on a Wednesday', and the 'IF' series from Alterna. Feast or Famine is my first published series that I both wrote and colored along with industry veteran Joseph Cooper (Flash, Bloodshot). I'm also currently illustrating and coloring two other projects I can't talk about yet, shhhhh....

I've also ran 4 successful crowd funding campaigns totaling over $20,000!

                                     

Alterna Comics has been publishing comics and graphic novels for almost 15 years. Their titles are distributed worldwide in books stores and online in the old-style newsprint from the 90's!  Their titles include all genres and age ranges, with stories that truly bring alternative stories to the indie comics landscape. With titles like the critically acclaimed the Chair, Trespasser, Cyko-Ko, Midnight Mystery, the Wicked Righteous, and many more!

 

Perk Gallery

Get a closer look at all the perk options for this campaign including, a T-Shirt, 5 Art Prints,  Single Issue Comics, and  Commission Examples...

 

Risks & Challenges

The best part about this campaign is, the book it ALL DONE! It just needs to go to print and they will be ready and waiting at your door before the end of the year!

story:
Just Say Uncle book #3 compiles all of the daily comic strips that appeared on Universal Press Syndicate's GoComics website in 2015!

 

There are some great perks available, including signed, framed original artwork, and a chance for YOU to appear in an upcoming strip and be immortalized as a cartoon character! Yes, YOU!!

The foreward was written by my former Kenosha News editor, Craig Swanson, the man who actually gave me a career in comics and music journalism. There's a nice recounting of how we met, which ultimately resulted in this series of Just Say Uncle books! 

The majority of the pre-order money that you contribute will go to the production costs of actually printing the books. I'm not skimping or cutting any corners, all strips will be printed as they originally ran, in glorious full color! 

Everyone who contributes will also receive the annual Just Say Uncle Christmas card that I send out every year!

Thank you for your support,

Dan P.

story:
THE HEAVY METAL LOVIN' REDNECK BAD ASS IS ON A QUEST FOR WOMEN AND BOOZE! BUT HE ALWAYS FINDS HIMSELF STUCK IN THE MIDDLE OF AN ANCIENT BATTLE BETWEEN THE GODS!

Joe Ball cover!

 

WHAT IS THIS?

DRAGOON KNIGHT ALDRAKE is an on going comic series in the style of an adult cartoon (South Park, Family Guy) with super hero action sequences. DRAGOON KNIGHT ALDRAKE: The Legendary Hero is the newest volume, a 140 page manga sized graphic novel by Matt Wenger.

 

STORY

It's been 75 years since Thomas Slugo sacrificed himself to stop an alien invasion that nearly destroyed his world. All over the planet Caliginus, Slugo is heralded as the greatest hero the world has ever known. As a selfish drunk redneck who grew up in a cave, Aldrake Razvalon isn't that guy. In a shocking revelation, Aldrake and sidekick Yoshi find Slugo has apparently returned to the side of the living. How and why? Worse they are in opposition to the great hero. Yoshi is an immortal sphinx who once fought alongside Slugo and knows first hand what Aldrake would be up against. Needless to say, it's a bad situation.
 



TWO HILARIOUS AND ACTION PACKED GRAPHIC NOVELS AVAILABLE!

DRAGOON KNIGHT ALDRAKE: The Legendary Hero will be a self contained story that is designed to introduce the titular hero and the world he lives in to a new audience. This fun comedic adventure will also feature a meta-narrative about the importance of heroes in popular culture and society.

DRAGOON KNIGHT ALDRAKE: Aldrake VS Chronah's Knights is a 200 page black and white graphic novel that tells Aldrake's origin story. It is an older book that doesn't have the higher production values of The Legendary Hero but is an important volume in the story of our hero. As self contained story it isn't necessary to read Aldrake VS Chronah's Knights to enjoy The Legendary Hero.

 

ALDRAKE VS CHRONAH'S KNIGHTS SPECIAL NARWHAL COVER ONLY AVAILABLE ON INDIEGOGO!

story:
Hybrids: The Sons of Gods "Trash Day" is a full-color standard sized comic spanning a 5 issue mini series.

ALL 5 issues successfully funded and ready for distrobution!

 

Who will like this series?

Hybrids is an action/adventure story set around the advent of a new super human species.  It includes theories surrounding the NEPHILIM and ANCIENT ALIENS set against a fast paced rescue attempt.  This series will appeal to you if you like the following...

  • Superheroes
  • Obscure History
  • Greek Mythology
  • Nephilim
  • Conspiracy Theories
  • Religious Lore
  • Movies like "Taken"

 

The Story So Far...

A brief look at what Hybrids: The Sons of Gods really is. 

 

 

Not the Typical Superheroes...

There are no magic hammers or vats of toxic chemicals that produce these heroes.  Rather, the origin of our HYBRIDS can find it's roots in several major religions.  The book of Genesis talks about a monumental event in the 6th chapter when it recounts the "Sons of God" coming to Earth and finding the daughters of men to be attractive.  These attractions lead to unholy unions that produce a human/angel HYBRID called the Nephilim.

Stories of the Nephilim predate the Greek Gods by several hundred years and many scholars believe that the stories of Zuess and the other gods where just exagerations of true stories about these Nephilim.

Imagine that these accounts are all true and not only did these creatures exist, but they continued to reproduce with humans.  Eventually these Nephilim traits and abilities would subside, but the genetic code would still remain.  What if walking around us right now we had the real life ancestors of the Greek Gods?  What if something were to happen to cause these recessive Nephilim traits to wake up?

In Hybrids: The Sons of Gods, that is exactly what happens.  People begin to develop God-like abilities seemingly out of nowhere.  This however, is not the whole story.  Just as quickly as these individuals begin to develop these fantastical powers, they also start to vanish.  All that is known is that they are being taken.

We follow a band of intrepid heroes who seek the answers to 3 questions.  Who is taking these people, where are they taking these people, and why are they taking these people.

Very personal connections fuel this endoevour as we descover corporate greed, human trafficking rings, and genetic experimentation at the root of this new epidemic.

 

Issue 1-4 Recap (Spoilers)

 

The Goal:

Star Cross Comics brings you the exciting conclusion of writer/artist Luke Stone's five part debut series of Hybrids: The Sons of Gods "Trash Day".  This exciting and fast paced 24 page comic reveals the horrific truth behind why these people are being abducted.  We also get our first look at the sinister characters behind it all.  

"Trash Day Part 5" features some amazing work from the creative team of Stone and Gama.  The progression in art and story telling reaches a new hight with this latest issue.  New threats, staggering loss, and intense drama drive you from page to page.  Don't miss out as the entire cast has assembled for this exciting conclusion!

This book is completely funded and the production is 100% complete.  This campaign is simply to distribute the project!

A brief look at what Hybrids: The Sons of Gods really is. 

 
 

Not the Typical Superheroes...
There are no magic hammers or vats of toxic chemicals that produce these heroes.  Rather, the origin of our HYBRIDS can find it's roots in several major religions.  The book of Genesis talks about a monumental event in the 6th chapter when it recounts the "Sons of God" coming to Earth and finding the daughters of men to be attractive.  These attractions lead to unholy unions that produce a human/angel HYBRID called the Nephilim.
Stories of the Nephilim predate the Greek Gods by several hundred years and many scholars believe that the stories of Zuess and the other gods where just exagerations of true stories about these Nephilim.
Imagine that these accounts are all true and not only did these creatures exist, but they continued to reproduce with humans.  Eventually these Nephilim traits and abilities would subside, but the genetic code would still remain.  What if walking around us right now we had the real life ancestors of the Greek Gods?  What if something were to happen to cause these recessive Nephilim traits to wake up?
In Hybrids: The Sons of Gods, that is exactly what happens.  People begin to develop God-like abilities seemingly out of nowhere.  This however, is not the whole story.  Just as quickly as these individuals begin to develop these fantastical powers, they also start to vanish.  All that is known is that they are being taken.
We follow a band of intrepid heroes who seek the answers to 3 questions.  Who is taking these people, where are they taking these people, and why are they taking these people.
Very personal connections fuel this endoevour as we descover corporate greed, human trafficking rings, and genetic experimentation at the root of this new epidemic.
 
Issue 1-4 Recap (Spoilers)

 
The Goal:
Star Cross Comics brings you the exciting conclusion of writer/artist Luke Stone's five part debut series of Hybrids: The Sons of Gods "Trash Day".  This exciting and fast paced 24 page comic reveals the horrific truth behind why these people are being abducted.  We also get our first look at the sinister characters behind it all.  
"Trash Day Part 5" features some amazing work from the creative team of Stone and Gama.  The progression in art and story telling reaches a new hight with this latest issue.  New threats, staggering loss, and intense drama drive you from page to page.  Don't miss out as the entire cast has assembled for this exciting conclusion!
This book is completely funded and the production is 100% complete.  This campaign is simply to distribute the project!

story:
The story of Cybernetic Punk takes place in the year 2138. Because of natural disasters and nuclear war, mankind lives in dome protected cities all across the globe.   They have colonized some of the planets and moons in the solar system, but colonist permission is granted to few and is sought after by many.  However, humanity has continued to evolve in their domed cities and thus the cyberpunk element of our story.

In the future world of Cybernetic Punk, cybernetics have become as common as cosmetic surgery in our time. Everything from cybernetic limbs to chip implants that enhance vision or connect the user to the global network. Because of the rise in cybernetic associated crime a special task force, Cybersquad, was started.
                                                   

        

Cybernetic punk is a story I first wrote some 25 years ago. At the time the "Cyberpunk" role-playing game (old school tabletop game. Remember... this is 25 or so years ago ;-) ) had just come out and I was really feeling the Cyberpunk/ Blade Runner vibe. But as with many stories, it ended up in my desk drawer only to be brought out now and again.

About a year or so ago, while going through the attic I stumbled upon a pile of sketches, notes, and rough layouts of the 25-year old, still unnamed  project . The characters, their backstory, the backstory of the city and world that this took place in, all still excited me. Even after all this time.

I'm not getting any younger and it won't happen on its own!  We've all heard or seen stories of elderly people who regret SO many things they didn't do in life. So many dreams that they kept putting off until it was too late. The older we get the stronger those feelings become. Now, I don't consider 44 as being old. I'm not kicking the bucket quite yet, but I sure as heck don't want to be that bitter old man who didn't go after his dreams of making comics.  

Over the years my skills as an artist and storyteller have improved and now I feel that I'm finally at a level where I can take on a project like this and do it justice.

So...I'm going for it! It's go time!  
         

The book will be:

  • 21.59cm X 27.94cm (8.5in X 11in) The typical size of a European comic album.
  • Full-color covers
  • Over 60 pages of black & white Film Noir, cyberpunk goodness.

Sample below and more pages available at Cybernetic Punk online.

        

         

        

                          

           More pages available at Cybernetic Punk online.


                 

               

                

                 

            

    So where is the money going? I'm not planning a huge print run. My plan is just to get this out there in the hands of you the readers and hope that you love it enough that you want more.  A big chunk is for printing and shipping of the book. I plan to use a fulfillment service to pack and ship the book because doing it from here in Sweden would cost an arm and a leg.  About 20% will go for the rewards/perks like sketch cards, posters etc. Then miscellaneous fees like Indiegogo. 

    And speaking of rewards...

               

              

              

              

            

              

            

            

              

               

               

    Risks & Challenges

    This is my first time dipping my toes in crowdfunding so I have spent countless hours researching EVERYTHING to hopefully avoid any possible pitfalls. 

    The biggest hurdle as an independent creator is juggling the time needed to devote to this project with everyday life and responsibilities. With the day-time job and being a father of three, the natural layout of my life can cause delays to happen when issues arise at home. I have, however, tried to accommodate time for any potential delays into my estimate.

    I understand the faith that backers have in me and my project so I'll be very transparent about everything that goes into the production of this book by posting frequent and timely updates and being quick to notify backers of any setbacks. 

    This is a life long dream. I have no wishes for it to turn into a nightmare for anyone. :-)

story:
My dream is to bring my script 'Dead Man's Land' to life in full glorious colour and eventually, via the Graphic Novel, get it onto a big screen near you.

Because of 277 amazing contributors I have been able to get this process started. Steve Stern and his crew are hard at work on the adaptation and artwork. Now I need your help to get it completed.

The Walking Dead & Hell Boy are a couple of successful examples of Graphic Novels that have made it to TV and the big screen - There are many more.

Graphic Novels are a great way for producers to visualize a story rather than just reading it on the page.

Logline:

"A squad of battle-hardened US paratroopers find themselves in mortal combat against a pack of genetically-altered Nazi Werewolves, with the outcome of the Second World War hanging in the balance."

I need $7,500 to make the final payment and complete this journey.

* Script to Graphic Novel adaptation by LA based Steve Stern

--STEVE STERN, creator of Zen Intergalactic Ninja and author of the BEOWULF, A CHRISTMAS CAROL and WAR OF THE WORLDS Graphic Novels

"There’s never been a World War II story quite like DEAD MAN’S LAND.  What could be cooler than a bunch of courageous paratroopers in bloody combat with  a pack of genetically-altered Nazi werewolves, with the outcome of the War in the balance?  This is going to make a great graphic novel, and one hell of a film!"

[Click on the external "WEBSITE" link below  to read more about Steve Stern]

* Artist

* Colourist

I have no doubt that each and everyone of you have a dream. I need your help to achieve mine.

If you can't help with funds please pass this forward to your friends. Your word of mouth could make all the difference.

story:
Who are you and what is this comic about?

20 Fingerprints is the story of a young woman, Rebecca, who just happens to have four arms.  She is accused of murdering her roommate's father and becomes involved with a doctor who wants to "fix" her.  The comic is a self-contained story spanning 22 pages.

My name is Amy Lynn Duengfelder and I am a cartoonist and illustrator living in Buffalo, NY.  I studied at both Pratt at MWP and the School of Visual Arts, where I majored in Cartooning.

What are you doing with the funds?

With the funds, I will be printing 20 Fingerprints into 5"x8" size books.  If I do not reach my funding goal, I will still use what I receive to print as many as I can and fulfill the perks.

Speaking of perks, here is what you will receive for contributing:

  • $5 will get a digital PDF of the comic and a thank you on my website.
  • $10 will get a copy of the comic shipped anywhere in the world, and everything in the $5 tier.
  • $20 will get a signed copy of the comic and everything in the $5 tier.
  • $50 will get a 20 Fingerprints tote bag, a spot on the thank you page in the comic, and everything in the $20 tier.
  • $75 will get a personalized sketch and everything in the $50 tier.
  • $150 will get an original page from the comic and everything in the $75 tier.

How else can I help?

Even if you can't contribute, I would be very thankful if you can spread the word about this campaign!

Also, please check out the comic as it is posted on my website, www.amylynnamylynn.com!

Thank you!

story:
Who is CFGodwell and what is Nukleus Comics?

Corey F. Godwell is the Bronx, New York born co-creator and artist of Nukleus first release 'The Boy from Planet A' (2011). A veteran Graphic Designer and a lifelong comics collector, Corey along with childhood friend DaShen (Author of sci-fi novel The Rueful), decided to apply his illustrative talents into trying his hand at his own book. Some of the mainstream comics he grew up on were being contorted to suit Hollywood ambitions, much to his dislike. With just 8 pages completed (and liking what he saw) a computer accident wiped out the original 8 pages. Regathering and totally replacing the lost pages, he pushed forward and completed what became 'The Boy from Planet A', which told the story of a boy named Noah and his objective of retrieving a black box (of sorts) that contained the data of the previous earth that functions as present earths 'Heaven'. Instead of shopping the property (and with the assistance of friend and printer Dan Hort of Enterprise Press), he and DaShen decided to form indie label Nukleus Comics, work the shows (NYCC, NYCBMarketplace and Bronx Heroes Con) and slowly add more titles as demand and finances allowed.

Nukleus would focus on a diverse cast of characters that featured "real everyday people" (not just Super Models) who have found themselves thrust into epic situations. The titles under Nukleus are Sci-fi based and will focus on human, metaphysics and social issues such as social engineering, climate change, spiritual warfare, championing physical handicaps, the effects of social engineering and how the real world would react to humans endowed with cosmic powers and the potential to mass murder. Imagine a world faced with a human/spiritual/cosmic evolution, the likes of which they have never seen...with flawed humans who could wipe out a city block, should they choose the wrong path. A child or a loved one who is now deemed a threat? Infants that are human bombs should they become irate? Children and family hunted down, should it be decided that they are the 'wrong' race or religion while possessing such abilities. Real comics for real people in world turned upside down almost overnight.

With three #1 titles being released at the New York Comic Con, Nukleus is making its official maiden voyage into the thriving and changing world of independent comic book publishing. With the creative obstacles in good hands, the second hurdle to cover is the financial backing, and that is where this campaign plays one of the more critical roles. This is the fuel that will help us set sail and push these creations and the Nukleus brand out to the public to compete with, not only the Big Two, but the hundreds of other properties being released on a weekly basis. We are confident in our product and with your assistance, we will show you why it is a worthy investment. Any amount is acceptable because any amount is appreciated. Every dollar is a step and brings us closer to fulfilling our end of this venture.

Our Titles

  • The Boy from Planet A - An oddly mature speaking teenage boy shows up in 1979 Bronx, New York to solicit the help of two local heroes to secure a 'black box' (of sorts) that he claims hold the data of his dying planet that he calls "Old Earth" and that it surrounds everything on this planet. He even claims it could be Heaven to our own earth. Children do lie.

    This is the jump on point to the entire Nukleus universe. A must have.

  • NUKLEUS: 'Born Into This' - The follow up to 'The Boy from Planet A' and the repercussions that follow. A girl named Nikki has a secret. She decides to tell her best friend who can't hold water and has a penchant for trouble, but this is not a schoolyard secret. Its one that can unlock an interplanetary power source that takes the best or the worst in us and literally...well, check out the preview. (by Corey F Godwell)

  • Cold Shoulder - After being crime-free for nearly three decades New York is thrust into mayhem after its protector mysteriously disappears. It’s been five years since Swift Justice, the city’s omnipresent hero vanished and NYPD is clueless how to handle the surge in crime. Amidst the virtual lawlessness, a physically challenged, psychotic, alcoholic with a third of his torso covered in an organic steel, Cold Shoulder, turns hired gun to turn chaos into cash. After deciding to take a job to find a boys missing mother as a favor to a friend, he soon learns easy money ain’t so easy. (by Da'Shen)

  • Butterfly Sundae - Its 1981 America. Sklyab had fallen. Ronald Reagan is the President. Video hadn't yet killed radio. The nuclear threat still lingered. "Adults cause way more s#!% than we kids do". Meet Papillon, Butter, Chick P, Liz, Pristine, Oh!Donna and friends as they make their mark in the most decadent of times and thru the eyes, hearts and words of the boys who shaped their lives around winning the affections of these unique and mischievous girls.

    "We can do what we want and just go to confession on Sunday"
    (by F.Corey)
  • Wunderkind - In a not so distant future NYC, a small band of children unknowingly discover a wormhole deep within a sealed off portion of the New York City subway system that leads to nexus of all things. They discover a world that thrives on the imagination and dreams of everyone in the universe. A universal data bank, of sorts...and its been taken under siege by the benefactor children of a long dead universe who survive on consuming hope and dreams. Naturally, they have got to be stopped, but there is a price that these kids are not ready to pay. (A/W: CFGodwell)

What We Need & What You Get

Now, as you can see, we have set our goal at $5700. This is the nearly the bare minimum to fund decent sized small print runs of 200+ issues per book and that is 3 titles plus ashcans of to more titles. We also factored in the cost of a table at the New York Comic Con, posters, prints and to finance the sculpting of bust of one of the main characters (Nuklear Woman) that we will be accepting pre-orders for at the show. A nice portion of the pledge funds will go toward the sculptures artist fee. A third of it will go toward the production fees for the trade paperback/graphic novel of the collected 'Nukleus: Born Into This' that will be released Q1 of 2013. The remainder will go toward convention fees, in which NYC is the most expensive in the nation. In exchange for your help, you receive some nice gift packs loaded with an arsenal of goodies that allow us to show our gratitude. Indiegogo calls them 'perks'. Let me explain.

Every pledge is basically a purchase with perks. To show our appreciation, the basic $15 pledge, you will receive autographed versions of the The Boy from Planet A , Born into This#1 (BIT) by CFGodwell, Sci-fi epic Cold Shoulder#1 by DaShen and a signed (pledge only) ashcans of the Manga themed futuristic adventure Wunderkind and what sure to be an 80's pop-cult nostalgic Butterfly Sundae, which is about a group of wayward Catholic School girls growing up in NYC in 1980's America. The $25 pledge is a bit meatier. Not only will the you receive the Nukleus logo tee (to be shipped Oct 7th or available for pickup at the NYCC), but you will also receive signed copies of all three #1 releases (BFPA, BIT and Cold Shoulder) and all subsequent ashcans. The $50 pledge includes the three signed releases, the Nukleus t-shirt, the ashcans, the giant sized Nukleus poster, the NYCC exclusive Nuklear woman bonus t-shirt and signed Nukleus: Born into This graphic novel/trade or all three issue of BIT instead.

As the pledges rise, the perks get sweeter. Some ($100 pledge) will include all three #1 along with the upcoming Nuklear Woman (sculpted by Chris Torres) and your name included in the special 'thank you' section of the Nukleus: Born Into This graphic novel. There will also be a later pledge that will see your name included in the actual story (see Your Perks) and possibly star you as an extra, but more on that later.This is the ground floor of something big. We want to immortalize those who made it possible.



In the event that we cannot reach our pledge goal, we will honor all pledges made and cut our run accordingly. While its always risk of running short, especially at an even as large as the NYCC, the people that made it all happen are who come first and foremost. All pledged items are to be placed aside and shipped as a package upon completion and before the Comic Con itself. With the exception of the Nukleus: BIT graphic novel, which will not be available until Quarter 1 2013. If we surpass the goal? Then we put the remainder of funds toward putting Butterfly Sundae into production. Not one dime will be wasted.

What difference does it make if I contribute or not?

ALL the difference. Period. Without gas, we cannot get this vehicle moving.

With the big two gradually moving more into the Hollywood end of the comics business, we independents are converging on the back to basics approach of "great story, great art, satisfied customer" Would we ever take a shot at a feature film if the script was right and the property was in good hands? Sure! But we are all about SOURCE MATERIAL FIRST and foremost. The kind of books we were raised on during the closing of the Silver Age. Fun books, with great stories and memorable characters that we could actually get attached to. Back then, the books did not rely on the 'Shocking Death of the Month' to sell a comic. The books sold themselves and the legion of fans grew up with these characters, sometimes cried when a story called for one to pass on and cheered for the occasional resurrection. That is how it used to be. the formula worked then and we are going to make it work now. Hollywood does not create these characters and movie tickets should be an addition to the books allure. Not the defining quality of the character. We want to take it back to basics and we need your help to get it done.

Diverse characters that each and every reader can imagine themselves in that fantastic situation. No stereotypical names and dialect that often leave readers like myself shaking our heads. These are books that that use culture as an asset and show the effects it has on the decision making of a person now physically endowed with a way to make change.

While we are not reinventing the wheel, its already been done, we are definitely navigating down a different road with our precious creations and this delicate universe we have created. Join us.

Giving a pledge is not the only way to help.

These are difficult times and if we are asking for pledges, then we cannot always expect people to have to contribute. What you can do is spread the word using the social networking tools such as Facebook and Twitter that Indiegogo supplies. We would greatly appreciate it and surrogates that are out there on the ground pushing our brand, will be rewarded as such.We are paying attention we will have goodies like digital versions of our books on Graphicly, T-Shirts, on standby for those who help us push the brand, if for no other reason but good faith.

Thank you for you time and please, wish us luck!

Its one that can unlock an interplanetary power source that takes the best or the worst in us and literally...well, check out the preview. (by Corey F Godwell)


Cold Shoulder - After being crime-free for nearly three decades New York is thrust into mayhem after its protector mysteriously disappears. It’s been five years since Swift Justice, the city’s omnipresent hero vanished and NYPD is clueless how to handle the surge in crime. Amidst the virtual lawlessness, a physically challenged, psychotic, alcoholic with a third of his torso covered in an organic steel, Cold Shoulder, turns hired gun to turn chaos into cash. After deciding to take a job to find a boys missing mother as a favor to a friend, he soon learns easy money ain’t so easy. (by Da'Shen)


Butterfly Sundae - Its 1981 America. Sklyab had fallen. Ronald Reagan is the President. Video hadn't yet killed radio. The nuclear threat still lingered. "Adults cause way more s#!% than we kids do". Meet Papillon, Butter, Chick P, Liz, Pristine, Oh!Donna and friends as they make their mark in the most decadent of times and thru the eyes, hearts and words of the boys who shaped their lives around winning the affections of these unique and mischievous girls."We can do what we want and just go to confession on Sunday"(by F.Corey)



Wunderkind - In a not so distant future NYC, a small band of children unknowingly discover a wormhole deep within a sealed off portion of the New York City subway system that leads to nexus of all things. They discover a world that thrives on the imagination and dreams of everyone in the universe. A universal data bank, of sorts...and its been taken under siege by the benefactor children of a long dead universe who survive on consuming hope and dreams. Naturally, they have got to be stopped, but there is a price that these kids are not ready to pay. (A/W: CFGodwell)




What We Need & What You Get
Now, as you can see, we have set our goal at $5700. This is the nearly the bare minimum to fund decent sized small print runs of 200+ issues per book and that is 3 titles plus ashcans of to more titles. We also factored in the cost of a table at the New York Comic Con, posters, prints and to finance the sculpting of bust of one of the main characters (Nuklear Woman) that we will be accepting pre-orders for at the show. A nice portion of the pledge funds will go toward the sculptures artist fee. A third of it will go toward the production fees for the trade paperback/graphic novel of the collected 'Nukleus: Born Into This' that will be released Q1 of 2013. The remainder will go toward convention fees, in which NYC is the most expensive in the nation. In exchange for your help, you receive some nice gift packs loaded with an arsenal of goodies that allow us to show our gratitude. Indiegogo calls them 'perks'. Let me explain.

Every pledge is basically a purchase with perks. To show our appreciation, the basic $15 pledge, you will receive autographed versions of the The Boy from Planet A , Born into This#1 (BIT) by CFGodwell, Sci-fi epic Cold Shoulder#1 by DaShen and a signed (pledge only) ashcans of the Manga themed futuristic adventure Wunderkind and what sure to be an 80's pop-cult nostalgic Butterfly Sundae, which is about a group of wayward Catholic School girls growing up in NYC in 1980's America. The $25 pledge is a bit meatier. Not only will the you receive the Nukleus logo tee (to be shipped Oct 7th or available for pickup at the NYCC), but you will also receive signed copies of all three #1 releases (BFPA, BIT and Cold Shoulder) and all subsequent ashcans. The $50 pledge includes the three signed releases, the Nukleus t-shirt, the ashcans, the giant sized Nukleus poster, the NYCC exclusive Nuklear woman bonus t-shirt and signed Nukleus: Born into This graphic novel/trade or all three issue of BIT instead. As the pledges rise, the perks get sweeter. Some ($100 pledge) will include all three #1 along with the upcoming Nuklear Woman (sculpted by Chris Torres) and your name included in the special 'thank you' section of the Nukleus: Born Into This graphic novel. There will also be a later pledge that will see your name included in the actual story (see Your Perks) and possibly star you as an extra, but more on that later.This is the ground floor of something big. We want to immortalize those who made it possible.



In the event that we cannot reach our pledge goal, we will honor all pledges made and cut our run accordingly. While its always risk of running short, especially at an even as large as the NYCC, the people that made it all happen are who come first and foremost. All pledged items are to be placed aside and shipped as a package upon completion and before the Comic Con itself. With the exception of the Nukleus: BIT graphic novel, which will not be available until Quarter 1 2013. If we surpass the goal? Then we put the remainder of funds toward putting Butterfly Sundae into production. Not one dime will be wasted.



What difference does it make if I contribute or not?
ALL the difference. Period. Without gas, we cannot get this vehicle moving. With the big two gradually moving more into the Hollywood end of the comics business, we independents are converging on the back to basics approach of "great story, great art, satisfied customer" Would we ever take a shot at a feature film if the script was right and the property was in good hands? Sure! But we are all about SOURCE MATERIAL FIRST and foremost. The kind of books we were raised on during the closing of the Silver Age. Fun books, with great stories and memorable characters that we could actually get attached to. Back then, the books did not rely on the 'Shocking Death of the Month' to sell a comic. The books sold themselves and the legion of fans grew up with these characters, sometimes cried when a story called for one to pass on and cheered for the occasional resurrection. That is how it used to be. the formula worked then and we are going to make it work now. Hollywood does not create these characters and movie tickets should be an addition to the books allure. Not the defining quality of the character. We want to take it back to basics and we need your help to get it done. Diverse characters that each and every reader can imagine themselves in that fantastic situation. No stereotypical names and dialect that often leave readers like myself shaking our heads. These are books that that use culture as an asset and show the effects it has on the decision making of a person now physically endowed with a way to make change. While we are not reinventing the wheel, its already been done, we are definitely navigating down a different road with our precious creations and this delicate universe we have created. Join us.


Giving a pledge is not the only way to help.
These are difficult times and if we are asking for pledges, then we cannot always expect people to have to contribute. What you can do is spread the word using the social networking tools such as Facebook and Twitter that Indiegogo supplies. We would greatly appreciate it and surrogates that are out there on the ground pushing our brand, will be rewarded as such.We are paying attention we will have goodies like digital versions of our books on Graphicly, T-Shirts, on standby for those who help us push the brand, if for no other reason but good faith.Thank you for you time and please, wish us luck!

story:
Hey all! I'm Matt Warwick, an artist known as 'DrDubz', who for the past few years has been working on his debut comic series 'FERAL'. It is packed full of awesome contemporary martial arts action and deep characters, setting it apart from most of the anthropomorphic character comics available. My goal is to make a great story that will be appreciated by anyone into action comics, even outside of the 'furry' circles. So far, two books in, it's certainly been the case.

If you wish to get a quick overview before reading, check out the official FERAL website, where you can also purchase the books in paperback form.

FERAL is the story of a proficient fighter and hustler named Hayley Rosa, who in previous two books has made huge leaps within the fighting circuit 'FERAL' in an incredibly short time, quickly breaking into the top tier. Despite this however, events unfold that take a toll on her confidence, and awaken her dangerous nature. 

The third book in this series will follow the results of her now unbridled rage, and it's heavy cost. The narrative will now focus on Brandt's point of view, who's shown concern over Hayley's destructiveness, especially now that she has her sights set on his good friend and the circuit's number three, Krista Toporasku. Will Hayley overcome the challenge in her mentally fragile state? Or will she finally be broken by the fearless ex-soldier she now must face...

FERAL is an ongoing comic series that I have worked on yearly. It began late 2011 as a small experiment while living in Australia, starting as a 50 page taster for my abilities, to be sold at a convention in Melbourne. However, since its almost instant success due to its deep, interesting characters and intricately crafted fighting scenes, it has blown up exponentially. Some have even gone on to say that it's a hidden gem in the furry comic community that is over saturated with rom-coms, unnecessary sexual content and goofiness.

From the initial teaser to the two main books, both together totaling over 320 pages of martial arts action, FERAL is both my first foray into comics and also my greatest achievement to date. It's garnered much interest from furs and non-furs alike, and I am hoping that it paves the way for greater things in the future. It is not just me reaching out to a niche audience, but rather a genre and story that I have a passion for, as both an avid action cinema junkie, and martial arts practitioner. 

I have degrees in both moving image media (ND) and digital animation (BA with HONS), where my martial arts love also seeped into my final major project. Since then, I have used the knowledge gained to apply to comic art, where the two mediums share a common story telling aesthetic. This also gave my art a sense of motion, which has been a major advantage in getting the action in FERAL just right.

If you've been following the story so far, you will not want to miss this, as it is the start of Hayley's darkest chapter! If you're new, be sure to grab a book from the main website, or even simply grab the digital versions by supporting this campaign!

To echo what has been confirmed in the last two books, the fans are the reason this comic exists. Many have applauded it's fresh perspective on anthropomorphic comics, while others also appreciate being part of the comic itself as members of the crowd or more. Regardless of the reason, I could not be more thankful. 

Like the previous campaigns, the funding goals remain roughly the same. I require basic funds to cover the cost of self publishing, which are mostly printing costs for both the merchandise and books. While living costs are also factored in, the initial $2000 will NOT be used for living expenses, rather it will be solely used for printing! Anything else beyond the funding goal will be used to help cover unseen technical problems (like equipment failure etc), as well as extra merch ideas such as t-shirts. The excess will go on living, so I can focus more on the comic without being swamped in commissions, since art is my only job.

I am also coming clean. The A4 books that the last campaign promised will also need funding. I've decided to make a double compendium, both volumes 1 and 2 put together in a limited run of 300+ page A4 sized books, with colour pages included with the black and white. This will mean better value all around, and a more collectible product.

$2000 makes about £1200 after Paypal takes it's cut. To break down approximate costs -
  • 100x A5 books @ 160+ pages  - £250 - £300
  • 25x A4 books @ 300+ pages - £230 - £250
  • 25x A2 posters and 50x A3 posters - £100 - £120
  • Misc (stickers, postcards etc) - £150 - £250*
  • Postage - £300+ (wold-wide shipping can be expensive when books are involved.)
* Dependent on type of printers and product availability.
In the end, everyone will be treated to Part 3 of FERAL, as well as other awesome perks. The perks in question range from the ever popular exclusive fight commissions, to the returning 'be in the book' slots that went like hot cakes for book 1. I'll also be including personalized desktop wallpapers for your computer, some awesome new merchandise, digital and physical copies of the books and other cool little digital goodies. Last campaign, contributors got badge sized commissions, like the two shown below.

Book 2 was fully funded within 3 days of it being put up. It was insane, and I'm hoping that this time will be even more successful. Since I've now gotten used to the ins and outs of Manga Studio, book 3 will be made quicker and better than ever. I am now also aiming to allocate funds to help get me to more conventions to sell this comic to more people, which will hopefully be subsidized by sales of books 1 and 2.

Due to a few people also asking how they could help after the campaign, I have decided to opt into the 'InDemand' funding option on Indiegogo. If you want to donate, even if the campaign is over, this will allow you to. Though no perks will be available to contributors, I shall endeavor to provide some kind of compensation, such as access to the digital goodies and PDF comics etc. I might even throw you a little sketch if you start getting generous. Regardless, thankyou in advance if you believe in me enough to essentially become a patron.

IMPORTANT - ONCE YOU HAVE FUNDED THE CAMPAIGN BY SELECTING A PERK ABOVE $80, PROMPTLY SEND AN EMAIL TO - mightydubz@gmail.com - WITH REFS AND OTHER NECESSARY INFO!

So much money!!! What do I do when I get excess funds? Well apart from using some of the money to register for major European conventions to spread the comic about, I'll also start up side projects, including a planned tabletop game based around the FERAL universe! Extra funds will also mean extra help, as I can then pay other artists to take the weight off my shoulders with inking.

To give you an idea of what I'd need to pay out, here's a brief overview -
  • at $3500 I'll be able to take on a second paid hand to help with the inking, so that the comic is shot out faster, allowing more time to add content and work on other things. $400 - 500 is a decent wage for an hour or two a day for a month, adding flat shades to pages. They can work this around their usual jobs or work, since they only ink pages as I finish them. I may have them do the work for longer than a month as well, so I'll need to keep on top of paying the artist for their hard and, frankly, tedious work.
  • at $4500 I'll be able to comfortably afford to register for Eurofurrence, which is the absolute biggest anthropomorphic fandom convention in Europe. I may also be able to allocate funds to set up for MCM in October of 2016, all depends on waiting lists and availability.
  • at $6000 I'll be able to start making prototypes for a possible FERAL tabletop game. This will allow the many people who've donated their characters to be in the comic and feature in perk commissions to actually be more involved as a fighter. It will be a mixture of role-playing combat and character building, a faster paced D&D if you will, where you can develop your own fighter to be pit against your friends and of course, the FERAL elite. It is aiming to be accessible and quick to play for any level, but also rich and strategic, allowing for many types of players to emulate real life martial artists.
As well as all that, I'll be able to spend more on merchandise for you all. More money, better product, everyone wins - especially you guys.

The risks are the same as last year, and now I can manage them much better. That doesn't mean that I get off with a 'get out of predicament free' card. All creators know they should assume that what can go wrong, will go wrong.

  • The biggest problem with a fully digital comic is equipment failure. Everything I work on is backed onto the Hard drive I bought with last campaign's money (which has served me reliably, an awesome piece of kit), so while all work is halted while I replace hardware, no data is lost. Hardware breaking will only result in delays, which will be shortened with a spare computer on hand and my tablet being fairly cheap to replace.
  • Speaking of delays, the deadline for the comics is the 25th May 2016, in time for the major British furry convention, Confuzzled. Last time I barely made it, due to wrestling with programs and printing schedules on short notice. This time, now that I'm fully trained with the programs and have templates at the ready, I should be able to get the third book done with time to spare.
  • Since I still have to live, I will need to allocate time for commissions work on the side. This can eat up valuable comic production time, which hopefully the campaign's funding should be able to subsidies till the bulk of the work is done, such as all the rough layout and some inking. I am also looking into getting paid help again to assist inking, like last time, to take weight off my shoulders.

Frankly, as I have said before, even without the funding and despite the problems, FERAL will never become a dead project. Not mentioning the amount of time invested already to just give up, this has been a dream that I plan on seeing through to completion. Book 3 will be the mid-way point of the saga, so through Hell and high water, this is a project that I plan on completing, for myself and the fans I have gathered so far. 

Times are hard, I understand. Doesn't make you any less entitled to jumping on this awesome ride, so if you want to help out, simply spread the word and hype the project up! I mean there's a lot to be hyped about, after all.

The best way to do it is to share this campaign page with this link: http://igg.me/at/feral-comic

Alternatively, you can follow the Feral page on Facebook, where I am most active with posting updates (click here). 

You can also throw people in the direction of the online store, so they can access samples and also purchase the first two books in PDF or paperback formats - http://www.feral-comic.com/store.html

Even the smallest voice can make a huge difference. Every droplet of help, be it monetary or otherwise, is greatly appreciated. Without a fanbase, FERAL wouldn't even exist.

From the bottom of my heart - 

Thankyou.

-Matt 'DrDubz' Warwick.

story:
Short Summary

MAS Media Studios is an independent publisher established back in 2007 by three guys who wanted to bring something to the comic book world that was more than just super heroes in tights. A few years back we were able to print a small run of a graphic novel entitled Street Journal. The book sold well so we decided to reprint the novel with a larger print run and a new dynamic cover. To do so, however, we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to put together $3000. This will cover printing costs, paying an artist for a shnazzy cover and a promotional budget to be able to raise awareness of the project.

As a contributor, you will receive great perks that include original artwork, unique laminated prints, sketch cards, and if that's not enough, we are also throwing in the  limited edition first prints of the graphic novel signed by the crew!

The Impact

Street Journal is unlike any other comic book in that it gives a real portrayal of one young man's push to build a new life for his two year old daughter. Each person has an obstacle to over come, Tyreke Miles becomes that literal living testament and for many, we believe a symbol of hope. Through your contributions, our goal is to print and release this book so that young indivuduals can be inspired to find their own purpose inspite of their environment and push on. Plus, it's a fun read.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, we do undesrtand that some people may not be able to contribute at this point in time, but that doesn't mean that you can't help.

Help us spread the word by either word of mouth or directing people to this link. You can also follow us on twitter @MASMediaStudios and @tyreke_miles and friend us on facebook @https://www.facebook.com/masmediastudios

Thank you for your support and contributions! Read MAS!
