story:
Veniamo in pace.

Ciao, siamo Francesco Manetti e Luciano Costarelli,  appassionati di fantascienza. Abbiamo iniziato a fare fumetti insieme sulla fanzine Collezionare quando eravamo ragazzi, poi non ci siamo più visti per anni (sapevo che non dovevo entrare in quella cabina blu inglese). Poi, grazie a una DeLorean… no, grazie a Facebook ci siamo ritrovati  e abbiamo deciso di ricominciare a fare qualcosa insieme.

Per un anno abbiamo pubblicato quasi ogni mese su DimeWeb   una storia di 3 o 4 pagine autoconclusiva

A un certo  punto ci siamo accorti che volevamo vedere questi fumetti su carta, così abbiamo raccolto e sistemato le 10 storie originariamente pubblicate in bassa risoluzione sul blog e creato una undicesima da 8 tavole per comporre l’albo che ci accingiamo a produrre. 

 

Se ti ci metti con impegno, puoi raggiungere qualsiasi risultato!

Abbiamo bisogno di te  per trasformare questo progetto in un vero albo. Il nostro scopo è quello di tenere il prezzo di copertina il più basso possibile in modo che quante più persone possano comprarlo. Per questo abbiamo bisogno di una prevendita per almeno 500 euro, in modo da coprire il costo per il numero minimo di tiratura necessaria.

L’albo sarà disponibile in due versioni: la regular avrà  in copertina una illustrazione a colori, la variant sarà bianca,  con solo il nostro piccolo robot mascotte in basso al centro,  pronta per dediche e disegni su richiesta.

Il formato è 16,5 x 24 cm, su ottima carta patinata opaca, disponibile a partite da 4€ più spese di spedizione e confezionamento (€1,50 per l’Italia) 

 

Un eldorado di opportunità e avventure.

Ci sono diverse possibilità per contribuire e più premi da ottenere: oltre alle ai disegni in B/N e a colori sulla copertina variant, per 12 mecenati e mega fan che sosterranno questo progetto con generosità, ci saranno alcune tavole, mezze pagine e strisce originali a matita e a china.

Non abbiamo inserito la possibilità di ottenere una versione digitale del fumetto, non perché non apprezziamo questa modalità, ma perché lo scopo di questo crowdfunding è  propriamente stampare un albo a fumetti.

 

Ma... è più grande all'interno!

L’albo è praticamente pronto, a Collezionando Lucca abbiamo presentato ad amici e  esperti del settore una prestampa con la copertina variant. Il progetto tra l’altro è piaciuto anche al mitico Moreno Burattini, che ha scritto per noi una bellissima prefazione, o meglio: un vero e proprio articolo sulle storie brevi. Solo quella vale il costo dell’albo.

Gli autori sono rimasti un po’ lontani dalla scena, ma come potete vedere, si stanno riprendendo velocemente. Francesco Manetti ha tradotto migliaia di pagine di fumetti americani per l’Italia e scritto per le principali riviste di fumetti Italiane e ha sceneggiato la serie Eva e Chris.

Luciano Costarelli ha disegnato centinaia di tavole per piccole case editrici (Fenix, Forte Editore, Master), soprattutto di genere sportivo. Attualmente collabora con diverse realtà indipendenti tra cui Bugs Comics (Alieni) e Cronache di Topolinia (Lunar Lex)

 

Ci porti su, signor Scott!

Puoi farti un’idea di quasi tutto l’albo in anteprima guardando i 10 episodi su DimeWeb… anche se, in bassa risoluzione, si perdono tantissimi particolari di queste tavole. Non abbiamo timore di smentita dicendo che su carta è tutta un’altra cosa. Ah, l’ultima storia per noi è la migliore e quella non si trova e non si troverà mai online. Ora spetta a te rendere questo albo reale.  Ci auguriamo che vorrai sostenere questo nostro progetto, ma se così non fosse, grazie comunque per il tempo che ci hai dedicato!

story:
Ciao, sono Davide La Rosa,

uno di Como nato nel 1980, e faccio i fumetti (sono autore, tra le altre cose di "Suore ninja"; "Paco Lanciano e il fagiano crononauta"; "Ugo Foscolo indagatore dell'incubo"; "La Bibbia 2"; "Il libretto rosso del trio occhialuto antifascista"; e altri fumetti). Tecnicamente sarei uno sceneggiatore ma, spesso, mi ritrovo a fare storie scritte e disegnate da me. Quindi sono un autore completo… come completo è il disastro dei miei disegni. Già, non so disegnare. Però pare che questi disegni funzionino con le cose che racconto. PARE eh, mica lo so se è vero… ai posteri l’ardua senza (dannati posteri, sempre lì pronti a giudicare).

Comunque:

Un giorno mi sono detto: “Davide, perché non illustri, male, tutta la Divina Commedia di Dante Alighieri?”. Ok, ho deciso che la illustro tutta. Però un libro alla volta. Quindi eccomi qui a presentarvi la prima cantica: “L’inferno”.

 

 

Ok, so cosa state pensando: “Perché dovrei comprare un libro che è già stato illustrato da Gustave Dorè?”. Per due motivi:

1) Dorè era bravo a disegnare, facile illustrare quando si è bravi a disegnare. Provate voi ad essere incapace e illustrare 34 canti (anzi 33+1… che fa sempre 34 ma Dante, pare, preferisse così).

2) Dorè è morto.

Il libro, brossurato, sarà di circa 200 pagine in bianco e nero. Dentro ci sarà il testo originale di Dante (che tanto è morto da 700 anni e non mi può denunciare) e tutto sarà illustrato da me (che per ora sono vivo quindi magari mi denuncio da solo… decido in settimana). Ci saranno disegni almeno 3 o 4 illustrazione a canto, per immortalare i momenti più salienti di un’opera immortale, un libro non muore mai fino a quando ci sarà qualcuno che lo legge (ho fatto un aforisma).

Il libro verrà consegnato a Marzo 2020.

Se poi questa campagna va in porto ne farò altre per Purgatorio e Paradiso (per quello ho scritto “Libro 1”).

Ecco qualche tavola per farvi venire lo Stige in bocca:

story:
Space Mama Piggy

Suffers from separation anxiety after blasting her many, oh so many, kids off into space.

Riddled with guilt and shame she roams her galaxy searching for purpose and value as an individual. 

We follow her encounters with diverse characters of space flora and fauna. They reflect her inner turmoil and impact her journey as she gains and loses confidence and comfort. These honest comic strips are inspired by real life conversations, thoughts and experiences around depression, isolation, codependence and anxiety.

Motherhood and Comics

Space Mama Piggy is a unique storytelling protagonist within the comic world. Not only is she an antihero who rather passively and reluctantly gets dragged through adventures, but she is a mother navigating a surrealist take on postpartum depression, codependence and separation anxiety.

She is not the perfect mother, but a flawed individual navigating her mistakes and doubts, her value as an individual, and her children leaving their nest.

While the rare representation of female characters in the comic book world tend to be hyper-sexualized, stereotyped, or used for token, Space Mama Piggy is a comforting sausage with empty ear-nests taking centre stage as an imperfect individual within an imperfect world.

She does not have super powers beyond our means, rather, she is the tragedy we hide away. Vulnerable, broken, honest, riddled with shame. She is a gaping wound taking shaky six legged steps towards healing.

She is the tragic clown providing gentle release for our own tension.

Her mission

With Space Mama Piggy her creator longs to expand the representation of female protagonists within the comic world. In order to attract more versatile readers the comic industry is in need of honest and diverse characters that share qualities with their reader. Although her six legs, ear-nests and trunk may not be familiar to most, her feelings, experiences, backlashes and pain are meant to provide a comic relief and company to all imperfect souls that are navigating change.

This first step

This fundraiser is to launch the first zine of the Space Mama Piggy chronicles. Space Mama Piggy is intended as a multi-zine storytelling piece, with each small zine representing a new chapter in her life, with new challenges, new encounters, new discoveries. Grief and anxiety are treacherous journeys, but we're full of hope that Space Mama Piggy will be alright in the end.

story:
The Story

Miranda Dean is a promising recent graduate with a degree in chemistry. When she receives a strange job offer from a company she's never heard of she's somewhat skeptical, but the proposed salary is enticing enough that she decides to look into it. Upon arriving at the company headquarters, however, it becomes immediately apparent that something is very wrong. Miranda finds herself trapped and forced to work under the mysterious Mr. Rasa, a bizarre humanoid creature with terrifying powers and mysterious motives. Faced with a seemingly invincible captor and unable to hide, what can she possibly do to escape?

 

The Book

This will be the first installment of RASA, a story that will last for around five issues. It is an international collaboration between American writer Web Bleynat and Italian Artist Matteo Prayer. With 50 story pages and a cover that will only ever be available to IndieGoGo backers, RASA is a surreal psychological thriller with a thoroughly unique premise and many intriguing mysteries that will keep you wondering just what could possibly happen next. Each new twist and turn reveals more about Miranda's bizarre predicament and builds the tension all the way up until the conclusion... whatever that may be. 

 

The Cover

This book features a cover by Juan Paolo Mañanita. This gorgeous cover is only going to be available through IndieGoGo, so be sure to get yours right away!

 

 

Take a look inside!

story:
MORE LETHAL is a 20 page black and white manga-sized cyberpunk comic book.

 

Regular Edition cover by Joe Ball

 

 

Alternate Limited Edition wrap-around cover by Joe Ball and Michael Beacon

 

 

 

 

FREE Blade Girl Akane MORE LETHAL trading card by Carla Tornielli (The Grim Reaper) comes with each comic!

 

 

"LESS LETHAL" print by Brandon Diaz (Magic Cop) has been UNLOCKED for all backers!

 

 

 

 

Blade Girl Akane is a synthetic human sword fighter with the ability to level up her fighting skills like a video game character. She fights for honor but is merciless in combat.

 

Master Nagato has been captured by cybernetic terrorists. Blade Girl Akane must fight through cyberninjas and the Aramusha Boss Ninja to rescue Nagato before his brain is hacked for secret information that could pose a worldwide threat.

 

THE CREATIVE TEAM

Story by Aaron Calimeri (CyberShock 1.0)

Cover art by John Joseph Ball (Super Harem, Bulletmaker, Death Death Death)

Interior art by Ibai Canales (Iron Sights)

Logo by Rodrigo Ybanez (Red Ninja Momji)

Letters and script assists by Adam AF (Bloodhunt)

Trading card by Carla Tornielli (The Grim Reaper)

 

MORE LETHAL is produced in association with King Toad Comics.

STRETCH GOALS

*UNLOCKED*  - Brandon Diaz "LESS LETHAL" print included with each comic!

story:
Word Smith is a steampunk fantasy adventure where words come to life. A skilled artisan can craft words to evoke feelings and emotions from its recipients. (Although not all words mean the same thing to everyone!)

Word Smith is written and created by Stephen Kok, artwork by P.R. Dedelis and coloured by Peyton Freeman. This creative team has worked successfully and delivered on multiple projects without any problems!  If you love anything steampunk, thrilling stories and awesome characters, you will love Word Smith!

 

Word Smith Volume 1 is a 52 page graphic novel. Word Smith Volume 2 will be a 60 page (Final page count to be confirmed) full coloured, perfect bound graphic novel (with a spine!). It will be 260mm x 170mm (10.2" x 6.7") in size and printed on 150gsm internal pages with a 250gsm cardstock cover with cello glazing. (For those unfamiliar with paper gsm, I'm a little bit of a paper snob and this is high quality paper! ) 

 

Word Smith Volume 1 :

When a word that Victoria crafts goes awry can she fix it or will she end up making matters worse?

Word Smith Volume 2 :

Victoria is the best word smith in the city, however a challenger from the Eastern Nations might steal Victoria's title! There's adventure, excitement and of course, lots of words.

 

More artwork?

Here's more for you to take a look at!

 

 

 

 

PDF Pack - AUD$9

You will received the PDF copies of Word Smith Volume 1 & 2.
 

Printed Copy - Volume 2 - AUD$25

You will received the PDF of Volume 1 & 2 and PRINTED copies of Word Smith Volume 2.
 

Printed Copy - Volume 2 (Variant) - AUD$29

You will received the PDF of Volume 1 & 2 and PRINTED copies of Word Smith Volume 2 (VARIANT).
 

Printed Copy - Volume 1 & 2 - AUD$50

You will received the PDF and PRINTED copies of Word Smith Volume 1 & 2.
 

Mega Pack - AUD$65

You will received the PDF and PRINTED copies of Word Smith Volume 1 & 2.
You will ALSO receive a special Mei-Li Business card and 2x A5 (210 x 148 mm or 8.27 x 5.83 inches) Prints.
 
 
 

Mega Pack - Exclusive IndieGoGo - A5 Print - $75

You will receive everything from the Mega Pack and an exclusive print. This print (210 x 148 mm or 8.27 x 5.83 inches) from artist Brian Lim. It will not offered anywhere else except on this IndieGoGo campaign!

Mega Pack - Autumn - AUD$249

You will get everything in the Mega Pack Exclusive as well as a UNIQUE ORIGINAL COLOURED ARTWORK of AUTUMN by P.R. Dedelis. Perfect for framing!
 

Mega Pack - Witch - AUD$249

You will get everything in the Mega Pack Exclusive as well as a UNIQUE ORIGINAL COLOURED ARTWORK of WITCH by P.R. Dedelis. Perfect for framing!
 

 

Mega Pack - Variant - AUD$275

You will get everything in the Mega Pack Exclusive as well as a UNIQUE ORIGINAL PENCILLED ARTWORK of VARIANT COVER by Wallace Cheong. Perfect for framing!
 

Risks and Challenges

Volume 1 has already been created. This IndieGoGo is to help finance the creation of Volume 2. There is an experienced team working on this and there should be no problem with fulfillment. My previous IndieGoGo Terralympus was delivered on schedule to all backers!

Thanks for checking out this campaign and for all your support. Please help to share the link and spread the word (pun intended).  Let's bring this story to life.

story:
ABOUT SACRED CHAOS COMICS

My name is Clifton King and I am 33 years old. I am the Husband to my beautiful wife Terrian King and the Father to two beautiful daughters. Astoria who is 2 and Kyree who is 11. I currently work at a grocery store as a cashier but I am chasing my true passion which is writing and creating. I am currently writing two titles, Abigail and F*ck This. 

Brandon Smith is the Co-creator and Co-writer for the team. He is passionate about writing and brings a lot of creativity to the team.

Terrian King is the customer service manager and HR. She brings everything about customer service and the business ends of things, She will make sure to take care of any questions you may have about the campaign.

We have been making appearances at cons at comic book shops over the past year and plan on never stopping. We want to make this company as big as possible and bring amazing stories to you.

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

We want to use Indiegogo to bring a quality campaign to you and focus on moving forward with our ongoing series. The book is done and we want to use this to take it to the printer. The profit made will be put into making book 2 happen. We already have Shelby Robertson ready to jump on in for interiors for the next project. 

ABIGAIL'S STORY

In a time of such suffering, the only thing that matters is becoming ascended. Children train day in and day out in hopes of being chosen to join the ranks of the Angels. Once a year, the Gods send their Angels down from Heaven to pick up those lucky enough to have been chosen to train them for ascension. Once ascended, they will become Angels themselves and serve the lords above controlling the surface world below as they see fit.


The lucky few Angels who have proven their worth are honored with the opportunity of becoming Archangels. Very few are ever chosen to take on this glorified position. The responsibility of an Archangel is to oversee the actions of the Angels and combat the Forces of Darkness rising on the surface.


The Forces of Darkness are those who resist the Gods and tear the wings from the angels. They will do anything in there power to resist the tyranny of the Gods above, even if it means creating their demons to rise against heaven. The Forces of Darkness will call forth the deadliest sins and strongest of the fallen to take back what they believe is rightfully theirs.


The Government has found the secret to immortal life and wanted nothing more than to make the world great again in their image. It all began 83 years ago when the self-proclaimed new Gods unleashed a virus upon the world while they escaped to their new world above, Heaven. The only way to cure this plague was to bow down and praise the new gods as their saviors. The fear and rage of the infected sparked the devastating 15-Year War. This brutal and seemingly endless war left the surface world in rubble and ruin. Those who chose to bend the knee and praise the new Gods were granted asylum in safe zones, truly a testament to the love and generosity of the Gods. The protection of these numbered safe zones, each dubbed an ‘Eden’, lies with the Angels.


Abigail’s journey begins in her home, Eden-6, where she and her fellow chosen have trained their whole lives with one goal in mind, to rise through the ranks and become mighty Archangels themselves.

REVIEWS FROM THE FANS

"Awesome story brilliant colors killer artwork." - Chris Mason

"I HIGHLY recommend Sacred Chaos and Abigail #1! A seriously great story that left me wanting the next book ASAP. If you’re looking for a new story to read from a quickly rising indie comic company than look no further!!" - Demetri Vlachos

"Sacred chaos is keeping the medium of storytelling alive and well. I read a lot of titles every week. About 15, whether its batman to spidey to oblivion song to dark ark. so I consider myself pretty loyal to the weekly reads and I keep wondering when the next Abigail is coming out. I enjoyed the story. I loved the biblical and political references in it and the art is absolutely killer! If you're just now checking this page out with any bit of curiosity, give it a shot. You may be pleasantly surprised." - Billy Goreski

"Truly enjoy the dystopian, high-adventure, breakneck speed, narrative that this creator is laying out before us! King has imbued his story with a synergy of religious totalitarianism and technocracy, spiraling the reader down a righteous rabbit hole of character-driven action! He's left plenty on the altar to keep us in the know, but with ample room for character development and plot twists. The animation is superb and flows effortlessly with the dialogue. The story is solid, compelling, and does the most important thing that an ongoing title should: leave us wanting more! I very much look forward to the continued story of Sacred Chaos Comics' debut title, and future titles to come! Check them out, good stuff!!!" - Chris Cheshire

"Just finished reading a physical copy of ABIGAIL, great start, need more!!! can anybody hook me up with a little crack until I get another issue I need a fix : ) please just don’t Rick and Morty me for like 2 years." - Nick Gher

"Abigail #1 is a great start to a new world to read about. Can't wait to see what else Sacred Chaos Comics comes up with." - Mary Winn

A LOOK INSIDE

QUESTIONS

We will be open from 9-5 Arizona time throughout the campaign and we will answer in question you may have about the project. Please feel free to reach out to us anytime.

ARTISTS

Antonio Brandao, Bryan Silverbax, Shelby Robertson, Courtney Rose, Phillip Glassmeyer, Brandon Wagner, Stef Wilson, Kerry Anne, Wendy Steen Shaner, Vincent J Tesla, Natasha Novy, David Faught, Stephen Strange, Jonathan McDaniel, Maria Iona, Keith Curtis, Stephen Strange, Billy Goreski, Nestor Redulla Jr. and Vincent Deporter

All these talented people brought you amazing covers and colors. Without them, this project would be caveman paintings at best.

COVERS

ALL BLACK AND WHITE COVERS WILL BE COLORED WHEN WE ARE FUNDED.

Antonio Brandao

Brandon WagnerPhilip GlassmeyerCourtney RoseMaria IonaAntonio BrandaoStef Wilson

                             Vincent J TeslaDavid FaughtWendy Steen Shaner                  Shelby Robertson

                                                             Jonathan McDanielNatasha Novy               Billy GoreskiVincent DeporterKeith CurtisStephen Strange

story:
Babylon Working follows a crew of misfit space pirates who call themselves Babylon. The crew attempts to pull off an easy job of stealing the cargo of an ancient cult. Little did they know that the cargo was housing an elder god. Now every collector, cult, and fear mongering zealot is after them. 

WHAT ARE YOU GETTING?

This is a 32 page full color comic, single (first) issue of a 5 issue mini series. 

Sci-Fi genre

Mature Readers

PREVIEW

REWARDS

CREATORS

Marcel Dupree - Writer

Owns and operates Evoluzione Publishing, which produces comics like  Armor-I and Delilah Blast.  He also edited Punch Drunk from Arcana Comics.

Joshua Metzger - Writer

Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics) and Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing).

Mannix Francisco - Artist

Mannix Francisco spent 20 years working for TOEI Animation Studio Philippines as animator and quality control on titles like Dragonball, Sailormoon and One Piece before trying his luck on comic book art. He has worked with publishers such as Big Dog Ink and Behemoth.

Rex Lokus - Colorist

Rex Lokus is a colorist who is currently working on for DC Comincs on titles such as Red Hood and Injustice.

Justin Birch - Letterer

I was born in the hills of West Virginia and raised on a diet of pepperoni rolls and Ecto Cooler Hi-C. I surprised everyone, including myself, by surviving to adulthood on that diet. Now, I letter comics. My eventual dream is the same as everyone else – to work full time from home in my underwear.

I have a Bachelor's in graphic design and have been lettering comics for over a year. In that short time I've worked with numerous publishers and I know I can meet any deadline you may have. I offer a quick turnaround and competitive rates. Email for a quote.

I would love to letter your next comic.

Risks and challenges

story:
Story

Rosemari Susan Oppenheimer is the pilot of the Hermit Crab, a one-of-a-kind set of Power Armor engineered with a myriad of optional loadouts to accommodate any job. Mari earns her living as a Contractor, solving problems for anyone willing to pay for her services: Mining, transportation, protection, sometimes even conflict resolution.

Although able to project a veil of professionalism toward her clients, Mari is actually naive, irresponsible, imprudent, and downright derpy - at least according to her mentor, the mad genius, Dr. Masaka. Retiring soon, he insists on imparting a critical lesson to his protege: That although she inherited incredible technological advantages from her estranged father, the universe won't simply step aside for Mari. If she isn't able to adapt to a ever-changing world (and take better care of her equipment) she will find herself quickly overwhelmed and depleted of resources.

Mari travels a foreign universe in a reliable (if clunky) cruiser with her pet/co-pilot, the foxy Bork. Her universe is very different than others: It resembles a swirling galactic soup, an ocean, something one might see under a microscope. There are gas clusters with breathable air, chunks of inhabitable floating rock and soil rather than planets. There is always somewhere interesting to visit, and countless clients seeking the services of a professional problem-solver.

Tone & Setting:

Mari Sue is a love letter to 80's and 90's anime: Filthy alleyways drenched in neon. Mech pilots conducting business in cities overrun with corruption. Sleazy swindlers rubbing elbows with duplicitous, seductive babes. Danger around every corner. Desperate citizens who will stab anyone in the back for a few bucks.

The universe of this story, Ouranos, is a dense sandbox. There are countless planets, planes, and "clusters" of inhabitable space for lifeforms to thrive upon, cradled in colorful clouds and intimidating heavenly phenomena. Each location will be lovingly rendered, prioritizing visual pleasure over realism.

This story will feature thrilling exo-suit battles, bizarre creatures, a fine cast of characters to befriend, dastardly enemies to despise, and dozens of rich settings you'll want to visit.

Episodes 1 & 2
Presented as a pair, the first two issues of this series will take place on a cruise ship, focusing on a handful of seminal events in Mari's life. Dr. Masaka begins the process of retiring, which means Mari will enjoy more autonomy than ever - but also responsibility.

Mari also develops a relationship with a handsome janitor.

However, her romance is threatened to be cut short when we learn that pirates have infiltrated the ship! Mari springs into action, except... (she's the one getting suplexed below).

This series will delight in every type of combat possible between humanoids: Melee, weaponry, vehicular. Fights will not only be brawls, but mind games - as Mari's suit requires a massive amount of battery usage, which she is not good at budgeting.

Every fight will challenge Mari's wits, as she skates a knife's edge between overpowering her opponents, and running out of juice before she defeats them.

Unfortunately, Mari will be reminded that winning now doesn't always mean winning later. There are consequences to being overpowered, which Dr. Masaka used to shield her from. Now that he's retiring and Mari is operating on her own, she may realize her job is more demanding than she believed.

What's got Mari so upset? More importantly, what's she going to do about it? Order the first two issues and see what's up!

Book Specs

This campaign will fund Issues 1 & 2 of the story. Each issue will be:

  • About 30 pages in length
  • Printed in color, on high quality paper stock.
  • Genre: Action, Comedy, Sci-Fi, Drama
  • Appropriate for ages 13+

Campaign Goals

I would also like to offer this book in Local Comic Shops. After this campaign begins fulfillment, please feel free to put me in touch with LCS so that I can ship them copies to sell. Backers will get a first look at the books, of course, as well as the knowledge that this series is only possible thanks to their generosity.

If this campaign succeeds, I plan to continue the story past these two issues. There is a larger story ready to go, as long as there's an audience for it!

Future Episodes

While there is a definitive story arc planned and written, there are plenty of enjoyable side stories we can explore as Mari climbs toward her ultimate goal.

  • Mari accidentally murders an elder god, pissing off Space PETA. They send an assassin after her to get revenge.
  • Mari encounters someone very scary from her past, someone who insists on playing a deadly game.

Stretch Goals

$5k: REACHED!!! THANK YOU! =D

$10k - Guest Art: I will be able to commission various fan-favorite indie illustrators to create guest art that can be featured on the rear covers of books, for cards, posters, goodies, and more!

$15k - Road Trip & Hiring an Editor: Once the books are printed, I hope to travel to as many local comic shops as possible to sell copies of the book and do signings. With a few extra bucks in my pocket, I'll be able to travel even farther! Costs would cover things like gas, maintenance, hotels, shipping, and so on. I would also like to hire a professional Editor who I've worked with in the past, so that future episodes will be even better!

$30k: I will personally animate a short "trailer" in a 90's anime style, complete with music and voice acting!

$40k+: I may hire some professional friends to help make the above content even better! Who knows, maybe I'll even hire assistants to get these books produced even faster!

Special Thanks

If you read this far, thank you! Please share this campaign around, tell everyone about it! With luck, this can be a long-running, delightful series that you'll be proud to have in your library.

Gallery

story:
The Dominus is the story of six childhood friends who reunite as adults and embark on an adventure to protect the Holy Grail from the Antichrist.  Through their adventure, they are drawn into the eternal struggle between good and evil, face death, and become ‘blessed’ with unique abilities and powers. The Dominus is a 96 page full color original graphic novel.  It is intended for mature audiences with violence and mild profanity.   

The story picks up on the night of a reunion between the six friends who grew up together at Saint Christopher’s Orphanage in Long Island, New York.  They are reminded of a story from their childhood involving a hidden land inside the Himalayas where the Holy Grail was kept in secret, guarded by an ancient race called the Peregrinus.  Upon hearing that name, memories are triggered among the group involving incredible things they could do as children while at the orphanage. 

As the group tries to make sense of these new memories, they are joined by their old priest who implores them to go on a quest with him to the Himalayas, where they must become the frightening power of good to protect the Grail from an ancient evil that seeks to possess it.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are hoping to raise $8,000.  This will cover completion of the project and printing.  Once the printing is covered we will send all the files to the printer.  We are hoping to ship the book to all the backers in March of 2019.  If we can make that happen sooner, we will.  Considering how much we raise, we will donate a portion to charity as a thank you and we will start to plan for the next project.

We have 5 perk levels that will give the backers some really cool swag.

Anything we raise over the goal will be used for additional perks and for starting on another exciting project. 

The Impact

To bring these characters to life is a dream come true for me.  I created these characters years ago as a way to entertain my younger sister and brother.  Now to see them in the pages of a comic book- words can't express how awesome that feels! 

This project is dedicated to Fred Browne and Drew Wessel.

Risks & Challenges

This is my first Indiegogo project but I have years of experience in big and small business. I have launched markets for major companies and in 2007 I purchased  a failing comic book store and turned it around into a viable business.  I know how to lead people and manage results.  Most of all I know the most important element of any business or project is its customers!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to all your friends and to anyone who is a fan of comic books!

This is my first Indiegogo project but I have years of experience in big and small business. I have launched markets for major companies and in 2007 I purchased  a failing comic book store and turned it around into a viable business.  I know how to lead people and manage results.  Most of all I know the most important element of any business or project is its customers!

Other Ways You Can HelpPlease spread the word to all your friends and to anyone who is a fan of comic books!

story:
From your first day of pre-school to your last day of high school teachers and parents instill the belief that you have to go to college to get a good education and be successful. Then you go to college and study a specific major and upon graduation most people have a plan to take life by the horns, just one problem... Life doesn't always want to be taken. Most college graduates in today's society find themselves in student-loan debt and are lucky if they can get a job in their major. Most grads need to find a job in any field just to gain "experience" and get a steady pay-check to pay off their loans. 

COSMIC- Back Story

Landon Debson moved to Los Angeles with dreams of being an actor after he graduated college with a degree in Acting. He quickly learned that not all goals in life could be accomplished, especially when nobody has heard of you and barely any companies are hiring. After a year of interviewing, Landon finally got a call-back from “UPA” for a “S.T.A.R.” position! Little did he know that he "UPA" actually stands for "Universal Protection Agency", and his new job is far from acting! Landon has now signed a five year contract, bonded by his life, to be a “S.T.A.R.”, “Soldier Through All Radii”. Landon Debson thought his position was to be an actor, but the contract was really for a career as a universal superhero known as Cosmic. Landon is officially, and reluctantly, a Soldier Through All Radii, sworn to protect Earth from universal dangers, pirates and creatures. Landon is not quite ready for such responsibility in his life, but needs to keep this job to pay off his student-loan debt. After all, nobody else is hiring.

COSMIC is a comic series for all ages.

COSMIC- Issues 1 & 2 

Cosmic is faced with the task of protecting the infants of Earth from the alien pirate “Captain Priam” and his crew of baby snatchers!

Our story begins a year into Landon's tenure as Cosmic as he will be faced with the challenge of defending Earth's infants from a crew of alien space-pirates led by Captain Priam. Priam and his crew are now looking to abduct babies in order to turn them into soldiers in his army of pirates. 

Check out the cover of Issue 1 and the first five pages:


 

Why Pre-Pay for the print of COSMIC ?

COSMIC Vol. 1, TPB can be printed with your help. Our goal is to make COSMIC a successful digital series through Alterna Comics. We trust that each and every one of you reading this has a dream or a goal you would like to accomplish and you will do anything to achieve... Well, we do have a goal and a dream, and this is our "anything" we are doing to achieve it. If you are interested in a new superhero story then COSMIC will be the book for you.

 

You Scratch Our Backs and We'll Scratch Yours!

Being that this book will be published in digital format, we really want to have it printed so you can put it into your book collection. Printing is pretty expensive for an independent comic writer with a regular day job but with your help this will come true.

All COSMIC backers who pledged $8 be in the "Thank You" section of the book and also! Write one paragraph about yourself, what you like to do, inform people about your own projects, promote your website or anything else you could think of. Please keep your paragraph appropriate. 

 

What if we aren't fully funded?

Let's just hope this doesn't happen. However, all backers will get the Perk they desire and this book will still be for sale through Digital Comics digital publishing outlets in 2014. The printing cost will be dampened a bit but it may take longer for me to get it printed.


On Our Own...

Originally, COSMIC was supposed to get published through Alterna Comics, but after a bit of a creative difference we have part ways with Alterna. We are officially on our own.  This makes absolutely no change to the book at all. In fact, this may be better because we are now in complete control of the book. Being that we are on our own we really do need your help to make this happen now more than ever.

     

    Check out some more COSMIC art in the gallery! 

    VISIT THE GALLERY TAB TO SEE COSMIC PAGES AND PERKS!

    CHECK UP ON SAL BRUCCULERI'S UPDATES AT http://salbrucculeri.tumblr.com/cosmicOR ON TWITTER @SALVEYB!

     

    Remember to use the IndieGogo share tools to help promote this project!

     

     

    STRETCH GOALS:

    For each stretch goal that is hit, another issue of COSMIC will be made!

    Backers who pledged $10 or more will receive all of the below in PDF format. 

    The $16000 Stretch Goal is Exclusive to backers who pledged $50 or any backers who pledged more than $50 and specify their interest.

    $3,300 = Issue 3 PDF and Print

    $4,300 = Issue 4 PDF and Print

    $5,300 = Issue 5 PDF and Print

    $5,400 = Issue 6 PDF and Print

    $6,200 = Issue 7 PDF and Print

    $7,000 = Issue 8 PDF and Print

    $7,800 = Issue 9 PDF and Print

    $8,600 = Issue 10 PDF and Print

    $9,400 = Issue 11 PDF and Print

    $10,200 = Issue 12 PDF and Print

    Release dates will be scheduled for 2014.

    $15,000 = Everyone who was suppose to receive a COSMIC Vol. 1, TPB will instead get a COSMIC Omnibus edition with all 12 issues mentioned above!

story:
View pages of the book here

https://www.dropbox.com/s/idtrq6zn0yveema/book.pdf


This is a prerelease version of the book and is subject to change.  It's only purpose is to give you an idea of the style and content of the book.

When You Were Young
When I Was Young

This is the first book that Leah Reed and Joseph Gats have ever published together. It's not really a children's book but it's presented in a style that anyone can appreciate. Simple but fun.

This campaign is aimed at printing and distributing printed copies of the book. It's also a great way for you the reader to join in on the creative process. Readers of the book can choose to submit content and that content will be added to the book with art to supplement it.

The book will always be free in digital media and so even if you choose not to donate we hope you choose to enjoy the book with someone you care about.

What We Need & What You Get

This is how the money will be used:

  • We are working towards getting the book printed and distributed.
  • All funds received will go towards that goal. The more funds we collect, the more copies of the book we can print and the less expensive it will cost per unit.
  • Supporters of the book who can contribute $25 or more will have the opportunity to submit their own experiences to the book which will be included in both the printed and digital versions. There is limited space in the printed version and so early contributors will have a greater chance of making it into that version. We do ask that you keep your submissions appropriate to the intended audience of the book which is all ages. Also we ask that no trademarked words or concepts be included in user submitted entries. Along with your content, we will also print your name and city.
  • Whatever funds we get, be they big or small will go towards the publication and distribution of the book. Contributors at the $25 or above levels will get a free signed and numbered copy.
  • All other contributors will have their names and city printed in the digital version of the book in a special thank you section. For those who contribute $10 or more, you will be able to also include a 140 character note under your name in the special thank you section (limitations based on appropriate content).

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with all your friends and family. This is a fun project that everyone can be a part of.

story:
Updates 17/04/2014:  


" A many thank you to all the contributors so far. You not know how much it means to me to have a good head start for this fund raising project. " Cheers! :)


Hey Gang,


Thanks for looking at my project first of all. For those that don't know me, my name is C.H.Ng. I've been a fan of comics most of my life, and throughout my love of comics, roleplaying and gaming, I've always had these stories waiting to get out, whether it was work, heartbreak, trying better at drawing, these stories still called out to be told.

And I have not just sit with wishful thinking of seeing my stories crystalize. Previously I have published hardcopy comics with works like " Fate of Three Kingdoms"  and "Roshido" Short Story ( Tales of the Onin War ). 

You can visit CH-Ng.com to have a view of my earlier works. Most of these previous projects are self funded and the return I got was merely below break even point ! Getting funds to propel my future works has become increasingly difficult as I need to strike a balance between passion and my Bread & Butter. 

Thanks to sites like Indiegogo, it really was a no brainer to just go ahead and tell my tales! With the help of crowdfunding my next dream might actually be realized. And with your help I hope to share my next dream with you!! This dream is to publish my '"Sherman" story in comic book form, and maybe one day lead to bigger things in the future! I want you to join me here at the inception. 

Be introduced to characters and world of Sherman - A Robot / Mecha Superhero.

The title of this book "Sherman" is in actual fact the name of an American battle tank that was deployed during the Second World War. Base on historical records, Sherman is a well rounded medium tank with good mobility, speed and firepower.These advantages along with it's relative ease of production had made her the primary U.S tanks and it had given the US army a numerical superiority over the Axis. Sherman were removed from the frontline after the korean war and thus mark an end to this legendary tank. 

While brainstorming for the robot character design, I made constant references to the picturial details of a Sherman Tank Model and incorporate them into the Tank-Man final sketch. This comic book will put a smile on your faces, and entertain you. My hope is to have you fall in love with my characters and want to spend time in the world that they take place in. 



What Are Needed


The Sherman Short Story is already completed and is now being sent for editorial process. My Goal is to get a funding of $2000. What does it cover? Mainly printing! And shipping and the Booth Expenses for Comic Convention in Singapore. 

If the goal of $2000 is reached, there will be a book launch and an exhibition at the Singapore Toy, Games and Comics Convention 2014. STGCC is a major comic event in Singapore and the best place to introduce new comic product to a large crowd.

If the funding goal exceed $2000, an additional larger print run will be considered based on pre-orders. 

If the goal of $2000 is not reach through crowd funding, all perks will still be provided and I'll use on line marketing and print on demand to get this book out to the world. The deadline is September 2014.


What You Get


To the minimum contributors get at least a Sherman digital copy in PDF format.

The Artist Signed Hardcopy Book :

  • Paperback - A5 Size
  • Black and White Art
  • plus Sherman Concept Art & Sketches
  • Approximately 64 pages



I hope most people will choose to get a physical copy. There is nothing like actually having the comic book in your hand. More details in the perks section. 

Furthermore you can own some of my previous comics works like  " Fate of Three Kingdoms"  ( 220 pgs ) and "Roshido -Tales of the Onin War ( 42 pgs ) if you decide to choose anything above the Collector Perk. Hence you can actually get a value package of more stories by contributing more. I include here a video of these works for your view. If you are interested to find out more of my other works simply go to my website at CH-Ng.com.




Other Ways You Can Help


Tweet or blog about Sherman! * Tell a friend using the share tools! * Watch Sherman campaign! * Talk about Sherman on a first date - it's sure to be memorable! 

Thanks very, very, much for even contemplating a donation! Even if you are just broke as a joke, but still want to contribute. Here's a deal, if you share this somehow or advertise this project I will give you a digital copy of Roshido - Tales of the Onin War FREE! Every little counts even well wishes. Thank you.

story:
**UPDATES** 

1. WE REACHED OUR TARGET!  But don't worry, if you want to help us out there's still plenty of time until the closing date, until which point we can continue to receive contributions.  Any spillover will go directly towards printing more copies, t-shirts and other merchandise for the world to enjoy. THANKS EVERYONE. 

2. Due to several cases of multiple contributions per person, some have mentioned they don't require the combined number of issues (usually 10) from the set Perk Packages. If you let us know how many issues/t-shirts you want when you make a donation, we can make a simple adjustment to the package we send you.


Now back to your regular scheduled programming...


Ladies & Gentlemen!

"Ladies & Gentlemen" is the brainchild of myself (Richard Worth) and my buddy Jordan Collver (a real Canadian!). It's a silver age style comic about a group of Victorian crime fighters. Whilst we have worked together on other projects, most notably a horror short called "The Land of All Sorts" (that has yet to see the light of day) and a comic card-trick called "Sleight of Hand" (that appeared in the fine pages of The Sorry Entertainer Anthology... it's good, go check it out) this is our first full-length comic. It's going to be the knees of the bees, but dont take our word for it, donate and see for yourself.

The Team

Our story's ragtag team consists of a roguish spy called The Peppered Moth; a ne'er-do-well alcoholic and former stage magician who goes by the name of Hex Vincente; a mute bruiser and his psychotic wife, The Lady and the Gentleman; and a portly Northern engineer called Ned.


What We Need & What You Get

We are attempting to raise £375 in order to help cover the printing cost of around 225 full sized black and white comics.  Any spillover will go towards various merchandise like buttons, leaflets and T-shirts, but the main concern is to get the comics themselves published and read by you fine folks.


What your contributions will get you:

£5--  A copy of issue one and your name in the Special Thanks section, and a poster-sized copy of "Sleight of Hand," our short story featuring the Hex character.


£10--   3 copies of issue one (why not give the extra two to friends, family, a beloved and intelligent pet or a highly influential comics publisher), "Sleight of Hand," the five page horror short "Land of All Sorts," and your name in the Thanks.


£20--  5 copies of issue one, all the treats from the £10 donation PLUS an exclusive Ladies & Gentlemen T-shirt seen in the Gallery section (make sure to tell us exactly how skinny and perfectly formed your bodies are when you donate). 


We are hoping to launch at the Thought Bubble Sequential Art Festival in Leeds on the 19-20th of November. Hopefully we'll be able to raise enough funds to actually have something on our table there....otherwise that might be awkward and slightly odd. See you guys there!


Please Note: All the donation stuff is in dollars (USD) on this site but rest assured our goal is in pounds (GBP). IndieGoGo will automatically take care of any currency exchange for you, so you can put your calculators away. Also kindly ignore the spelling mistakes in the Perks section when selecting your contribution... they are permanent blunders.


Other Ways You Can Help

Hey even if you can't donate, you can always come along to Though Bubble and pick up an issue. Other than that if any of you wonderful people out there frequent twitter, facebook or even just rant in the street like a lunatic, please let people know about our campaign. This is going to be our first published project together and we're as excited to share it with you guys as we where making it.

story:
Il Lamezia Comics & Co… è una fiera del fumetto nata in Calabria nel 2009.

Quest’anno siamo alle porte della settima edizione che ci vedrà protagonisti di 3 giorni pieni di fumetti, giochi, workshop e tanto divertimento. La manifestazione, ad INGRESSO GRATUITO, offre a tutti la possibilità di respirare l’aria incantata di questo mondo. 



Questa campagna è stata ideata per aiutare la realizzazione della manifestazione dei nostri sogni: abbiamo fissato l'obiettivo da raggiungere a 10,000 €. perché sappiamo che con questa cifra potremmo garantire la realizzazione di una fiera all'altezza delle vostre aspettative. 

Qualunque sia il ricavato, sarà interamente impiegato nell'allestimento dell'evento e per coprire i costi di strutture, allestimento, degli ospiti e della pubblicità. 

Ogni centesimo sarà usato saggiamente affinché la fiera possa trarne il massimo beneficio. Tutti i perk sono infatti stati pensati per poter essere unici, esclusivi e ad edizione limitata. 

Alla fine della campagna butteremo lo stampo in un pozzo molto profondo così che nessuno possa replicarli.

Ringraziamenti Social 

Qualsiasi sia il vostro contributo vi ringrazieremo sui nostri social network, far sapere al mondo che ci avete aiutato è importante e fondamentale per noi.

Cartolina

Un’illustrazione in edizione limitata del nostro manifesto, numerata ed ottenibile esclusivamente attraverso la partecipazione a questa campagna. 

Dimensioni: 10 x 15 cm.


Poster

Il poster avrà un’illustrazione in edizione limitata del nostro manifesto. Anche queste immagini saranno numerate e reperibili esclusivamente durante questa raccolta fondi.

Dimensioni: 35 x 50 cm.


Albo

La nostra idea è quella di raccogliere opere di amici e ospiti della manifestazione per realizzare un’opera unica ed esclusiva da potervi offrire. Nel corso della campagna vi sveleremo tutti i nomi e qualche illustrazione in anteprima. Per il momento all'interno potrete trovare la storia "Ernest Egg e il canto di Ligea" realizzata appositamente da Paul Izzo, Stefano Bosi Fioravanti e Antonio Nonnato.  Tutto questo in Blank Cover, così ognuno di voi potrà personalizzare la copertina come meglio crede. Anche l’albo sarà ovviamente in edizione limitata e numerata.


Albo Contributor

Non vuoi semplicemente avere L’Albo fra le mani? Vuoi farne parte?… ecco questo è il regalo giusto, all’interno del volume metteremo il tuo nome fra i ringraziamenti.


T-shirt

Avrà un’illustrazione unica creata appositamente per il crowdfounding .


Pranzo del Sabato

PASSERAI UN PIACEVOLE PRANZO assieme agli ospiti di questa edizione e il presidente dell'Associazione !!!


Pranzo della Domenica

PASSERAI UN PIACEVOLE PRANZO assieme agli ospiti di questa edizione e il presidente dell'Associazione !!!


Combo Pack.

La possibilità di avere tutti i premi in varie formule. 

Lo scorso anno abbiamo creato una campagna crowdfounding per farci aiutare a realizzare la sesta edizione, raggiungendo 1,631€ su 10,000€ 


Le incertezze sulla realizzazione della manifestazione sono tante, poiché ogni anno affrontiamo grandi difficoltà visto che come ogni organizzazione no profit aspettiamo finanziamenti e bandi pubblici, sempre pochi e molte volte con requisiti per l’accesso proibitivi. Il nostro unico obiettivo è quello di creare una fiera libera per tutti senza biglietti di ingresso o altri vincoli e voi potreste darci una mano con un semplice contributo, monetario o social.

Come ogni anno ci metteremo tanta voglia di fare, coraggio e ore di sonno mancato. 

Anche se non ci darete una mano in termini economici, vi ringrazieremo di cuore se ci aiuterete a condividere questa campagna e a sostenere il Lamezia Comics & Co.

Noi siamo Attivamente, un’associazione culturale no profit di Lamezia Terme, una ridente cittadina al centro della Calabria.Siamo un gruppo di giovani, che opera sul territorio cittadino e regionale da ben cinque anni. Le  passioni che ci accomunano ci hanno portato a riunirci e creare tante iniziative culturali,ludiche e sociali. 

 Grazie di cuore <3.

story:
Hello

Barking Bad is going to sweep you off your feet and take you on a journey that will spark your curiosity and leave you wanting to find out what is lurking in those back alleys and dog parks.  You'll never know unless you're willing to take a walk on the WILD side.... 

When Brock Wurst (a.k.a. The Big Sausage), a gruff, older Dachshund and Top Dog of the New Jersey Canine Cartel, discovers the Canadian Cartel’s Top Dog, Mr. Labatzki, a sinister, older Rottweiler, is selling “treats” (drugs) on his turf, Brock declares war on him and his younger business partner, Blue, a scrappy Irish Terrier.

This leads Brock, his gang of “made” mongrels and family on a sinful and erotically captivating journey of jaw-dropping twists and unexpected betrayals, involving constant conflict with the authorities and adversaries. Queenie, his sly and devoted wife, supports Brock’s illegal doings to ensure her lavish lifestyle, while Rocco and Lulu, their two teenage kids are constantly barking down the wrong alleys. And as they lick their wounds, these lovable anti-heroes manage to capture our hearts.

BROCK WURST (a.k.a. The Big Sausage) is the Top Dog of the New Jersey Canine Cartel. Brock is an older, heavy set Dachshund with a gruff and tough demeanor, powerful, but fair and with a heart of gold when it comes to his family and close friends. Warning: Don’t encroach on his turf!
QUEENIE, Brock’s devoted wife is a cunning and attractive Dachshund who supports Brock’s criminal activities in order to enjoy her lavish lifestyle. She has an air of sophistication, yet is a caring and attentive mother. She speaks with a heavy New Jersey accent, often giving away her humble beginnings.
ROCCO WURST is Brock and Queenie’s teenage son, a natural leader, very outgoing and charismatic, rebellious and street smart, yet possesses a devout loyalty to his friends and loved ones. Although he plays hard, he cares deeply, making him a true anti-hero.
LULU WURST is Brock and Queenie’s teenage daughter. The girl with the twirl! Prissy and alluring, yet kind-hearted and naïve, devoted to her family. She has a child-like sweetness, but has a hard time controlling her sexy, wild side!


Hi! I’m Kathy…and Barking Bad is the story I was always destined to write.

Barking Bad is a comic book reflection of my vivid imagination, love for animals, fondness for mafia movies, and some hilarious misadventures (somewhat exaggerated) as a former private investigator in Los Angeles, the City of Angels, where everyone is decidedly not angelic.

It started out as a whimsical, fun project that I wanted my son, Shawn, who is a talented illustrator and animator, (and Saturday morning cartoon addict) to draw as a comic book. But the more I developed the characters, the more my imagination ran wild. That’s when I knew I could never let these “sleeping dogs lie," and I've spent the past two years developing this continuing saga of unending havoc in the lives of my colorful characters.

My desire is to have this story published as an ongoing Graphic Novel series. But my DREAM is to bring these characters to life someday via animation to become a movie, mini-series or ongoing television series.

By incorporating themes from successful shows like The Sopranos, The Godfather and Breaking Bad, but using a comical twist and making the characters canine and feline, it puts a unique and captivating spin on such popular themes.

The characters are both mature and young, and likeable and sinister, so they bridge the generation gap and make the story appealing for a wide range of adult audiences. Yes, this is an edgy story, and not appropriate for the younger ones.

So, I invite you to join me on this unpredictable journey, and I promise you these charismatic and cantankerous characters will delight and amuse you...and may even come back to BITE you!

But, fair warning to all: the BADDER they bark, the harder they fall!

Character drawings illustrated by Shawn Branden

Comic book pages illustrated by Sam Angus Jackson, a talented, young artist from Austin, Texas, whose inherited artistic gift left him no choice but to pick up a pen and draw. It's in his blood.

PAGE 6  Illustrated by Sam Angus Jackson




What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting $9,000, which will cover the art and printing for at least the first 2 issues. The funding I am requesting will help me to pay the artist, get the issues to print, and promote the project.

The art for the first issue is complete and the writing is finished for the first 40 issues! I need help funding Chapter Two and Chapter Three. So far I've been funding this project out of my own pocket... and lets just say, my pockets are getting lighter by the day. I have so much story to tell and I want to see it all through. Our team is extremely devoted and excited about this project and desire to share it.  So, we are asking for your support  by backing our campaign. If you can't back the campaign financially, another way to help is to share the campaign with friends who you think will enjoy it. 

We sincerely appreciate any help you can give us. Thank you for contributing to our project. 

If you'd like to see the story so far, please visit our website: www.barkingbadcartoon.com 


Here are some samples of the perks we are offering:   

                              

                                           RollingBone Magazine Poster

                     

                                                     Barking Bad T-Shirt

Our other perks include a  personalized Barking Bad character based on your dog, cat, or YOU! Based on the perk selected, your character will either be an extra or be a re-occurring character throughout the span of the comic.

story:
Stretch Goal 1 - (Locked) Unlock at $3500 / Limited and Exclusive 11x17 Print by: Leonardo Colapietro Colors by: Marco Pagnotta. Print will be available to everyone who has pledged after Goal 1 is Unlocked. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Stretch Goal 2 - (Locked) Unlock at $4000 / Stretch Goal Cover will be available to everyone as an 17x11 Print Pencils by: Steve Firchow, Colors by Steve and Inks by Joe Weems

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Stretch Goal #3 - (Locked) unlock at $4500 / This Exclusive Cover will be available to everyone as an 11x17 Print and to anyone who contributes above $50 as an EXCLUSIVE cover. This here cover is our way of saying Thank You to Frank Frazetta for inspiring all of us to continue with TOA and make this Sword and Scorcery story of ours happen. 

Short Summary

A medieval adventure where warriors must join forces, caught in the center of an epic battle between angels and demons.

Welcome to the first issue of The Tribulations of Abaddon!

As humanity prospers and kingdoms grow, the balance of good and evil shifts into chaos when the demon Syria escapes from the dark bowels of Hell. On Earth, the Sumerian city of Larsa begins to consume itself as a demonic plague begins to spread at an overwhelming rate. Its defending warriors desperately strive to maintain their existence, and ensure their survival, by coming together. They overcome great odds as they fight for their lives, caught in the war between Heaven and Hell.

 

FROM THE CREATOR:

Hey everyone! My name is David Sandoval, and I am here to ask for your help in making the first issue of “The Tribulations of Abaddon” a reality. The journey to produce this fantastic tale has been a long one. I’ve been working on T.O.A. for a few years, and in the process of development I came together with a fantastic team of artists who have helped me create this labor of love.

What We Need & What You Get

This is where you can help. I’ve been personally funding the creative production of this book, but I can’t do it alone -- and producing the physical comic is a financial challenge in itself. We’re looking forward to getting this story out to comic fans everywhere, so we can show everyone what an epic adventure we’ve created. We’re hoping to find enough support to make this a successful Kickstarter and make the book happen. We’ve gotten some great reactions from our fellow creators, artists and fans in the industry, so we’re even more excited than ever about bringing this comic to you.

One of the things about self-publishing that isn’t often spoken about, is the expenses. When I got into writing, I never imagined myself putting together a comic.Two years later, here I am and the most difficult thing isn’t finding the talent, it’s paying for quality work.

I decided to try Indiegogo to not only help pay the artists for their hard work on the book, but to actually get it into people’s hands in both print and digital format. I started N.A.S Studios for this very reason: I love telling stories. I have actually been working on developing the story of The Tribulations of Abaddon for over five years; finally I got the script to where I wanted it. Being a history buff as well as a huge fantasy and horror fan, I took all that I loved and turned it into this epic adventure.

If you love monsters, demons, barbarians, sword fighting and beautiful women, then helping to fund the production of The Tribulations of Abaddon is for you. And lets not forget all of the awesome REWARDS we have lined up for you guys.

The funding ($3000) will be used to help pay for the interior sequential art, which includes: pencils by Kris Cagle, inks by Juan Albarran, colors by Tommy Shelton, lettering by Kel Nuttall, post-production graphic design by Raymond Dowaliby, and the printing and Distribution of T.O.A. #1 

This first issue will have 24 pages of story as well as 8 pages of bonus materials including concept sketches and pinup art. That's a 32 page book!

The Team:

Interiors by: Kris Cagle

Inks by: Juan Albarran

Colors by: Tommy Shelton

Lettering by: Kel Nuttall

REWARDS - We worked really hard to put together rewards for everyone helping out with our campaign. We hope that you'll enjoy them. I'll be posting Work In Progress pictures of the Rewards as they become available. For now, here are some of the penciled and inked covers, pinups and other original artwork up for grabs: 

Covers by: 

Romano Molenaar / Jonathan Glapion / Thomas Mason 

Patrick Blaine / Jonathan Glapion / Steve Firchow

Richard Bonk / Kevin Conrad / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!

Kevin Conrad / Jonathan Glapion / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!

Richard Bonk / Patrick Blaine / Kris Cagle / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!

Paolo Pantalena / Nei Ruffino - Coming Soon! 

Patrick Blaine / Joe Weems / Steve Firchow 

FAQ:

Do we ship outside the USA or Canada?

Yes we do! Please add $10 to cover all shipments outside the USA and Canada.

For more information about other current available titles go to. 

www.nasstudios.net 

The Impact

What's been said about The Story (The Tribulations of Abaddon)

“The Tribulations of Abaddon is one of those rare projects that comes along and combines everything I love about high fantasy in the comic medium. N.A.S Studios is putting together an incredible tale of sword, sorcery, angels and demons and I am very excited to be involved in helping to bring this to life!”    - Patrick Blaine (penciler/artist for Top Cow, Dark Horse, DC)

“TOA… monsters, demons, hot women, badass men. And a great storyline to boot! I am looking forward to my involvement with this project."
- Kevin Conrad (inker/artist for Image, DC)

"T.O.A. is a BIG story... Big, over-sized people shooting off their big, over-sized mouths in a big, over-sized adventure! Feeding T.O.A.'s 'bigness' however, is a deep pool of subtlety.The characters are relevant, original and complex, and the settings are familiar enough to be engaging without being predictable. T.O.A.'s dialogue is loaded with humor and emotion, while remaining happily free of the campy bulls**t that is the lingua franca of modern Sword and Sorcery. The script paints crystal clear pictures -- I wish I were the artist drawing it! Its going to be a fun, epic saga and I can't wait to see it all come together!"                                                -Steve Firchow (artist/colorist for Top Cow, DC, Marvel)

Everyone at N.A.S Studios is putting in there heart and soul to this project. 

Having worked on this story for a few years and having one of the best teams I've had the privilege of working with I feel TOA is a story that not only will it be noticed but will stand out with its great cover art and epic story telling. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We undrestand that times are a little tough on us So if you can’t contribute, Help us make noise about the project and use that Indiegogo share tools!

I'd like to THANK YOU all in advance.   -David Sandoval

We’re hoping to find enough support to make this a successful Kickstarter and make the book happen. We’ve gotten some great reactions from our fellow creators, artists and fans in the industry, so we’re even more excited than ever about bringing this comic to you.
One of the things about self-publishing that isn’t often spoken about, is the expenses. When I got into writing, I never imagined myself putting together a comic.Two years later, here I am and the most difficult thing isn’t finding the talent, it’s paying for quality work.
I decided to try Indiegogo to not only help pay the artists for their hard work on the book, but to actually get it into people’s hands in both print and digital format. I started N.A.S Studios for this very reason: I love telling stories. I have actually been working on developing the story of The Tribulations of Abaddon for over five years; finally I got the script to where I wanted it. Being a history buff as well as a huge fantasy and horror fan, I took all that I loved and turned it into this epic adventure.
If you love monsters, demons, barbarians, sword fighting and beautiful women, then helping to fund the production of The Tribulations of Abaddon is for you. And lets not forget all of the awesome REWARDS we have lined up for you guys.
The funding ($3000) will be used to help pay for the interior sequential art, which includes: pencils by Kris Cagle, inks by Juan Albarran, colors by Tommy Shelton, lettering by Kel Nuttall, post-production graphic design by Raymond Dowaliby, and the printing and Distribution of T.O.A. #1 This first issue will have 24 pages of story as well as 8 pages of bonus materials including concept sketches and pinup art. That's a 32 page book!
The Team:
Interiors by: Kris Cagle
Inks by: Juan Albarran
Colors by: Tommy Shelton
Lettering by: Kel Nuttall
REWARDS - We worked really hard to put together rewards for everyone helping out with our campaign. We hope that you'll enjoy them. I'll be posting Work In Progress pictures of the Rewards as they become available. For now, here are some of the penciled and inked covers, pinups and other original artwork up for grabs: 






Covers by: 
Romano Molenaar / Jonathan Glapion / Thomas Mason 

Patrick Blaine / Jonathan Glapion / Steve Firchow

Richard Bonk / Kevin Conrad / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!
Kevin Conrad / Jonathan Glapion / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!
Richard Bonk / Patrick Blaine / Kris Cagle / Thomas Mason - Coming Soon!
Paolo Pantalena / Nei Ruffino - Coming Soon! 
Patrick Blaine / Joe Weems / Steve Firchow 

FAQ:
Do we ship outside the USA or Canada?
Yes we do! Please add $10 to cover all shipments outside the USA and Canada.
For more information about other current available titles go to. 
www.nasstudios.net 

The Impact


What's been said about The Story (The Tribulations of Abaddon)
“The Tribulations of Abaddon is one of those rare projects that comes along and combines everything I love about high fantasy in the comic medium. N.A.S Studios is putting together an incredible tale of sword, sorcery, angels and demons and I am very excited to be involved in helping to bring this to life!”    - Patrick Blaine (penciler/artist for Top Cow, Dark Horse, DC)
“TOA… monsters, demons, hot women, badass men. And a great storyline to boot! I am looking forward to my involvement with this project."- Kevin Conrad (inker/artist for Image, DC)
"T.O.A. is a BIG story... Big, over-sized people shooting off their big, over-sized mouths in a big, over-sized adventure! Feeding T.O.A.'s 'bigness' however, is a deep pool of subtlety.The characters are relevant, original and complex, and the settings are familiar enough to be engaging without being predictable. T.O.A.'s dialogue is loaded with humor and emotion, while remaining happily free of the campy bulls**t that is the lingua franca of modern Sword and Sorcery. The script paints crystal clear pictures -- I wish I were the artist drawing it! Its going to be a fun, epic saga and I can't wait to see it all come together!"                                                -Steve Firchow (artist/colorist for Top Cow, DC, Marvel)


Everyone at N.A.S Studios is putting in there heart and soul to this project. 
Having worked on this story for a few years and having one of the best teams I've had the privilege of working with I feel TOA is a story that not only will it be noticed but will stand out with its great cover art and epic story telling. 
Other Ways You Can Help
We undrestand that times are a little tough on us So if you can’t contribute, Help us make noise about the project and use that Indiegogo share tools!
I'd like to THANK YOU all in advance.   -David Sandoval

​LOCKED: $12,000 I'll include to ALL BACKERS an NEW 12-page story of DEMONS that I will write and draw that will take place between Vol. 1 and 2. 

Each perk will come with THREE FREE INDIE COMICS! 

 

Included in the Volume 2 is the crossover "Hollow Girl vs Demons" by Tyler Carpenter and Luke Cooper (creator of Hollow Girl). The story directly ties into the Demons storyline and introduces the character of Hollow Girl into the Demons Universe. 

 

 

DEMONS is created by Tyler Carpenter with art by Trevis Martinez. 

First stretch goal = $3000 EXCLUSIVE TO BACKERS :) What could it be?

story:
About Me

My name is Brandon and I'm an Illustration graduate from Massachusetts college of Art and Design. I live in Massachusetts, just north of boston and I love to draw. I've been drawing since I was about 5 and trying to make comics for just as long. I've always been attracted to story and feel a natural affinity to try and tell stories.

Match, to date, is my first comic completely created on my own. I did all of the drawing, the inking, lettering and editing myself. It started as a project while I was at massart to create a comic and post a page regularily every friday as a way to discipline myself. It took hours of writing and rewriting script pages and finding the right models for my characters but once I sat down and began to draw it finally all felt right.

For its successes and failures, Match is still very close to me. It's my first completed story, a story thats defined my voice, my style and other stories I'm writing for the future. It's my ultimate dream and goal to have a printed version, with all my extras in tow that I couldnt have dreamed to have in one collection. It would mean so much to me to have the hard copy to go to comic cons with and promote my work. I feel like it would strengthen my presence as a young Illustrator.

Thank you for your time and for reading!



The Details

The comic itself will cost me $900 to print and bind into trade paperback(not counting the cost of shipping). It's a difficult goal to meet on my own so any contribution would be greatly appreciated.

As a special thank you, I'm going to include bonuses for different levels of contribution!

 

The Impact

With the comic already completed in digital format it would be so powerful to see in a complete printed format. To include all of the extras that I've worked on and have it all together for the first time would be very integral to making my first steps in the comic industry. It would open the doors to artist gallery and vendor tables at local cons and help build relationships with other local creators.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are still other ways to help outside of cash donations! Any reposting or sharing of this page is greatly appreciated. Also sharing the blogspot could be a huge help too! again its located for free at match-the-comic.blogspot.com!

story:
Hallo liebe Heerscharler!

Ich möchte einen Manga zeichnen, der in unserer imperialen Welt spielt. Dafür benötige ich jedoch Arbeitsgerät, genauer einen Laptop und Zubehör. Für dessen Finanzierung bitte ich um eure Hilfe!

Angeschafft werden sollen:

  • Ein Laptop
  • Ein Drucker
  • Ein Zeichenprogramm

Jeglicher Überschuss aus dieser Sammelaktion fließt direkt in Dinge wie Copics, Toner und Papier, aber auch ein qualitatives Zeichentablett soll irgendwann dazukommen.

Ich werde noch keine Details verraten, aber macht euch auf eine imperiale Story, sowohl mit bekannten als auch neuen Charakteren, in einem Inplay-Setting gefasst! Bitte unterstützt mich dabei, diese Idee Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen.

Imperiale Grüße,
eure YueDee

story:
THE CONTRAPTOR #3!!!

Hey Everyone! This is the 3rd installment of The Contraptor comic book series. Because we want to continue to satisfy our supporters we have made sure that the book was printed BEFORE the fundraiser was set up. We at LFDF Comics want to get our supporters their comics and other stuff quickly and in high quality! 

Why is LFDF Comics doing a fundraiser?


  • We wanted to make sure that the supporters outside of the Las Vegas area can get The Contraptor comic even if they are thousands of miles away! We have great supporters in Hawaii, Arizona, Alaska, California, Utah, Denver, and many more. So, we wanted to keep the people outside of LV in the loop with getting their favorite steampunk adventurer!!!
  • LFDF Comics have always given extra love to our supporters. From the first book we put out we here at LFDF COmics try to give special incentives for your  support. We were the first in LV to give away METAL TRADING CARDS, the first in LV to give away LFDF CASINO CHIPS, and LFDF will be the first to give away the "surprise" perks to all supporters!!! 
  • All funds raised will be used for shipping (it cost more to ship than the comic and perks), printing, and other promo material.

Because this is out 3rd funding campaign, we know what we are doing...now! HA!

We had a few bumps in the road on the last campaign. We didn't consider events and convention schedules, produce production time, vendor schedules, etc. We won't make that mistake twice! LFDF Comics has a specific plan to correct our misjudgment in the past and will make sure our supporters are happy!!!

story:
Project Summary

Our motto: Provide QUALITY storytelling with EXCELLENT artwork!!!

Before I introduce myself I think it worthy to introduce someone else...

The wonderful artist on the project, Glenn Jones, has been working professionally as a Designer and Illustrator for over 12 years. His skills include hand drawing techniques, animation and typography. He has a lot of experience working with clients on a wide range of exciting projects, including storyboards, animation, album covers, merchandising, packaging and advertising. And that is why I hired him!

Check out his website: http://www.wretchedgingerboy.com

Glenn Jones, Comic Book Artist


Jose Arana, Creator & Writer

It's nice to "meet" you! I'm Jose. You can call me Jose Arana, but that'd be kinda lame considering we're on a first name basis here! So please call me Jose :). I'm the writer/creator of the new fantasy comic Chronicles of a Necromancer, and I've loved reading & writing since I can remember. This story is about a female college student who discovers that she is a necromancer. Not only that, but...SPOILER ALERT...she seems to share some kind of metaphysical relationship with the Greek gods. This is a tale of mystery, magic, love and - of course - fantasy! 

Themes Present: 

  • Female Empowerment
  • Coming of Age
  • Darkness and Light

I have worked very hard to save up money so that I could provide Issue 1 right away to you guys! Glenn has done a FANTASTIC job, and I can't wait to have you guys read it! I know you'll love it :). 

This campaign is to complete Volume 1, which means Issues 2-7. I've written out the scripts for all issues of Volume 1, which means all we need is the minimum amount of money ($6,300 USD) to proceed to finish the first batch. Note: I do have plans to create Volume 2, and I already have the overarching story outlined. 

Why is this campaign only Vol. 1?

  • Feasibility - It is more feasible to create 6 comic books first since it is a grueling process for the artist. To save you and me some $ I hired someone who is excellent at what he does and is also multi-talented. He not only does the artwork. He also does the coloring and lettering for the comics. Usually, you'd hire someone for each of these tasks, but that would greatly increase costs. 
  • Story Potential - I love creating these characters. They truly speak to me, and it's funny how I can finish writing one or two comics in a day if my muses are there and the time is right. The thing is, I can love these characters 'til death do us part, but the real firework event is when you guys love them, as well. For that reason, I chose to wait and see what kind of reaction I get from readers and fans before proceeding to the next volume of comic books. If Volume 1 exceeds my expectations in terms of the response I get, I promise you that the next volume will be BIGGER and BETTER!!!
  • Room for Improvement - As in all creative projects, there is always room for improvement. By only creating Vol. 1 first I am able to pause afterward and see what the reaction is from readers/fans so that when I start Volume 2 I can make the necessary changes and improvements to the story and the presentation of the comic book. 

CHARITY: For every Issue 1 sold through this campaign TWO digital comics will be donated to the non-profit organization Comics For Kids (@comics4_kids). They help underprivileged children, as well as those with special needs, by providing them with the BEST GIFT: a comic book. For more info: https://www.facebook.com/Comicsforkids

Just remember the kid in you and don't hesitate! You know when you like something. No questions asked! Any support will be MUCH appreciated. This includes retweeting @MythicJose, telling your friends, liking my Facebook page (www.facebook.com/chroniclesofanecromancer), and basically showing any sign of support! Even a message of "I love the project" keeps me motivated! hehe ^_^

Budget

Most of the money will be going directly to paying the professional comic artist. As mentioned before, I hired someone who is excellent at what he does and is also multi-talented. He not only does the artwork. He also does the coloring and lettering for the comics. Usually, you'd hire someone for each of these tasks, but that would greatly increase costs. 

I will NEVER use the money received in this campaign for personal use. All expenses are to ensure the comic is made, advertised and promoted in the best way possible. 

If we receive even more money than we need for the minimum expenses, I want to assure you that we WILL put that money to good use. We will spend that money on marketing to further increase the value of your investment.

Thank You

Thank you for donating your time and money! It means THE WORLD 2 me :). And know that no matter how much you pay, you TRULY have made a DIFFERENCE!!!


Credits (video):

SFX

“Lightning rain” by beman87 is licensed under CC BY 2.0

“Violent Thunderstorm at Polo field Rowfant” by Simon Spiers is licensed under CC BY 2.0

“Back we go to the patio!” by NoiseCollector is licensed under CC BY 2.0

“Lightning_strike” by artifact is licensed under CC BY 2.0

MUSIC

“Blanks” by Upbeat is licensed under CC BY 2.0

“Good Times” by Upbeat is licensed under CC BY 2.0

http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Podington_Bear/Upbeat/
