story:
Short Summary

Hello Comic Fans!

My name is Ray Whitcher and I'm from South Africa (yup, that tiny country right at the bottom of the Africa). My friend Moray Rhoda and I were invited by the San Diego Comic Convention to present our panel: The Velocity Anthology - Comic Art of Africa and Australia on Thursday the 18th of July at 6:30pm.

Moray is the South African Publisher of the anthology and I am one of the administrators of the South African Arts forum Legionink.com. Together, our organisations have strived to create a viable and high-quality comic output in collaboration with Neville Howard, who is based in Australia and publishes the anthology there. I am a scholar of comic adaptation theory (with research outputs published in The Arts in Media journal) and Moray is a designer and part-time lecturer in Cape Town, and is a member of the TDT comic group as well as being co-founder of Velocity Anthology with Neville Howard. We are extremely passionate and dedicated to our cause, and when presented with the opportunity to showcase the work of South Africa and Australia and demonstrate the international standards of our artistic outputs.

This is a MASSIVE achievement for us, as it will be a South African first to present a panel at SDCC, especially because we've been given a slot on the openining night. We've also been given a 90minute-long slot, which is an honour in of itself!

We do have a slight problem though... We only received notification of our acceptance to the panels yesterday and have had no chance to organise funding to get to San Diego, hence doing this crowd-funding initiative.

What We Need & What You Get

Right, so to get to nitty-gritty, Moray and I are both lecturers and hence not exactly in the best of financial means to pay for air tickets. So we're looking to raise approximately $5000 to cover our travel expenses. If we get more, that'd be AMAZING!

It's really just to pay for our flights as Moray and I will sort out our own accommodation fees. We'll happily list you as a contributor to the initiative and add you in to our presentation. I will also be happy to blog/vlog/tweet for any major corporates that sponsor us as well. (Obviously this would be more beneficial to South African and Australian organisations that wouldn't normally have access to this convention).

We'll be taking the Anthology with us and will be showing it to the big boys like Marvel, DC, Image and Dark Horse as well as network with publishers we love such as IDW, Dynamite Entertainment and UK's Com-X. We hope to expose South African and Australian comic artists as extensively as possible.

We will use every cent that we raise to get there, even if we don't make our target, so any donation big or small would be massively beneficial!

The Impact

Moray and I will keep an updated blog running on our experience at SDCC and I'd be very keen to do a feature on Cosplay as well. Once we've returned, I am going to be writing and contributing new research outputs about Comics in South Africa and how to take them further. Our panel will hopefully also open the door to many previously underexposed Australian and South African artists and show the world what we're made of.

Read the 100page Preview BELOW

We've collated stories from issues 1, 2 & 3 to show the level of work in the Velocity Anthology and you can read it by clicking on the "100p Preview" button below. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help us financially, please feel free to spread this campaign around as much as possible, especially if you know of any corporates or potential sponsors that'd be keen to help! We'd be eternally grateful to you. :)

My friend Moray Rhoda and I were invited by the San Diego Comic Convention to present our panel: The Velocity Anthology - Comic Art of Africa and Australia on Thursday the 18th of July at 6:30pm. 
Moray is the South African Publisher of the anthology and I am one of the administrators of the South African Arts forum Legionink.com. Together, our organisations have strived to create a viable and high-quality comic output in collaboration with Neville Howard, who is based in Australia and publishes the anthology there. I am a scholar of comic adaptation theory (with research outputs published in The Arts in Media journal) and Moray is a designer and part-time lecturer in Cape Town, and is a member of the TDT comic group as well as being co-founder of Velocity Anthology with Neville Howard. We are extremely passionate and dedicated to our cause, and when presented with the opportunity to showcase the work of South Africa and Australia and demonstrate the international standards of our artistic outputs. 
This is a MASSIVE achievement for us, as it will be a South African first to present a panel at SDCC, especially because we've been given a slot on the openining night. We've also been given a 90minute-long slot, which is an honour in of itself!
We do have a slight problem though... We only received notification of our acceptance to the panels yesterday and have had no chance to organise funding to get to San Diego, hence doing this crowd-funding initiative.


What We Need & What You Get
Right, so to get to nitty-gritty, Moray and I are both lecturers and hence not exactly in the best of financial means to pay for air tickets. So we're looking to raise approximately $5000 to cover our travel expenses. If we get more, that'd be AMAZING!
It's really just to pay for our flights as Moray and I will sort out our own accommodation fees. We'll happily list you as a contributor to the initiative and add you in to our presentation. I will also be happy to blog/vlog/tweet for any major corporates that sponsor us as well. (Obviously this would be more beneficial to South African and Australian organisations that wouldn't normally have access to this convention).
We'll be taking the Anthology with us and will be showing it to the big boys like Marvel, DC, Image and Dark Horse as well as network with publishers we love such as IDW, Dynamite Entertainment and UK's Com-X. We hope to expose South African and Australian comic artists as extensively as possible.
We will use every cent that we raise to get there, even if we don't make our target, so any donation big or small would be massively beneficial!


The Impact
Moray and I will keep an updated blog running on our experience at SDCC and I'd be very keen to do a feature on Cosplay as well. Once we've returned, I am going to be writing and contributing new research outputs about Comics in South Africa and how to take them further. Our panel will hopefully also open the door to many previously underexposed Australian and South African artists and show the world what we're made of.
Read the 100page Preview BELOW
We've collated stories from issues 1, 2 & 3 to show the level of work in the Velocity Anthology and you can read it by clicking on the "100p Preview" button below. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't afford to help us financially, please feel free to spread this campaign around as much as possible, especially if you know of any corporates or potential sponsors that'd be keen to help! We'd be eternally grateful to you. :)

story:
WHAT IS ‘HOLE IN THE EARTH’?

“Hole in the earth” is a 96 pages black and white creator owned graphic novel. It is a thriller horror comic that will both excite and scare its readers to their very core. Below is a short teaser trailer I made to give you just a taste for what is in store for you.

I’ve always been a huge fan of both Horror and Thriller movies.

“Hole in the earth” is the tail of four down and out guys with nothing to live for and nothing to lose, who decide pull one big job.

Unfortunately for them the bank robbery was the easy part.

After the successful heist and getaway the gang hold up in a small rural town to let the heat die down, but what they don’t know is Hell is coming to town. 

Even though there are no good guys in this story the characters and the situations created will put the reader in the most impossible of situations where you will route for the bad guys not to win, just survive.

 

WHO I AM?

My name is Valentin Ramon, a Spanish illustrator based in London. For the last couple of years I’ve been illustrating for different book publishers around the world, with the ambition to work for the big three. I’m constantly perfecting my craft and submitting only my best work to grab their attention.

As well as this project, I’m currently working on the nearly completed graphic novel adaption of John Saul’s Blackstone’s Chronicles for Bluewater publishing.

 

WHAT IS THE MONEY RAISED FOR?

I’m looking to raise $6000 to help self-publish this book. The money will be used to cover all printing, shipping and editing costs, because English is not my first language. The little money left from this will also help support me, so I can dedicate my time to complete this project. Currently I am spending 10 hours per day drawing, inking and lettering the Hole in the earth.

There will be two versions printed. The first version is going out to book stores, sold at conventions etc. The second is a special limited variant cover edition that will only be available to the people that support this project through Indiegogo.

 

WHAT I WILL DO MEANWHILE WAITING TO RAISE THIS MONEY

I’m going to be documenting the entire creation process of making this graphic novel on my blog, so you can all follow its progress. This will include notes, script, sketched, designs and full pages to wet your appetite. In fact you can already check the progress so far on http://valentinramon.blogspot.com/

During the money raising process I’ll be researching, reworking the script and creating the overall design of the book. There will be posts daily of my progress.

 

I APPRECIATE YOUR PATIENCE!

Due to the fact that “Hole in the earth” is a 96 pages comic compared to a regular 24 pages book, it will take me around 4 months to complete it. Because this is a long time to wait for the finished product, I’ve decided to give away some freebie now to say thank you for helping.

This can be found in the perks section and will be shipped separately from the completed books.

Some of the options include:

 

  • PDF with the first 24 pages of the graphic novel as soon as they are ready.
  • 8x11 Colour digital copies of the 50 different “Polaroid” (you can see some of these Polaroids  in the end of the promotional trailer .I will keep creating them from now till the end of the pledge and post them in my blog)
  • The original 50 B/W art of those Polaroid.

 

                                            

 Anything you give is appreciated - as every dollar pushes me toward my goal.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Angel and i draw smexy Boy's Love stories. I have always wanted to offer my readers some actual merchandise, but due to the financial issues of a starving art student, its not exactly easy to achieve that dream ;//v//;

So with this project,with the help of caring supporters, my goal is to raise just enough to print an official "KaitoShuno Extras" comic book with never before seen scenes not available anywhere online. And to maybe earn enough to even make other official merchandise!

What We Need & What You Get

Printing books is not an easy task i'll be honest, especially for Yaoi artists ;---;. People just dont seem to be fond of printing weenies. Ive managed to find a printer that can print all of the smexy goodies but at a price!

                                                    

  • Black and white books is what id be able to afford with the asking amount, buuut,
  • If we manage to somehow go well over the pledged amount, we can have beautiful full color books! 8D
  • The rest of what is made will go into funding other merchandise like keychains, stickers etc...(feel free to make suggestions for anything you'd like to see!)

     If you contribute over certain amounts, you will receive a complementary UkexPride NSFW comic not available anywhere online and even a sneak peak look at some future moments of my other comic "<3Art" (Content may contain 18+ material)


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

You can simply help by spreading the word to any smexy art enthusiasts out there! <3

story:
Short Summary

     Hello everyone. My name is Jay Mooers. I am an artist and writer. Autumn Grey is a personal project that began 10 years ago. Autumn Grey #1 was my first comic ever! Since then I've done many indie comics with various writers and artists. I also have done work for companies like Dynamite Entertainment, Living Dead Press, Belanger Books, and 5finity. 

     Autumn Grey is my personal journey as a comic writer and artist. It has grown over the years and changed along with my life in the comic industry. I'm proud to introduce issue #8 and would love for you to take the journey with me.

     The tale is about a girl named Kara Grey, who is pulled into a war hidden from people in 1990's New Hampshire between fairies and monsters. She is turned into a weapon as she falls down the proverbial rabbit hole into very dark places. By this issue, she is serving a monster known only as Simon as they terminate the creatures on his hit list. 

     The book is already complete! This is your opportunity to get into this tale, or continue the journey you're already on! Either way, I hope you enjoy what you find here.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As I stated before. This book is complete! I am only looking to acquire the expenses for printing. 
  • I am offering a few different perks including digital or physical copies of all the Autumn Grey books. All books will be signed by me. There is also going to be a special variant cover only available through this campaign! 
  • Any funds raised by this campaign will go directly to printing costs. The better this campaign does, the nicer options for printing we will have. 

The Impact

  • The indie market in comics is booming! There is unlimited potential stretching in every direction with more variety than you can imagine. I created a comic style and story here that I feel it truly unique. It's not just a comic, but really an expression of the artist and a readable work of art that continues to grow. Forget what you know about comics. This is something unique. 
  • This is the first time I'm using crowd funding for an issue of Autumn Grey. Usually I preorder through my site and make most of my sales through comic conventions. But the way the world is at this time, I needed to find other ways of promoting growth. 
  • So every dollar I make here will solely go to the printing and distribution of the comic, Autumn Grey. I hope this campaign brings Autumn Grey to more places than I ever could by traveling to comic shows. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Every backer will get a copy of this book. The only possible delay would be if printing houses were closed during the pandemic. As I've said before, this book is complete! And I have already begun working on the next issue. 
  • If my printer does shut down, and isn't able to commit to my printing, I'll find another printer.  You WILL get your books.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign. Word of mouth is the best form of advertising. If you like what you see, please tell a friend. If you think this project is up someone you know's alley, please tell them about it.
  • Don't forget that Indiegogo has its own share tools! Use them like crazy!

story:
Hey there.

I'm Dave. I tell stories. Some of you may even have read some of my stories. One of the ways I've found that I enjoy telling stories is through comics. 

These comics:

  • http://tapastic.com/series/Rainy-Days
  • http://tapastic.com/series/EVSG
  • http://tapastic.com/series/colur
  • http://tapastic.com/series/Toku
  • http://tapastic.com/series/zeroes

I begin drawing in sixth grade when I realized school was boring and I needed something to distract myself from it. Soon, I realized other people enjoyed seeing my work as much as I enjoyed making it. Sometime in high school I begin making comics. And eventually I got a real drawing tablet (pictured above). And it served me well for 8+ years making every comic and digital art piece that you've seen. But sadly, it is dying. I've worked it to death and it is slowly getting harder and harder to work with. So I need a new one, and I figured this is an excellent time for some of you to get some cool stuff while we're at it.

Stuff for Stuff

If I'm to continue making comics, I'm going to need some help. I've got some money but with the wonderful financial obligations of being a college student, I don't have enough to buy what I need. And this is where you come in.

  • I'm looking for 500 bucks. That's it. I'm aiming for the Large Wacom Intuos5 but if by some miracle we raise more money, I'll spring for a tablet with a screen. All of this in the name of bringing you more free webcomics for your enjoyment.
You're probably wondering: Dave! What do I get if I help you get a tablet (besides more comics)? Well that's a good question, person. You see, depending on how much you donate, you can get stuff. That's right stuff. Specifically this stuff:
  • $1: Eternal Gratitude
  • $5: A full-res digital file of any comic strip/page from any comic I've made. Your choice.
  • $10: A scan of a pencil sketch of any two characters you want. Doing whatever you want (with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) (no backgrounds)
  • $15: A scan of a pencil sketch any three characters you want. Doing whatever you want (with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) (no backgrounds)
  • $25: A digital drawing of any two characters you want Doing whatever you want (with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) (no backgrounds)
  • $50: A digital drawing of up to four characters you want. Doing whatever you want. (with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) (NO background)
  • $60: A digital drawing of up to four characters you want. Doing whatever you want. (with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) (background included!)
  • $100: An actual pencil drawing (up to 3 characters doing whatever you want with the exception of overly graphic or risqué content) mailed to you. Signed and stuff by the creators of the characters that you choose.
EVERY perk above $5 will include the digital file of a comic strip/page of your choice
NOTE: I reserve the right to draw what I think is appropriate. If you request a drawing I'm not comfortable with, I will contact you about it. I will do my best to draw what you want. I will get as close to what you are thinking as I can. The more description of what you want the better chance of getting the drawing the way you want it.

You might also be wondering: Dave! What if you don't reach your goal? Any money earned will be going towards the tablet. Additional money will go towards bettering the comics. Always.

    The Impact

    What? This has an impact? Well it will help me continue to bring great free content to you folks. Everyone loves free stuff right? 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute, please consider at least sharing my comics with people you know. Because that's what this is really about. Having something cool, or funny, or awesome to share with your friends. Any support will help me share my stories with you and the rest of the internet. 

      If We Succeed

      If everyone works out you all will have helped ensure I can continue to work on the comics. And if we manage to raise more money I'll be able to go for even better tablets to make the comics the best they can be.

      Depending on how things go, bonus stuff might appear. Who knows?

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN IS FOR THE COMIC BOOK. THE ABOVE VIDEO IS ABOUT OUR UPCOMING LIVE-ACTION SERIAL!

Please visit http://www.facebook.com/lunariaworld for information on both!

 If you've already donated in our previous campaign, your donation is noted and you WILL get a copy of this edition IN ADDITION to the final comic!

Short Summary

Lunaria is a comic book featuring super heroes and villains called "Daemons", who have a variety of innovative powers and abilities, living in cadence with regular citizens, vigilantes, and police. The story centers around a conflicted young woman named Lunaria, who was driven to vigilantism by childhood traumas. She soon discovers that she is a daemon, in the midst of dealing with politics, love, and intrigue.

The ongoing comic book is being written by Blake Acker ("Prowl") and is illustrated by "Lunaria" creator Brandon Scott Jensen with additional inks and colours by Jevon Campisi! This talented trio strives for the utmost quality in their work and look forward to the continuing adventures of this modern-day superhero!

The comic book series is coupled with a live action serial of the same title, featuring award winning actors and multi-internationally award winning director Brandon Scott Jensen, and featuring guest directors Craig A. Butler (The Righteous and the Wicked), Rachel Sampson, and Jessica Osbourne.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to get the comic book printed! For pre-purchasing your copy you get free shipping and can add on additional perks! This special pre-sale edition will only be available through pre-purchase and at comic conventions!

The Impact

We are creating an original and innovative comic book series and live action serial. These products are being created by absolute industry professionals, and provide a family friendly, action packed entertainment that will blow you away!

Other ways you can help

If you aren't able to help fund the project, you can still promote the project. Tell your friends, and make sure to get every issue of the comic and to see every episode of the live action! Once again, you will have our eternal gratitude for this.
 

Beyond the Comic

The comic book is only part of the action! Look for more details on the currently in production Lunaria live action serial coming soon. www.facebook.com/lunariaworld

story:
APOCALYPTO DooM vs The Great Old Ones

I am a stay at home dad, that in my spare time have written and drawn a 40 page one shot comic

This campaign will hopefully lead to printing a run of 250, as well as going towards getting more professional items so i can continue the story

Funding this campaign helps towards my dream of releasing my own comic and a story that I have great passion about

Even if you cannot fund, please visit the facebook page and spread the word if you can, as its just as important just to get people to see this

Its a fun story involving retired wrestlers and Old Gods

Its in black and white and is designed to be a throwback to low budget horror films, and is mostly dark humour and occasional violence

Its all designed to be a small A-5 book with coloured front and back

Now can do Paypal


What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal is for printing costs and more equipment
  • I would love to print 250, but with additional funding i can print more
  • Art equipment, this is all pretty much D.I.Y comic, goes towards buying a graphics tab and more
  • Being able to produce more comics and build a fnabase for them
  • Perks include a choice of 3 exclusive one of a kind T-Shirts, original artwork and exclusive portraits of you as a wrestler or Old One
  • Even if i do not reach the goal, the money will still go on printing and the perks will still be sent


What it is all about

Apocalypto Doom is a retired wrestler, getting an injury in the biggest match of his career, he now lives a life as a fast fry cook, his life is changed when an old wrestling buddy comes into his life


Now faced with becoming the key to releasing Cthulhu, he must battle to save himself and the world, what will happen when Apocalypto DooM comes out of retirement and meets Cthulhu in the ring

 

 Please visit https://www.facebook.com/ApocalyptoDooMvs?ref=hl

story:
UPDATE from Professional Creators who Believe in Our Book: 

"The subject matter is unsettling, provocative, and, like any good clown, very hard to turn away from. If you're even just a little bit twisted, you'll love this book!" -- Fabian Nicieza.

"Producing a comic requires a lot of hard work, dedication and passion--and you can see that effort in SEND IN THE CLOWNS." --Tom DeFalco.

"Simply the best clown-related anthology you will ever get to read, a truly great effort!" --Harry Markos, Founder of Markosia Enterprises

"I was really impressed with this book, tight stories and strong horror. This is the way horror should be presented. In the circus of the mind, this book is center stage!" --Rusty Gilligan
UPDATE from Chris Johnson: 
Hey, guys! First of all, I'd like to say give thanks to MilitaryJuggalos, Horror Society, Baron's Crypt, Chad at Legless Corpse, HorrorKick, The Horror Scene, MoviePilot, Wichita Falls Zombie Crawl, Decapitated Dan, Jeff and DW at FanBoysInc, and Galo and Shawn at Project-Nerd for supporting us! Your interviews and reviews, your tags and shares, your posts and promotions have helped us tremendously and EVERY Anomaly is appreciative of your unwavering support so... THANKS FOR BEING DOWN WITH OUR CLOWNS! 
This is a little about the book and who you'll be helping with your pledge and the interior books they are involved with: 
Anomalous Comics is the home to over forty indie comic artists. Writer/Letterer Chris Johnson (me) and Web Designer/Inker Fletcher Horton (my best bud!) have worked tirelessly over the past two years to lay the foundation to create quality books with plenty of help from our artist friends, whom we affectionately dub "Anomalies". 
The first book in the anthology is Whose Kill is this Anyways. It centers on a serial killing, clown-garbed psycho chasing someone through the streets of Raelo City. He's about to hone in and get his kill, but is stopped by another psycho, this one wielding a mace. Check out the cover to this eight page story below! 

The second interior book in our anthology is called Night of the Clowns. This book is about a group of carefree teenagers who have a surprise in store for the outsider they lure into their car with the promise of a ride home. Little do they know, there's a group of clowns who have a surprise for them! Check out the cover to this nine page story below! Credits for this book are as follows: Written by George Aguilar, Pencils by Mark Savona, Inks by Michael Hickmott, and Colors by Michael McElveen. Letters by me, Chris Johnson. 

The third book in our antho, Fool's Errand, features a suicidal clown becoming the unlikely hero in the face of terrifying evil. Check out the cover to this six page story below! 

The fourth book in our anthology features a different kind of clown, River Jones. This is the tragic tale of what it takes-- No, what it costs, to be a celebrity in America. Your self-worth. Your dignity. And sometimes your very soul. Check out the cover to this five page story below! 

The fifth book in our anthology features a man trying to come to grips with his abusive childhood as well as his fear of clowns by visiting a therapist and subsequently a clown academy... then a zombie outbreak occurs! Check out the cover to this six page story below! 

The eight and final story is the origin to our main character, Mr. SadFace, who appears on the front and back covers of the anthology as well as in interior pages throughout. Check out this five page story's cover below! 

You'll also be able to read the origin at the bottom of this page, but I wanted to show people more of the backbone of what was going to be inside the actual book itself. I hope you enjoyed this update. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 
END UPDATE.

Over eighty of the most talented artists in the indie comics scene have come together to bring clowns to your Halloween!

Straight from the big top, Anomalous Comics is Sending in the Clowns! Anomalous Comics presents: Send in the Clowns is a horror anthology featuring a vastly untapped horror resource: CLOWNS! 

Send in the Clowns collects some of the most horrific, macabre, and strange stories from over eighty of most talented indie creators from around the world with the singular goal of making you scream!  

This anthology will come in digital and print formats, is over 70 full-color pages in length, and features 8 chilling stories as well as covers and pin-ups from several up and coming artists in the independent comics scene! 

Chris Johnson, managing partner of Anomalous Comics and Project Manager, has united some of indie comics' best and brightest to bring you to the edge of madness and beyond!  

Send in the Clowns is already largely complete, but in order to bring you the anthology, Anomalous Comics has launched this campaign with the goal of raising money to print, market, and distribute this massive tome of terror! If we can raise at lease $1,000, we can order a small print run of books. The prints and posters are already created and ready to send out to backers. 

Check out our incredible rewards tiers and support quality independent comics production by backing our campaign! 

 Want to know more about us or our project? We'll be adding a ton of updates, including videos of us doing our thing in our various studios and pictures of the original works we'll be sending to you, the backers we're trying so hard to impress. But for now, check this out. It's a five page story from the book, called "High Strangeness", and features none other than Mr. SadFace in his origin story. 

Risks and challenges

We know there are many issues that can arise even after a project has been successfully funded. This is the reason we decided not to run this campaign until after the book was at least 80% complete, which it was at the time of the first campaign. During this sixty day campaign, we will be uploading daily updates showing you the progress of the final touches on the book, as well as updates we've compiled throughout the book's production for this specific reason. We want to show you, the backers, how a comic book like this comes together, and how it is we do what we do.

Once we receive funding, the book will already be complete. All that will be needed is to send the pages off to the printer and to mail out rewards once they arrive. The smaller print run of this book will be much easier to (and faster) to do and everyone will receive their books and merchandise within a couple months of the campaign's close. Chris Johnson has collaborated with several of his local friends and set up packing parties to mail rewards to backers in a timely and prompt manner, as well as found lots of goodies and freebies for backers to enjoy with their rewards. Several random backers will also receive free, signed posters like the ones hanging up in the video.

This is the plan, but if a setback arises, we will handle it the same way we have during the last seven months of working on this monster of a book. Together. There are over eighty of us for a reason. We are constantly helping one another out with our various projects and if for any reason the book is not finished, it will not take long to complete it and send it directly to those who deserve it. Without you, this huge book will never be printed in its entirety and we feel it is important to release this tome and these tales as one solid work of macabre art. Our last campaign went unfunded and no one got anything from us, but we wanted this one to be different. This time everyone who orders a book will receive one!

story:
UPDATE:

If you make it before the end of August, we'll include a copy of a page of the original pencil!

  • Stan Lee, Steve Ditko, and Jack Kirby don't create comics anymore.  Or do they?
  • Can we channel the spirits of the greats?
  • Get back to that love of comics you had!  When and heroes fought off great odds to rescue the helpless and mad scientists created formula x!
  • SunJay is a young man who lived in another dimension and escaped from a totalitarian world to America.  He's so thrilled at the many different ways he can run his own life, he decides to pay back the great kindness of being allowed to stay:  By becoming a hero.
  • In this first issue ever, SunJay is challenged by Sarna.   In their world, Sarna had been a demolition expert, hired to destroy the past.  Now in America, not satisfied with being free, she longs for the perks of her old life.  And she's willing to blow things up to get them.
  • Armed with his strength and good looks and the values of his father, SunJay could get her what she wants-- "everything"-- or stop her!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Only $9!  Let our stories make you feel great!  Like you're reading a real epic!
  •  These are low page rates!
  • A 32 page book.   Story by yours truly, and even pencils, coloring, type-lettering and some of the inking by myself -- Say, that is a low page rate for all that work!  Plus for my two inkers/co-collaborators!
  • The printing, on beautiful, white, quality newsprint!
  • But here's the crazy part.  We're only charging $9 per book.  (I wanted to charge $8.50, but Indiegogo isn't letting me press those keys!)
  • "What?  only $9?  But Dan!"  You say.  (And I'd say, "Where did you get that name!") "I thought you said you were asking for a hundred thousand dollars to complete this book!"  No.  You just need to recharge your hearing aid--  nothing to be embarrassed about.  I'm losing my hearing myself.  But enough about me!
  • How do we get $10,200 from $9 a book if we're only selling 400 to 500 of them?  After all, even if we sold all 500 copies, we'd only gross $4,500, less the $600 cost, netting $3,900!  THAT'S NOT $10,000!  Too true.  We're going to print anyway!
  • You have the opportunity to receive original artwork!  12X9, 16X11, 18X12 inch sizes!  Some of the original page pencils!  Some of the original inks!  Character sketches!  Concept drawings!  More work for us and more value for you! 
  • Donate by the end of August, or buy a special sketch or poster, and we'll put your name on the book's contributor page!  (If you don't want your name on there, just tell us!  Don't twist our arm!  We're not going to judge you for not wanting to be famous!)
  • Can we make up the difference that way?  Help us get there!
  • We love this story so much, even if we don't get all the gravy we want, we're still going to finish the book, get it printed and into the hot little hands of anyone who wants to read it!  Our tiniest goal is getting enough money to get it printed!

Listen-- I grew up sharing and loving my brothers' comics-- they helped me read, they gave me heroes, new ideas, and a passion for telling stories through art.

But big kids and little kids don't share comics anymore.  They're separated-- kid comics vs. adult comics, or it's teen comics or political messaging without a story or entertainment. 

Help us  get out a great story about a hero who will always be a hero, always fight for right, and have a lot of fun doing it.

  • When we reach our goal, we will start right on creating the next adventure of our hero!  And we even know what happens already!
  • Great comics bring together people of all age groups and  backgrounds, and we're dedicated to continuing that work!

 We're fast learners, a new group, and we want to entertain you.

If you buy one of our books, please let as many people as you possibly can know about us!

Something great is about to happen.

For Updates, see here, or go to https://m.facebook.com/OfficialSunjay

Armed with his strength and good looks and the values of his father, SunJay could get her what she wants-- "everything"-- or stop her!

 These are low page rates!
A 32 page book.   Story by yours truly, and even pencils, coloring, type-lettering and some of the inking by myself -- Say, that is a low page rate for all that work!  Plus for my two inkers/co-collaborators!
The printing, on beautiful, white, quality newsprint!
But here's the crazy part.  We're only charging $9 per book.  (I wanted to charge $8.50, but Indiegogo isn't letting me press those keys!)
"What?  only $9?  But Dan!"  You say.  (And I'd say, "Where did you get that name!") You have the opportunity to receive original artwork!  12X9, 16X11, 18X12 inch sizes!  Some of the original page pencils!  Some of the original inks!  Character sketches!  Concept drawings!  More work for us and more value for you! 
Donate by the end of August, or buy a special sketch or poster, and we'll put your name on the book's contributor page!  (If you don't want your name on there, just tell us!  Don't twist our arm!  We're not going to judge you for not wanting to be famous!)
Can we make up the difference that way?  Help us get there!
We love this story so much, even if we don't get all the gravy we want, we're still going to finish the book, get it printed and into the hot little hands of anyone who wants to read it!  Our tiniest goal is getting enough money to get it printed!


Listen-- I grew up sharing and loving my brothers' comics-- they helped me read, they gave me heroes, new ideas, and a passion for telling stories through art.
But big kids and little kids don't share comics anymore.  They're separated-- kid comics vs. adult comics, or it's teen comics or political messaging without a story or entertainment. 
Help us  get out a great story about a hero who will always be a hero, always fight for right, and have a lot of fun doing it.

When we reach our goal, we will start right on creating the next adventure of our hero!  And we even know what happens already!
Great comics bring together people of all age groups and  backgrounds, and we're dedicated to continuing that work!

 We're fast learners, a new group, and we want to entertain you.
If you buy one of our books, please let as many people as you possibly can know about us!
Something great is about to happen.
For Updates, see here, or go to https://m.facebook.com/OfficialSunjay

story:
My name is Mike Ciriaco. I'm a professional writer whose theatrical, comedic, and journalist credits includes LA Weekly, Frontiers, Instinct Magazine, Second City LA, Hollywood Fringe Fest, as well as the web sketch series Special Ed and Fungasm. My new comic book series HYPE marks my first dive into nerdier waters.

The series HYPE follows the children of super heroes who inherit their  parents' amazing powers, but none of the responsibility. After alien invaders viciously murder Earth's greatest heroes, the planet's only hope lies in these lazy, vapid, super powered trust fund kids.

While I am talented at writing, I'm useless as an artist, so these funds will go directly to paying a penciler, inker, and colorist to create the visual half of this comic book. Additional funds will go towards a letterer and publicity. While the book will primarily be distributed digitally via Graphation Comics, a limited edition will be printed as well.

Thank you everyone in advance for your time, support, money, and Nerdgasms xoxo

story:
Hard Exit - Issue 1 - Mature Readers Only

The new comic series by Atomic Ink Comix and in association with Dani Divine. Please note, this series is graphic in nature and deals with mature subject matter, and is intended for mature readers only. We're not saying it's going to cause nightmares...but it will probably cause nightmares. (I guess we are saying that after all)

Issue One is a 32 page, full colour, hard hitting, crime/horror thriller that puts Private Detective Dani Divine against the dark mind of a serial killer with a penchant for leaving grisly displays of his victims. 


"My father was a gentle man. For him to bring himself to punish my siblings and I he would need to put on a mask, to transform into the Preacher, the one that comes in the dark to exact punishment. With the mask on there are  no barriers, no guilt...only punishment...and pain. For what is redemption without a little pain?
                                                                                       - The Preacher           Hard Exit

He targets those he calls deviants, creatures of the night, and in his twisted mind he is 'saving' them. If they happen to endure unspeakable torture and pain in the process? 'Well, sometimes you need to break a few eggs to make an omelette don't you?'

With the police at a loss and unmotivated to solve these murders, help is sought after by Private Detective Dani Divine, a hard talking, hard hitting PI that goes above and beyond to help her clients. Now, on the trail of what appears to be a demented madman, Divine must follow her own rules and bypass conventional law enforcement to track down the killer. She's not much of a follower anyway.

Sample page for Hard Exit.

By pre-ordering your copy of Hard Exit, you will help ensure it gets made properly and in eye-catching colour as it should be. It will also allow us to print enough copies to ensure the per issue cost becomes something affordable. Oh, and all the artists involved will get paid as well. ;-)

Take a look at all the perks offered and I'm sure there is something listed that will suit your budget. From pre-ordering your 32 page copy of issue one, to our personal favorite, being drawn into the comic as a character that gets to interact with Dani.

If you can't contribute at this time even sharing this project will be a huge help to get the word out. Your support is very appreciated. 



T-shirt Perks

The special perks offered for Hard Exit Issue #1 will only be available through this 30 day Indiegogo campaign so now is the chance to reserve your copy, and help Dani chase down this sadistic killer.

This is issue #1 of a planned 4 issue series. With your support we can have all 4 created but we need your help to do so.
If you picked your perk and want to include another, or add something on, you can do so and add that you have another perk in your notes section. We will match everything up before shipping so that you get everything you picked.

From pencils, to inks, to color.

FAQ

1. Where do I add shipping?

There isn't a place for indiegogo to add shipping after the fact so we have added it to all perks. So that shipping charge is included in everything.

2. What made you decide to partner up with Dani Divine?

Basically we had this great script ready but something was missing. The main character was already a bad ass, sexy, hard as nails woman so we looked around for who represented those characteristics. Naturally, our first choice was Dani Divine and the rest is history.

3. How do the character perks work?

Simple. Once you order this perk you will be contacted by someone on the art team for Hard Exit. You will be asked to send 2-3 pictures for us to create your character that will appear in the comic. Just by looking at our main character you can see how good we are at making this happen.

4. What about these indie movie rumours?

Yes, we have been contacted about taking this from comic form to movie but creating an eye catching, hard hitting comic series is our first priority. To do that we need your help. Without your support none of this is possible.

5. Is Dani Divine really going to be at the signing party perk? Where is it going to be held and isn't she based in the UK?

Absolutely! She is working out as we speak to get her hands and arms in top strength to sign everyones copy that comes to the signing party. The party will be held in the city that has the most backers. Dani will fly in and everyone will have a fantastic day getting autographs and taking pictures.

6. I would love to help but you know...the economy and all.

Understood! It would be great if you can share this project with all your friends and family, especially on social media. Indiegogo offers a lot of ways to share projects so look for the tabs they provide and help spread the word. It's appreciated.

Any questions can also be sent to info@atomicinkcomix.com and we will do our best to answer them quickly.
story_txt:
Hard Exit - Issue 1 - Mature Readers Only   The new comic series by Atomic Ink Comix and in association with Dani Divine. Please note, this series is graphic in nature and deals with mature subject matter, and is intended for mature readers only. We're not saying it's going to cause nightmares...but it will probably cause nightmares. (I guess we are saying that after all)
Issue One is a 32 page, full colour, hard hitting, crime/horror thriller that puts Private Detective Dani Divine against the dark mind of a serial killer with a penchant for leaving grisly displays of his victims. 


"My father was a gentle man. For him to bring himself to punish my siblings and I he would need to put on a mask, to transform into the Preacher, the one that comes in the dark to exact punishment. With the mask on there are  no barriers, no guilt...only punishment...and pain. For what is redemption without a little pain?
                                                                                       - The Preacher           Hard Exit


He targets those he calls deviants, creatures of the night, and in his twisted mind he is 'saving' them. If they happen to endure unspeakable torture and pain in the process? 'Well, sometimes you need to break a few eggs to make an omelette don't you?'


With the police at a loss and unmotivated to solve these murders, help is sought after by Private Detective Dani Divine, a hard talking, hard hitting PI that goes above and beyond to help her clients. Now, on the trail of what appears to be a demented madman, Divine must follow her own rules and bypass conventional law enforcement to track down the killer. She's not much of a follower anyway.


Sample page for Hard Exit.

By pre-ordering your copy of Hard Exit, you will help ensure it gets made properly and in eye-catching colour as it should be. It will also allow us to print enough copies to ensure the per issue cost becomes something affordable. Oh, and all the artists involved will get paid as well. ;-)
Take a look at all the perks offered and I'm sure there is something listed that will suit your budget. From pre-ordering your 32 page copy of issue one, to our personal favorite, being drawn into the comic as a character that gets to interact with Dani.
If you can't contribute at this time even sharing this project will be a huge help to get the word out. Your support is very appreciated. 




T-shirt Perks






The special perks offered for Hard Exit Issue #1 will only be available through this 30 day Indiegogo campaign so now is the chance to reserve your copy, and help Dani chase down this sadistic killer.

This is issue #1 of a planned 4 issue series. With your support we can have all 4 created but we need your help to do so.
If you picked your perk and want to include another, or add something on, you can do so and add that you have another perk in your notes section. We will match everything up before shipping so that you get everything you picked.

From pencils, to inks, to color.
    FAQ
1. Where do I add shipping? There isn't a place for indiegogo to add shipping after the fact so we have added it to all perks. So that shipping charge is included in everything.
2. What made you decide to partner up with Dani Divine?
Basically we had this great script ready but something was missing. The main character was already a bad ass, sexy, hard as nails woman so we looked around for who represented those characteristics. Naturally, our first choice was Dani Divine and the rest is history.
3. How do the character perks work?
Simple. Once you order this perk you will be contacted by someone on the art team for Hard Exit. You will be asked to send 2-3 pictures for us to create your character that will appear in the comic. Just by looking at our main character you can see how good we are at making this happen.
4. What about these indie movie rumours?
Yes, we have been contacted about taking this from comic form to movie but creating an eye catching, hard hitting comic series is our first priority. To do that we need your help. Without your support none of this is possible.
5. Is Dani Divine really going to be at the signing party perk? Where is it going to be held and isn't she based in the UK?
Absolutely! She is working out as we speak to get her hands and arms in top strength to sign everyones copy that comes to the signing party. The party will be held in the city that has the most backers. Dani will fly in and everyone will have a fantastic day getting autographs and taking pictures.
6. I would love to help but you know...the economy and all.
Understood! It would be great if you can share this project with all your friends and family, especially on social media. Indiegogo offers a lot of ways to share projects so look for the tabs they provide and help spread the word. It's appreciated.
Any questions can also be sent to info@atomicinkcomix.com and we will do our best to answer them quickly.

story:
Our Story

Hey! I'm Twixx Johnson an amateur comedienne from Asbury Park, NJ. In March I will be celebrating my one yr comedy anniversary and I am still trying to learn and grow, network and get to work with various people. I was introduced to the FICA or Females In Comedy Association through a dear friend and also to the fact that they are having their First Annual Female Comedy convention. A place that is perfect for me to get the experience and support of comediennes such as myself. Ms. Hope Flood A 23 yr vet started the association to give people the opputunity and i feel that i deserve to be there but being a single mom on a fixed income, well its kinda hard to take financial leaps as great as this because my responsibilities definitely come first.


The Impact

The impact will be great on my family, friends, supporters, and my community as a whole because i get to come out and represent for us and they get to see that I am very serious about making positive examples to our children that you can be what you want to be with God, determination and hardwork. It will be an impact on me because it will prove my point that there are ppl who still care enough to support a person who has a dream and it shows that am loved and also blessed.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need it the funds to pay for the transportation, the room/board, the convention, the performer's fee and the professional attire. Its strictly for the trip not for a vacation even though i plan to enjoy every experience this trip has to offer. Here is a link for the Females in Comedy Convention site so you can see that this is very legitimate.. http://femalesincomedyconvention.hopeflood2.com/


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot financially help, there are still ways you can help.. by using your share tools(ie facebook,twitter) you can keep my campaign in rotation so that maybe some one can see who is willing to help sponsor me also visit my comedy page, https://www.facebook.com/pages/Twixx-Got-Jokes-Johnson/277460038948242 ,but make sure you keep me in your prayers and once again thank you!!

story:
Short Summary

Long story short? The comic book industry has spent almost the entire past century writing super hero comics. Now, consumers are demanding new material, and we have three stories that we want to tell that we think you'll all enjoy.

The first one is called Travelers Passed, and it's the story of how Detective Prospero Leatherby finds out he can warp reality and then spends about four years trying to get back to our version of reality once he's banished from it for breaking the rules. Also notable is his partner, Lieutenant Richard Hall, who solves murders with Prospero.

On what might seem like a lighter tone, we have a series called Orenda. It's a retelling of fairy tales, folk tales, and classical literature from across the world, but it is definitely not for kids. Orenda follows an expansive cast of characters, but for the first stretch of the comic it mostly follows two unlikely friends: Tsarevitch Ivan of Tsarevitch Ivan, the Fire Bird and the Grey Wolf and Rapunzel, of... Rapunzel... The two seem to get into quite a bit of trouble together, but unlike many fairy tales, their villains' actions can't always be fixed at the end.

Finally, we're working on a limited eight part miniseries with fourty eight pages a piece called The Final Stretch. The idea is that Order and Chaos have fought with humans since the beginning of time. Our history has been shaped by their battles, called turning points. When we jump in there are five turning points left and both sides are tied. We watch as two young Irish boys, best friends to this point, are made key players for each side.

What We Need & What You Get

So our Studio is a production studio, not a publisher, which means our startup costs are pretty cheap. What do we need to start up?
  1. We have to pay all of our business licensing fees. You know, so that we can do business with publishers and have some protection besides one person saying that they'll take care of it.
  2. A website. While we're currently working off of a Tumblr, that's ultimately not going to cut it. We've got to have a place for people to see what we do.
  3. Artists. While most of our artists work off of a royalty program, there are a few that are being used and/or considered as guest artists who will only work for page rates. So besides paying them, we want to be sure that over the four to eight month gap between submitting and getting out books out to the public our artists have some cash.
So those are the three things that we're focused on with this project.

You guys can look to the perks to see what you'll get in investing in us at each level, but some of our favorites being offered are a special edition Acrine Preview, which will include not only preview of all three series but concept art, and a special video conference where you'll get to ask us questions and we'll answer them.

The Impact

We can make comics as much as we want, and even if we have to do it on no budget we'll keep making them, because that's what we love to do. But to get these comics out to you guys, where you can read and enjoy them on a regular basis, we need your help.
We want to introduce more character driven stories to the comic book markets. Eric Stephenson said it right when he told ComicsPro this year that "new creativity that is native to comics is what makes this industry stronger," and it's our goal to add more creativity to the field.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us right now but you like our project, we'd be happy to hear from you at acrinecomics@gmail.com. Also, spreading the word about this project would be super great too. And if we succeed, we'd appreciate your support in the market, of course. But really, just letting us know you like our work and spreading the word would be great!

In The Loop

Throughout the course of this fundraiser our artists will be releasing interviews and concept art for their series. So keep in the loop by checking in regularly for updates!

story:
I have an unfortunate announcement. Due to the loss of my car I have been forced to work overtime which means I can no longer work meet my deadline.
Once the campaign is over all funders will receive a refund and a link to my website which will contain the webcomic version of this comic. Hopefully sometime later next year when I have caught up on all my bills I will have a published book for all of you to read.
Thanks again for your support. c:

 

 

 

**As an important disclaimer this is a mature rated comic. It includes themes of religion, the supernatural, sex, drug use and foul language. If this offends you then please move on. : )**

 

The Story~

Le Petit Monstre is a futurepunk/victorian/psychological horror comic about a young girl named H0n3y who sees monsters. Outcast from her family and everyday society, she only finds solace in her best friend P4n1c, an eccentric inventor and heir to a technological revolution. Before being imprisoned by an arranged marriage he swears to find a cure for her curse, a cure only found in the books that were banned 70 years ago in that very city. Things take a turn however when H0n3y encounters the peculiar yet charming Daisy, who houses an entire library of books no man has ever read before. 

But of course, Daisy isn’t what she seems, and when her desire for friendship becomes an obsession the monsters plaguing H0n3y will be the least of her worries. 

 

The Artist~

My name is Gabrielle and I have been creating art since I was a wee lass. You may have heard of me through my art username H0n3yd011. 

For years I've been writing and creating characters for stories and have planned out at least six comics, but never have I had the opportunity to actually go through with my dreams and aspirations. I grew up in a rather strict home life where my art wasn't understood. That being said I'm 98% self taught, having only taken a seven week drawing and comp class once a week. 

Earlier this year I received the exciting opportunity to intern with an indie comic book company here in central Florida. They have given me the opportunity to publish my work through their company! However I lack the funds in order to get this started. I'm so close to my dream that I can taste it, but I work two jobs just to pay my bills alone so I need help from you lovely people!

 

WHY I NEED YOU GUYS : )


I have been working on this for roughly a year now and in March the comic will be for sale at Megacon in Orlando Florida~! However I only intern and have no extra funds needed in order to publish this project! 

Your money will go to the following:

PRINTING COSTS! (The most important and expensive necessity!)

A new tablet.

Art supplies such as pencils, paper, inking pens, light box etc (being an artist is an expensive trade!)

 

By supporting me in my campaign you assisting me in realizing a life long dream of mine. Yes it's corny but I nearly tear up at the thought of having an actual physical copy of my comic in my hands. In return for funding you'll receive some awesome perks show in the sidebar as well as my eternal love and appreciation. Oh and the comic too ;)

And if you're broke like I am then please spread the word via the bookface, tweeter, tumbling and other social networks! Any signal boost is appreciated! 

Much love xoxoxo

Gabrielle 

a.k.a. H0n3yd011

story:
PUPPY RAYN AND FRIENDS

(pronounced RAIN)

 

Puppy Rayn and Friends is a comic I've been trying to get off the ground since 2000. It's about a magical puppy in a fantasy world of Knights and dragons, who lives with nice Sylphie – a dessert elf who casts spells and teaches Puppy Rayn how to use his spells, and to help others.

 

I will be posting copies of my strip in the update/gallery section over the next 30 days, as well as information from the artist(s) who wish to work with me on the project. So keep your eyes on this spot.

 

WHAT I'VE DONE

 

I've planned out the characters and a year's worth of plot while trying to solicit for syndication. In the beginning I've produced some hand made coloring books, and tested them out with some very honest kids. Their giggles told me they all seem to like Puppy Rayn. My hope is that a syndicate would be able to match me up with an artist, and through our success I would be able to use Puppy Rayn to help others through various means.

 

Unfortunately, while I've received favorable responses from one of the syndicates in some newspapers, personal notes from the editors notified me that they couldn't match me up with an artist, and to try again when I had somebody with a “more polished” look. They also expressed to me they liked the story concept, and the “fun factor”, which brings me to the following problem:

 

THE PROBLEM

 

Years of piano have made it difficult for me to draw, so I have to find an artist to help me out. Most artists that I've approached want full, up-front fees, which are a little bit out of my budget range.

 

SOLUTION

 

The solution is, I have now found a few artists who like Puppy Rayn and would like to complete the project. The project will be done in an animation style, piece-meal system. It would be where the artists draws each person's body part/moveable section seen at a different angle. These sections (eyes, mouth, head, hand, etc) are called “elements” and would total around 1400 in number in order to give me a large enough base that I can use to create comics and games. While I have convinced these artists to work for partial up-front, plus residuals, I will still need close to $1000 more than what I have right now to begin the project.

 

MY PLANS FOR PUPPY RAYN

 

My plans are simple. I wish to re-establish contact with those in the industry who liked Puppy Rayn while I use these elements to re-draft cartoons I've drawn, while creating more. I also have some computer programming friends who expressed a desire to create fun learning games, leaving me another avenue to pursue with Puppy Rayn.

 

I hope that you will read some of the comics I've completed and see what others have seen beyond my amateurish art. It's been 12 years of frustration to get this going, and I need your help.

 

 

 

WHAT YOU GET

 

  • A $5.00 donation will get a magical animal companion named after you.

  • A $15.00 donation will get a character drawn to look like you.

  • A $30.00 donation will get you an autographed copy of a Puppy Rayn picture or comic strip of your choice (good for one year in case you want to wait).

  • A $60.00 donation will get you your choice of up to $20.00 worth of Puppy Rayn merchandise (which will include mugs, t-shirts, activity and coloring books, images not available until the art work is done).

  • For a $100 donation you get to design your own Puppy Rayn character to be used as we see fit, and you will receive a signed full color picture of you with your character. (We will retain the rights and profits from the character, but you will be credited appropriately.)

 

 

Please help me make Puppy Rayn a reality!

 

 

Thank you!

 

 

Kevin Conner

story:
Allô !

Bienvenue à ma campagne Indiegogo !

Je suis Rosz, je suis actuellement finissante à l'Université du Québec en Outaouais, dans le Baccalauréat en Arts et design, concentration bande dessinée. À la fin de leur parcours universitaire, les étudiants finissants doivent réaliser un projet de fin d'études qui représente tout leurs apprentissages et leur évolution au sein de l'Université. Et je n'y échappe pas !

L'impression des projets <<synthèse>> est très important pour les étudiants finissants en bande dessinée, car ils représentent non seulement la fin de leurs études , mais il est souvent vendu à l'Exposition des finissants de l'ÉMI, dans divers festivals de bande dessinée, et il est aussi représenté en guise de portfolio pour les maisons d'éditions. 

Ainsi, je vous demande de l'aide pour m'aider à imprimer mon projet, en échange de votre don.  Si le montant est d'au moins 15$, vous aurez droit à une copie du livre!

L'intimidation est un sujet très important pour moi, et c'est pour cette raison que j'en ai fait le sujet de mon projet de fin d'études. Ayant été victime moi-même d'intimidation, je me suis basée non seulement sur les choses que j'ai vécues, mais ce que j'ai aussi entendu de mes pairs. Le secondaire a été une partie très noire de ma vie, où je me sentais perdue, et abandonnée. Je souhaiterais que Crinolines apporte de l'espoir à son lecteur, que s'il a une passion, un.e ami.e, qui lui est cher.ère, que tout ira bien et pour le mieux. 

Sur ce, si vous avez envie de m'encourager moi, ou le projet Crinolines, je serais éternellement reconnaissante de vos dons, peut importe de sa valeur ! Non seulement vous contribuer à l'impression de ce projet, mais également au début de la carrière de mes rêves; auteure de bande dessinée.

Gros câlins,

- Rosz

 

Objectif de la campagne Indiegogo : 

  • J'aimerais amasser 500$ pour imprimer au moins 50 copies de mon projet.
  • Idéalement, je dois avoir réussi au moins 50% de mon objectif pour le 25 mars 2019 (date au quel j'enverrais mon projet à l'imprimeur).
  • Le lancement aura lieu le jeudi 18 avril 2019, à l'Université du Québec en Outaouais, dans le cadre de l'Évènement des finissants de l'ÉMI. 
  • Tous les participants de la campagne qui fait un don d'au moins de 15$, aura droit à sa copie de Crinolines.

story:
Campaign Summary

Arley Owens, President and Founder of Earth Team Green Inc., is a futures thinking individual in matters related to educating our youth on environmental issues.       Earth Team Green's overarching goal is to introduce our Environmental Edutainment System titled,“The Art and Science of Getting Green,”that includes our signature Eco-Thriller Comic Book series aptly titled “Earth Team Green,”  to 5th Grade Students across America. 


Today we're seeking funds to assist with the costs of employing a new lead comic book artist and printing sufficient copies of Earth Team Green's Issue 8 for distribution to 5th Graders at Cedarwood Alternative Elementary School, located in Columbus, Ohio. Cedarwood Alternative Elementary School will be the sixth school district we've introduced our "Eco-Thriller Comic Books In The Classroom" initiative. Here's where we've been: Elgin, Illinois, Century Oaks Elementary School, Reynoldsburg, Ohio, Hannah Ashton Middle School, Mansfield, Ohio, Malabar and Hedges Middle Schools, Brilliant, Ohio, Buckeye North Elementary School. Working with the "Next Generation" (5th Graders) is near and dear to my heart. They are the future and we need to show them how to protect and respect the environment. 

Earth Team Green's slogan is, "We Touch The Future" which simply means we help our youth understand the importance of caring for our planet today to ensure our  natural resources and needs of future generations will be sustained.

You to can "Touch The Future" when you support our campaign. By giving at any level you'll ensure the 5th Grade students of Cedarwood Alternative Elementary School  will have the opportunity to learn more about the environment through the readings of our Eco-Thriller Comic Books and in class room activities.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding to cover the costs of employing a new lead artist and to help pay for the printing of Issue 8. .
  • For your generous contribution you may, depending on your level of generosity for our cause; receive recognition and praise, virtual hugs and kisses and Earth Team Green stuff to include signed Earth Team Green posters, copies of your choice of any Issue of Earth Team Green Eco-Thriller Comic Books, a limited collector's edition set of our Eco-Thriller Comics and more! 
  • Hopefully we will reach and exceed our goal if we fall a tad short we use the funds to print Issue 8 and help pay for an artist. We will find a way!
  • When we meet and surpass our goal any  additional funds will be rolled back into the printing of more comic books for schools.

Our  Impact

Earth Team Green Is more than a comic book series... It's a bold new Environmental Edutainment System designed to reach and teach the next generation how to protect and respect the environment and each other. Over two thousand students have been exposed to our Earth Team Green's Environmental Edutainment System, (The Art & Science of Getting Green) and our Eco-Thriller comic books. At last report not one student or their teachers have recovered from the positive message spread by the inspired works of Earth Team Green. The students and teachers are all doing their part to help protect the planet from Land, Air and Water Pollution.                                                                                                                    EARTH TEAM GREEN SCHOOL TESTED MOVIE READY!


Risks & Challenges

Earth Team Green Inc. is a registered business with the State of Ohio and has been in existence since 2005. The President and Founder, Arley Owens, has worked with schools, community groups, businesses and national organizations such as the National Recycling Coalition, NIKE, American Beverage Corporation, Ohio Zoos,Public Housing Authorities, Keep America Beautiful Inc. and the Steel Recycling Institute on environmentally focused initiatives for over twenty years. Arley presently is the Board Chair for RecycleForce Columbus' Board of Directors and is an active member of the Association of Ohio Recyclers and the National Recycling Coalition. Keeping these traits in mind about Arley one would have to conclude that donating to Earth Team Green's campaign is a safe investment and a fun way to help 5th Graders learn more about the environment.

The challenges Earth Team Green faces are minimal because we're geared up to work with Cedarwood Alternative Elementary School. We have 100% support from the school's principal and have volunteers from Ohio State University's Net Impact Group who will be involved along with other community focused organizations.

    How You Can Help In Other Ways

    We understand if you are unable to make a monetary contribution however you're still important to us and our campaign. Just tell seven of your friends, family or colleagues about Earth Team Green's Campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools and also remember to Reduce-Reuse and Recycle!

    WE THANK YOU

story:
UPDATE:

2/13/2014 - We have enough money for the books, the shirts, the buttons and all that. Way more than enough, in fact. I am placing an order for books and buttons today! I will be requesting shirt sizes as the end date closes in. If you’d like to go ahead and do that for me, email rorymorriscomics at gmail dot com. If you are a potential backer interested in backing at this point, know that the project will still proceed regardless of whether or not we meet the 8,000 goal.

Short Summary

WOLFEN JUMP is a print anthology featuring the work of 24 artists. 

WOLFEN JUMP began as an online anthology, and will remain freely available to read on its home portal at wolfenjump.com, the index of artists can be found here - those included in the print edition can be seen here! With our full color print anthology, we strive to bring the same level of quality!

But enough gushing, onto the goodies!

What We Need & What You Get

A 500-book print run, shipping, and compensation for all artists involved! In exchange for funding all these things, you could have any one of these lovely packages:

(cover art by Emily Partridge!)

(button designs by Jen Lee!)

(shirt design by Sloane Leong!)


(original pen and marker drawing by Rory Morris!)

OMEGA LEVEL PERK – JUST THE BOOK!

BETA LEVEL PERK – BOOK AND BUTTON SET!

ALPHA LEVEL PERK – BOOK, BUTTON SET AND SHIRT!

SUPER ALPHA LEVEL PERK - BOOK, BUTTON SET, SHIRT, AND A SKETCH BY ONE OF THE ARTISTS OF YOU AS A MEAN WALF!! RAR!!!

LONE WOLF PERK - ALL THAT STUFF, PLUS THE ORIGINAL "WALF PARTY" DRAWING, AS SEEN ABOVE! (9x12, pens and markers, by Rory)

(credits for assets:

http://puppytube.tumblr.com

http://empartridge.tumblr.com

http://repoghost.com

http://sloanesloane.com )
